original: bam po dang po /

analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo //

original: gang la blo mnga' rtogs par bya ba ma rtogs med //
analyzed: gang la blo mnga' rtogs par bya ba ma rtogs med //

original: gang la dag mnga' phyi nas rnam par sbyang bya med //
analyzed: gang la dag mnga' phyi nas rnam par sbyang bya med //

original: de ni 'jig rten mgon te 'jig rten mthar 'byin pa //
analyzed: de ni 'jig rten mgon te 'jig rten mthar 'byin pa //
translated: They are the protectors of the world, the ones who end the world.

original: skye dgu rnams kyi gtso la spyi pos phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: skye dgu rnams kyi gtso la spyi pos phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: I pay homage to the head of all beings.

original: chos kyang de dag nyid kyis ji bzhin bstan pa ni //
analyzed: chos kyang de dag nyid kyis ji bzhin bstan pa ni //
translated: The Dharma is also taught by them as it is,

original: zhi ba'i gnas dang lam dang lam gyi ched du byas //
analyzed: zhi ba'i gnas dang lam dang lam gyi ched du byas //
translated: For the sake of the path and the state of peace.

original: gang zhig rab tu rtogs pas sa gsum 'di dag tu //
analyzed: gang zhig rab tu rtogs pas sa gsum 'di dag tu //
translated: By fully realizing these three worlds,

original: 'khor lo bzhin du 'gro ba 'di dag 'khor ba med //
analyzed: 'khor lo bzhin du 'gro ba 'di dag 'khor ba med //
translated: These beings revolve like a wheel.

original: chos de dag la gnas pa'i 'phags pa'i dge 'dun ni //
analyzed: chos de dag la gnas pa'i 'phags pa'i dge 'dun ni //
translated: The noble community of those who abide in those teachings.

original: chags dang tshogs dag las ni shin tu 'das gyur nas //
analyzed: chags dang tshogs dag las ni shin tu 'das gyur nas //
translated: Having completely transcended attachment and the assemblies,

original: yan lag bcu dang yan lag brgyad dang dbye ba brgyad //
analyzed: yan lag bcu dang yan lag brgyad dang dbye ba brgyad //
translated: with ten and eight limbs, divided into eight.

original: lam gyi 'bras bu 'bras bus kyang ni de dag rnams //
analyzed: lam gyi 'bras bu 'bras bus kyang ni de dag rnams //
translated: The result of the path, and also by the result, those

original: 'di dag gi 'grel pa ni mdo'i don bshad pa rtsom pa'i tshe phyis bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di dag gi 'grel pa ni mdo'i don bshad pa rtsom pa'i tshe phyis bshad par bya'o //
translated: The commentary on these will be explained later when composing the explanation of the meaning of the sutra.

original: dkon mchog gsum la mchod par brjod pa ni bstod pa dang phyag 'tshal ba yin no //
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum la mchod par brjod pa ni bstod pa dang phyag 'tshal ba yin no //
translated: The expression of worship to the Three Jewels is praise and prostration.

original: de yang ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: ston pa po dang bstan pa dang slob ma'i yon tan phun sum tshogs pa brjod pas /
analyzed: ston pa po dang bstan pa dang slob ma'i yon tan phun sum tshogs pa brjod pas /
translated: By expressing the perfect qualities of the teacher, the teaching, and the disciples,

original: mdo sde 'di la gus pa'i khyad par bskyed pa'i phyir dang / kha cig dag la de bstan pa byas pa dang / de la zhugs pa dang de la brten pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mdo sde 'di la gus pa'i khyad par bskyed pa'i phyir dang / kha cig dag la de bstan pa byas pa dang / de la zhugs pa dang de la brten pa'i phyir te /
translated: it generates a special respect for this sutra, and because some have been taught that, have entered that, and rely on that.

original: 'dir tshigs su bcad pas dkon mchog gsum la mchod pa brjod pa'i sgo nas gleng bslang ba yin no zhes 'brel pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dir tshigs su bcad pas dkon mchog gsum la mchod pa brjod pa'i sgo nas gleng bslang ba yin no zhes 'brel pa bstan to //
translated: Here, the connection is taught: ‚ÄúThe introduction is by way of the praise of worship of the Three Jewels in the verse.‚Äù

original: mchod pa brjod pa yang mdo sde 'di la gus pa'i khyad par bskyed pa'i phyir dang / kha cig dag la zhes smos pa yin pa'i phyir dgos pa dang bcas pa yin par bstan to //
analyzed: mchod pa brjod pa yang mdo sde 'di la gus pa'i khyad par bskyed pa'i phyir dang / kha cig dag la zhes smos pa yin pa'i phyir dgos pa dang bcas pa yin par bstan to //
translated: The praise of worship is taught to have a purpose, because it generates a special respect for this Sutra, and because it is stated for some.

original: gus pa'i khyad par bskyed pa yang gus pas mnyan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gus pa'i khyad par bskyed pa yang gus pas mnyan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The generation of a special respect is for the sake of listening with respect.

original: gus pas mnyan pa yang phyin ci ma log par gzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gus pas mnyan pa yang phyin ci ma log par gzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Listening with respect is for the sake of unmistaken retention.

original: phyin ci ma log par don bzung ba yang mnyan pa dang / bsam pa dang / bsgom pa'i rim pa dang / mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i rim gyis mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyin ci ma log par don bzung ba yang mnyan pa dang / bsam pa dang / bsgom pa'i rim pa dang / mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i rim gyis mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Unmistaken retention of the meaning is for the sake of abandoning the afflictions abandoned by the paths of seeing and cultivation, through the paths of seeing and cultivation, by way of the stages of listening, reflection, and cultivation.

original: kha cig dag la zhes smos pa ni skyob pa rab tu grub pa'i gang zag bye brag tu bya ba'i phyir ro //üîΩde bstan @62a * //
analyzed: kha cig dag la zhes smos pa ni skyob pa rab tu grub pa'i gang zag bye brag tu bya ba'i phyir ro // de bstan @62a * //
translated: The phrase to some is used to specify the person who is fully accomplished as a protector.

original: pa byas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni de bstan pa byas pa nye bar len pa zhes bya ba'i don gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: pa byas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni de bstan pa byas pa nye bar len pa zhes bya ba'i don gang yin pa ste /
translated: The phrase who have been taught by him refers to the meaning of the term appropriated in the expression appropriated aggregates.

original: bstan pa byas pa ni bstan zin pa dang don mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bstan pa byas pa ni bstan zin pa dang don mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The term taught means that they have been taught and are consistent with the meaning.

original: de la zhugs ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mdo sde 'di la bstan cing bslabs pa'i nang du chud pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la zhugs ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mdo sde 'di la bstan cing bslabs pa'i nang du chud pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase who have entered into that teaching means that they have entered into the teaching and training that is presented in this sutra.

original: de la brten pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni slob ma bsten pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba'i don gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: de la brten pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni slob ma bsten pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba'i don gang yin pa ste /
translated: The phrase who rely upon that refers to the meaning of the term who rely upon a teacher.

original: bstan pa ni goms par byed pa'i don yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bstan pa ni goms par byed pa'i don yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The term taught means that they have been made familiar with.

original: 'di ltar sangs rgyas kyi slob ma rnams mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'bras bu don du gnyer ba'i phyir chos kyi rnam grangs 'di la bstan pa ni mnyan pa dang / bsam pa dang / bsgom pa'i tshul gyis bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar sangs rgyas kyi slob ma rnams mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'bras bu don du gnyer ba'i phyir chos kyi rnam grangs 'di la bstan pa ni mnyan pa dang / bsam pa dang / bsgom pa'i tshul gyis bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, this Dharma discourse is taught for the disciples of the Buddha who seek the fruit of nirvana, by way of listening, reflection, and meditation.

original: de la sangs rgyas la bstod pas ni yon tan phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa lnga bstan te /
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas la bstod pas ni yon tan phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa lnga bstan te /
translated: Therein, the praise of the Buddha reveals the fivefold excellence of his qualities.

original: gang la blo mnga' rtogs par bya ba ma rtogs med //
analyzed: gang la blo mnga' rtogs par bya ba ma rtogs med //
translated: The line ‚Äúthere is nothing not realized for those who have the intelligence‚Äù

original: ces bya ba'i tshig gis ni ye shes phun sum tshogs pa bstan te /
analyzed: ces bya ba'i tshig gis ni ye shes phun sum tshogs pa bstan te /
translated: reveals the excellence of his wisdom.

original: shes bya thams cad la thogs pa mi mnga' ba'i ye shes yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgang la dag mnga' phyi nas rnam par sbyang bya med //
analyzed: shes bya thams cad la thogs pa mi mnga' ba'i ye shes yin pa'i phyir ro // gang la dag mnga' phyi nas rnam par sbyang bya med //
translated: It is the wisdom that is unobstructed with regard to all objects of knowledge.üîΩThe line ‚Äúthere is nothing pure for those who have purity that is not purified later‚Äù

original: ces bya ba'i tshig gis ni spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa yin te /
analyzed: ces bya ba'i tshig gis ni spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa yin te /
translated: reveals the excellence of his abandonment.

original: bag la nyal dang nyon mongs pa'i phra rgyas thams cad spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bag la nyal dang nyon mongs pa'i phra rgyas thams cad spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is because he has abandoned all latent tendencies and the subtle afflictions.

original: de ni 'jig rten mgon te zhes bya ba 'dis ni thugs rje phun sum tshogs pa yin te //
analyzed: de ni 'jig rten mgon te zhes bya ba 'dis ni thugs rje phun sum tshogs pa yin te //
translated: This is the abundance of compassion.

original: 'jig rten 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal thams cad las yongs su skyob par mdzad pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal thams cad las yongs su skyob par mdzad pa'i phyir te /
translated: He is the protector of the world, because he protects the world from all the sufferings of cyclic existence.

original: thugs rje can ni 'jig rten pa'i mgon du gyur pa yin no //üîΩ'jig rten mthar 'byin pa zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis ni mi zad pa phun sum tshogs pa yin te /
analyzed: thugs rje can ni 'jig rten pa'i mgon du gyur pa yin no // 'jig rten mthar 'byin pa zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis ni mi zad pa phun sum tshogs pa yin te /
translated: The compassionate one is the protector of the world.

original: 'jig rten gyi mtha' gtugs par bzhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi mtha' gtugs par bzhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is the abundance of inexhaustibility, because he remains until the end of the world.

original: 'jig rten mthar phyin pa zhes bya ba'i sgras 'dir 'jig rten gyi mtha' gtugs par bstan pa yin gyi 'jig rten gyi mchog la bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'jig rten mthar phyin pa zhes bya ba'i sgras 'dir 'jig rten gyi mtha' gtugs par bstan pa yin gyi 'jig rten gyi mchog la bya ba ma yin te /
translated: The term ‚Äúend of the world‚Äù indicates the end of the world here, not the highest point of the world.

original: gang gis 'jig rten mthar 'byin pa de 'jig rten mthar 'byin pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gang gis 'jig rten mthar 'byin pa de 'jig rten mthar 'byin pa zhes bya ste /
translated: He who brings the world to an end is called the ‚Äúend of the world.‚Äù

original: mtha'i sgra ni 'dir gzhi la sgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: mtha'i sgra ni 'dir gzhi la sgrub pa yin no //
translated: The term ‚Äúend‚Äù is established here as a basis.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mi dge ba dang sdig pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mi dge ba dang sdig pa med pa yin no //
translated: For this very reason, he is without nonvirtue and without sin.

original: gzhan du na ni 'jig rten mthar phyin pa zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na ni 'jig rten mthar phyin pa zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would be explained that the world has an end.

original: skye dgu rnams kyi gtso zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis ni mtshungs pa med pa phun sum tshogs pa yin te /
analyzed: skye dgu rnams kyi gtso zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis ni mtshungs pa med pa phun sum tshogs pa yin te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúchief of beings‚Äù indicates the perfection of being incomparable,

original: sems can thams cad pas mchog tu gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can thams cad pas mchog tu gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he is superior to all sentient beings.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: yon tan phun sum tshogs pa dang skyes @62b bu chen po'i dngos po phun sum tshogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: yon tan phun sum tshogs pa dang skyes @62b bu chen po'i dngos po phun sum tshogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Because of the perfection of good qualities and the perfection of the state of a great being.

original: de la ye shes phun sum tshogs pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de la ye shes phun sum tshogs pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The perfection of knowledge is fourfold:

original: thams cad mkhyen pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa dang / ma bstan pa mkhyen pa dang / 'bad pa med par mkhyen pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa dang / ma bstan pa mkhyen pa dang / 'bad pa med par mkhyen pa'o //
translated: knowledge of everything, knowledge of all modes, knowledge of what is not taught, and effortless knowledge.

original: de la thams cad mkhyen pa ni shes bya mtha' yas pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid rtogs pa'i don gyis rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la thams cad mkhyen pa ni shes bya mtha' yas pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid rtogs pa'i don gyis rig par bya'o //
translated: Knowledge of everything should be understood as the realization of the infinite specific characteristics of objects of knowledge.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i rgyu dang 'gro ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa dang / dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / kun 'byung ba dang /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i rgyu dang 'gro ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa dang / dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / kun 'byung ba dang /
translated: It is the cause of omniscience, it is concomitant with migrating beings and not concomitant with them, it is virtuous, nonvirtuous and neutral, it is suffering, origin,üîΩ

original: 'gog pa dang / lam dang / mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang par bya ba dang / thogs pa dang bcas pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa thugs su chud pa'i don gyis yin no //
analyzed: 'gog pa dang / lam dang / mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang par bya ba dang / thogs pa dang bcas pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa thugs su chud pa'i don gyis yin no //
translated: It is the cause of omniscience, and it is the cause of the world, and it is associated with the world, and it is not associated with the world, and it is virtuous, and it is nonvirtuous, and it is neutral, and it is suffering, and it is origin, and it is cessation, and it is the path, and it is to be abandoned by seeing and cultivation, and it is impeded, and so on.üîΩIt is omniscience in the sense of understanding these aspects.

original: ma bstan par mkhyen pa ni rang nyid kyis mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i don gyis yin no //
analyzed: ma bstan par mkhyen pa ni rang nyid kyis mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i don gyis yin no //
translated: It is non-teaching omniscience in the sense of self-enlightenment.

original: 'bad pa med par mkhyen pa ni rtsol ba mi mnga' ba nyid kyi phyir te /
analyzed: 'bad pa med par mkhyen pa ni rtsol ba mi mnga' ba nyid kyi phyir te /
translated: It is effortless omniscience because it is not subject to exertion.

original: bzhed pa tsam la rag lus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bzhed pa tsam la rag lus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is dependent on mere intention.

original: de la ye shes phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa gsum ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang thun mong ma yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la ye shes phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa gsum ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang thun mong ma yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: The three perfections of knowledge are to be understood as not shared in common with the sravakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: 'di ltar nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas ni thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin /
analyzed: 'di ltar nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas ni thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin /
translated: Thus, the sravakas and pratyekabuddhas are not omniscient,

original: rnam pa thams cad shes pa ma yin ;
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad shes pa ma yin ;
translated: they do not know all modes,

original: 'bad pa med par shes pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'bad pa med par shes pa ma yin no //
translated: and they do not know effortlessly.

original: ma bstan par mkhyen pa phun sum tshogs pa ni nyan thos kho na dang thun mong ma yin pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: ma bstan par mkhyen pa phun sum tshogs pa ni nyan thos kho na dang thun mong ma yin pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The perfection of knowledge without teaching is to be understood as not shared in common with the sravakas.

original: de ltar byas na nyan thos ni thams cad shes pa ma yin /
analyzed: de ltar byas na nyan thos ni thams cad shes pa ma yin /
translated: Thus, the sravakas do not know all,

original: rnam pa thams cad shes pa ma yin 'bad pa med pa ma yin /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad shes pa ma yin 'bad pa med pa ma yin /
translated: they do not know all modes, they do not know effortlessly,

original: ma bstan par ma yin no//
analyzed: ma bstan par ma yin no//
translated: and they do not know without teaching.

original: rang sangs rgyas ni thams cad shes pa ma yin /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas ni thams cad shes pa ma yin /
translated: The pratyekabuddhas do not know all,

original: rnam pa thams cad shes pa ma yin /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad shes pa ma yin /
translated: they do not know all modes,

original: 'bad pa med par ma yin no //
analyzed: 'bad pa med par ma yin no //
translated: and they do not know effortlessly.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni thams cad mkhyen pa yin /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni thams cad mkhyen pa yin /
translated: The Lord Buddha is omniscient,

original: rnam pa thams cad dang / ma bstan pa dang / 'bad pa med par yang mkhyen pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad dang / ma bstan pa dang / 'bad pa med par yang mkhyen pa yin no //
translated: He knows all aspects, the unknown, and without exertion.

original: de nyid kyi phyir thogs pa med pa'i don gyis ye shes stobs can ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir thogs pa med pa'i don gyis ye shes stobs can ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of ‚Äúunimpeded‚Äù is that the Buddha BhagavƒÅn has the power of knowledge.

original: de yang dmigs pa'i bye brag gis ni stobs bcu yin te /üîΩgnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / las kyi rnam par smin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / bsam gtan dang rnam par thar pa dang / ting @63a * //
analyzed: de yang dmigs pa'i bye brag gis ni stobs bcu yin te / gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / las kyi rnam par smin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / bsam gtan dang rnam par thar pa dang / ting @63a * //
translated: Moreover, the ten powers are distinguished by their objects.üîΩThe power of knowledge of the possible and impossible, the power of knowledge of the maturation of actions, the power of knowledge of the absorptions, deliverances, concentrations, and attainments,

original: de 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / dbang po mchog dang / mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / mos pa sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang /
analyzed: de 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / dbang po mchog dang / mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / mos pa sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang /
translated: the power of knowledge of superior and nonsuperior faculties, the power of knowledge of various resolves, the power of knowledge of various elements, the power of knowledge of the paths going everywhere, the power of knowledge of recollection of former existences,

original: 'chi 'pho dang skye ba mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i stobs te 'jigs pa mi mnga' ba'i don gyis na chos thams cad mngon bar rdzogs par byang chub pa la mi 'jigs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'chi 'pho dang skye ba mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i stobs te 'jigs pa mi mnga' ba'i don gyis na chos thams cad mngon bar rdzogs par byang chub pa la mi 'jigs pa yin te /
translated: The power of knowledge of the exhaustion of contaminants is the fearlessness of fully knowing all the methods of liberation.

original: stobs rnam par spros pa ni mdo sde'i rgyud las ji lta ba bzhin du khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: stobs rnam par spros pa ni mdo sde'i rgyud las ji lta ba bzhin du khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: The elaboration of the powers should be understood according to the sutras.

original: spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The perfection of abandonment is also fourfold:

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa dang / gtan du spangs pa dang / bag la nyal dang bcas te spangs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgrib ba thams cad spangs pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa dang / gtan du spangs pa dang / bag la nyal dang bcas te spangs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgrib ba thams cad spangs pa'o //
translated: abandonment of all the defilements, abandonment forever, abandonment together with the latent tendencies, and abandonment of all obscurations to meditative concentration and meditative attainment.

original: de la nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa thams cad spangs pa ni mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mangs pa spangs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa thams cad spangs pa ni mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mangs pa spangs par rig par bya'o //
translated: Abandonment of all the defilements should be understood as the abandonment of the defilements that are to be abandoned by the paths of seeing and meditation.

original: gtan du spangs pa ni yongs su mi nyams pa yin te /
analyzed: gtan du spangs pa ni yongs su mi nyams pa yin te /
translated: Abandonment forever is complete non-regression.

original: ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong dag de ni gang 'phags pa'i shes rab kyis yongs su spangs pa yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong dag de ni gang 'phags pa'i shes rab kyis yongs su spangs pa yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: As the Lord has said, ‚ÄúMonks, that is completely abandoned by the noble wisdom.‚Äù

original: 'di nyid tshig gi rgyan gyi sgo nas gnas brtan rta dbyangs kyis kyang /
analyzed: 'di nyid tshig gi rgyan gyi sgo nas gnas brtan rta dbyangs kyis kyang /
translated: The Elder A≈õvagho·π£a has also said this in the form of a verse ornament:

original: sa ni bsregs na'ang de nas yang yang skye //
analyzed: sa ni bsregs na'ang de nas yang yang skye //
translated: Even if the earth is burned, it will grow again.

original: shing ni bcad na yang lo ma skye bar 'gyur //
analyzed: shing ni bcad na yang lo ma skye bar 'gyur //
translated: Even if a tree is cut down, it will grow leaves again.

original: chu ni skams na'ang klung ni 'bab 'gyur gyi //üîΩshes rab mtshon gyis khyod skyon bcad 'byung med //
analyzed: chu ni skams na'ang klung ni 'bab 'gyur gyi // shes rab mtshon gyis khyod skyon bcad 'byung med //
translated: Even if the water is drunk, the river will flow again.

original: ces smras so //
analyzed: ces smras so //
translated: But when you are cut by the weapon of wisdom, there is no regeneration.

original: bag chags dang bcas te spangs pa ni nyon mongs pa'i bya ba byed pa rjes su 'jug pa'i 'du byed spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bag chags dang bcas te spangs pa ni nyon mongs pa'i bya ba byed pa rjes su 'jug pa'i 'du byed spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Abandonment together with the instinct is because the instinct that causes the afflicted action to occur is abandoned.

original: ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgrib pa thams cad spangs pa ni yon tan khyad par can ma lus pa mngon par bsgrub pa'i gegs su gyur pa ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgrib pa thams cad spangs pa ni yon tan khyad par can ma lus pa mngon par bsgrub pa'i gegs su gyur pa ste /
translated: The abandonment of all obscurations to concentration and meditative attainment is the obstacle to the full accomplishment of all special qualities.

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang mi shes pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang mi shes pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the abandonment of secondary afflictions and ignorance.

original: 'dir mu bzhir 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dir mu bzhir 'gyur te /
translated: Here there are four possibilities:

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs la gtan du spangs pa ma yin pa yang yod de //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs la gtan du spangs pa ma yin pa yang yod de //
translated: There is the abandonment of all afflictions but not their permanent abandonment,

original: dper na yongs su nyams pa'i chos nyan gyi dgra bcom pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na yongs su nyams pa'i chos nyan gyi dgra bcom pa lta bu'o //
translated: like the arhat who is subject to complete degeneration.

original: gtan du spangs ba yin la nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa ma yin pa yang yod de /
analyzed: gtan du spangs ba yin la nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa ma yin pa yang yod de /
translated: There is the permanent abandonment of the afflictions but not the abandonment of all afflictions,

original: dper na thog ma'i 'bras bus bsdus pa'i spangs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na thog ma'i 'bras bus bsdus pa'i spangs pa lta bu'o //
translated: like the abandonment subsumed by the first result.

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa gtan du spangs pa yin pa yang yod de /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa gtan du spangs pa yin pa yang yod de /
translated: There is the abandonment of all afflictions and their permanent abandonment,

original: @63b dper na mi 'khrugs pa'i chos can gyi lta bu'o //
analyzed: @63b dper na mi 'khrugs pa'i chos can gyi lta bu'o //
translated: like the arhat who is not subject to degeneration.üîΩThere is neither the abandonment of all afflictions nor their permanent abandonment,üîΩlike the abandonment of the first result by the arhat who is subject to complete degeneration.

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa ma yin gtan du spangs pa ma yin pa yang yod de /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa ma yin gtan du spangs pa ma yin pa yang yod de /
translated: There is no abandonment of all afflictions and no permanent abandonment.

original: dper na 'jig rten pa'i spangs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na 'jig rten pa'i spangs pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like the abandonment of mundane beings.

original: re zhig gang nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa yin la bag chags dang bcas te spangs pa ma yin pa yang yod de /
analyzed: re zhig gang nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa yin la bag chags dang bcas te spangs pa ma yin pa yang yod de /
translated: There is abandonment of all afflictions but not abandonment together with their imprints.

original: dper na dgra bcom pa dang rang sangs rgyas kyi lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na dgra bcom pa dang rang sangs rgyas kyi lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like the abandonment of arhats and pratyekabuddhas.

original: de bzhin du gang bag chags dang bcas te spangs pa dang / gtan du spangs pa yang de yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du gang bag chags dang bcas te spangs pa dang / gtan du spangs pa yang de yin te /
translated: Similarly, there is abandonment together with their imprints and permanent abandonment.

original: dper na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like the abandonment of the Bhagavan Buddha.

original: gtan du spangs pa yin la /
analyzed: gtan du spangs pa yin la /
translated: There is permanent abandonment but not abandonment together with their imprints.

original: bag chags dang bcas te spangs pa ma yin pa ni dper na mi 'khrugs pa'i chos can dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi lta bu'o //
analyzed: bag chags dang bcas te spangs pa ma yin pa ni dper na mi 'khrugs pa'i chos can dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like the abandonment of those who are unshakable and pratyekabuddhas.

original: gang ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgrib pa thams cad spangs pa dang / nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa dang / gtan du spangs pa dang / bag chags dang bcas te spangs pa yang de yin pa ni /
analyzed: gang ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgrib pa thams cad spangs pa dang / nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa dang / gtan du spangs pa dang / bag chags dang bcas te spangs pa yang de yin pa ni /
translated: That is the abandonment of all obscurations of meditative concentration and meditative attainment, the abandonment of all afflictions, the abandonment of them permanently, and the abandonment of them together with their latent impressions.

original: dper na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi lta bu'o ;
analyzed: dper na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi lta bu'o ;
translated: For example, it is like the Blessed Buddha.

original: / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dag la ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgrib pa ma lus par yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dag la ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgrib pa ma lus par yod pa ma yin te /
translated: ≈örƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas do not have all the obscurations of meditative concentration and meditative attainment.

original: sangs rgyas kyi ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa ma thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa ma thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they have not attained the meditative concentration and meditative attainment of a buddha.

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs la gtan du spangs pa yin yang ting nge 'dzin dan snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgrib pa thams cad spangs pa ma yin pa yang yod de /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs la gtan du spangs pa yin yang ting nge 'dzin dan snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgrib pa thams cad spangs pa ma yin pa yang yod de /
translated: There are those who have abandoned all afflictions but have not abandoned all the obscurations of meditative concentration and meditative attainment.

original: dper na mi 'khrugs pa'i chos can dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na mi 'khrugs pa'i chos can dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like the one of unshakable nature and the pratyekabuddha.

original: gang bag chags dang bcas te spangs la snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgrib pa spangs pa yang de yin pa ni sangs rgyas kho na yin te de la mnga' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang bag chags dang bcas te spangs la snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgrib pa spangs pa yang de yin pa ni sangs rgyas kho na yin te de la mnga' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The Buddha alone is the one who has abandoned the obscurations of meditative concentration and meditative attainment together with their traces, because he has mastery over them.

original: spangs pa rnams bsdoms nas de skad smras pa yin gyi /
analyzed: spangs pa rnams bsdoms nas de skad smras pa yin gyi /
translated: It is said in this way by combining the abandonments.

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa yang gzhan yin la /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa yang gzhan yin la /
translated: There is one who has abandoned all the afflictions,

original: ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgrib pa thams cad spangs pa yang gzhan yin no //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgrib pa thams cad spangs pa yang gzhan yin no //
translated: and there is another who has abandoned all the obscurations of meditative concentration and meditative attainment.

original: de ltar byas na nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas gnyis la ni nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa yang yod gtan du spangs pa yang yod mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar byas na nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas gnyis la ni nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa yang yod gtan du spangs pa yang yod mod kyi /
translated: If this is so, then the ≈õrƒÅvaka and the pratyekabuddha do have the abandonment of all the afflictions, and they do have the abandonment of the afflictions forever.

original: bag chags dang bcas te spangs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgrib pa thams cad spangs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bag chags dang bcas te spangs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgrib pa thams cad spangs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But they do not have the abandonment of the traces, nor do they have the abandonment of all the obscurations of meditative concentration and meditative attainment.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa dang / gtan du spangs pa dang bag chags dang bcas te spangs pa dang snyoms par 'jug pa'i @64a * //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa dang / gtan du spangs pa dang bag chags dang bcas te spangs pa dang snyoms par 'jug pa'i @64a * //
translated: The Bhagavan Buddhas have abandoned all afflictions, they have abandoned them permanently and they have abandoned them together with their imprints.üîΩ

original: sgrib pa thams cad spangs pa yang yin no zhes bya ba ni spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: sgrib pa thams cad spangs pa yang yin no zhes bya ba ni spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, are endowed with the perfection of abandonment, because they have abandoned all the defilements, because they have abandoned them definitively, because they have abandoned them with their imprints, and because they have abandoned the obscurations of the meditative attainments.

original: thugs rje phun sum tshogs pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: thugs rje phun sum tshogs pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The perfection of compassion is fourfold:

original: dgongs pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / dgongs pa'i rab tu dbye ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / sbyor ba'i rab tu dbye ba phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: dgongs pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / dgongs pa'i rab tu dbye ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / sbyor ba'i rab tu dbye ba phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: the perfection of the intention, the perfection of application, the perfection of the classification of the intention, and the perfection of the classification of application.

original: de la dgongs pa phun sum tshogs pa ni /
analyzed: de la dgongs pa phun sum tshogs pa ni /
translated: The perfection of the intention is

original: rtag tu thugs rje dang / dge bar dgongs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag tu thugs rje dang / dge bar dgongs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of the constant intention of compassion and of virtue.üîΩThe perfection of application is

original: sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa ni gzhan gyi don du mchog la brtson pa dang / dge ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa ni gzhan gyi don du mchog la brtson pa dang / dge ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of the application to the highest good for the sake of others and because of virtue.

original: dgongs pa'i rab tu dbye ba phun sum tshogs pa ni phan par dgongs pa dang / skal ba dang ldan pa'i dus su 'ong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgongs pa'i rab tu dbye ba phun sum tshogs pa ni phan par dgongs pa dang / skal ba dang ldan pa'i dus su 'ong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The perfection of the discernment of the resolve is due to the resolve to benefit and the arrival at the appropriate time.

original: sbyor ba'i rab tu dbye ba phun sum tshogs pa ni ngan song gsum las 'byin pa'i sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa dang bde 'gro dang theg pa gsum la rab tu 'god pa'i sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i rab tu dbye ba phun sum tshogs pa ni ngan song gsum las 'byin pa'i sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa dang bde 'gro dang theg pa gsum la rab tu 'god pa'i sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: The perfection of application is due to the perfection of application in the deliverance from the three unfortunate states of existence and the perfection of application in the establishment in the fortunate states of existence and the three vehicles.

original: de yang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang thun mong ma yin pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyi thugs rje chen po nyid yin par bstan to //
analyzed: de yang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang thun mong ma yin pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyi thugs rje chen po nyid yin par bstan to //
translated: Moreover, the non-commonality of the disciples and the Solitary Buddhas is demonstrated as the Great Compassion of the Lord.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rnam pa thams cad dang ldan pa'i phyir thugs rje phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya'o //üîΩmi zad pa phun sum tshogs pa yang rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rnam pa thams cad dang ldan pa'i phyir thugs rje phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya'o // mi zad pa phun sum tshogs pa yang rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the perfection of compassion because it is endowed with all aspects.üîΩThe perfection of inexhaustibility is also fourfold.

original: ji lta zhe na zad pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na zad pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: What are the four kinds of inexhaustibility?

original: ma rdzogs par zad pa dang / rdzogs te zad pa dang / dus la ma bab par dus zad pa dang / rang gi mtshan nyid zad pa'o //
analyzed: ma rdzogs par zad pa dang / rdzogs te zad pa dang / dus la ma bab par dus zad pa dang / rang gi mtshan nyid zad pa'o //
translated: non-exhaustion as incomplete, exhaustion as complete, non-exhaustion as untimely, and non-exhaustion as intrinsic nature.

original: ji skad du rga shi'i yan lag rnam par ma phye bar nyams pa dang / tshe nyams pa dang drod nyams pa dang / srog gi dbang po 'gags pa dang / 'chi ba dang dus byed pa dang zhigs pa dang / nang du nyams pa'o //
analyzed: ji skad du rga shi'i yan lag rnam par ma phye bar nyams pa dang / tshe nyams pa dang drod nyams pa dang / srog gi dbang po 'gags pa dang / 'chi ba dang dus byed pa dang zhigs pa dang / nang du nyams pa'o //
translated: As it is said: ‚ÄúThere is deterioration without the branch of aging and death, deterioration of life, deterioration of heat, cessation of the life faculty, death, the end of life, dissolution, and internal deterioration.‚Äù

original: de dag las bzlog pa ni mi zad pa rnam pa bzhir rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag las bzlog pa ni mi zad pa rnam pa bzhir rig par bya'o //
translated: The opposite of those should be understood as the four kinds of non-exhaustion.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rnam pa thams cad dang ldan pa'i phyir mi zad pa nyid phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rnam pa thams cad dang ldan pa'i phyir mi zad pa nyid phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the perfection of non-exhaustion because it possesses all aspects.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams la yang mi zad pa phun sum tshogs par 'dod mod kyi /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams la yang mi zad pa phun sum tshogs par 'dod mod kyi /
translated: The ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas are also considered to have the perfection of non-exhaustion.

original: de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i man ngag sngon du song ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i mi zad pa nyid yin par rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i man ngag sngon du song ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i mi zad pa nyid yin par rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: Because it is preceded by the Tathagata's personal instruction, it is established as the Tathagata's inexhaustibility.

original: 'khor los sgyur ba'i 'khor phun sum tshogs pa rnam par gzhag pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba'i 'khor phun sum tshogs pa rnam par gzhag pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like the establishment of the perfection of the retinue of a wheel-turning king.

original: skyes bu chen po'i dngos po phun sum tshogs pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: skyes bu chen po'i dngos po phun sum tshogs pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The perfection of the entity of a great man is twofold:

original: gzugs kyi sku phun sum tshogs pa dang @64b mthu phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi sku phun sum tshogs pa dang @64b mthu phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: the perfection of the form body and the perfection of power.

original: de la gzugs kyi sku phun sum tshogs pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de la gzugs kyi sku phun sum tshogs pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The perfection of the form body is fourfold:

original: mtshan phun sum tshogs pa ni skyes bu chen po'i dngos po nye bar mtshon par byed pa nyid kyi phyir dang / dpe byad bzang po phun sum tshogs pa ni de dpe byad bzang ba'i phyir dang stobs phun sum tshogs pa ni mtha' med pa'i ye shes kyi stobs bzod pa nyid kyi phyir dang /
analyzed: mtshan phun sum tshogs pa ni skyes bu chen po'i dngos po nye bar mtshon par byed pa nyid kyi phyir dang / dpe byad bzang po phun sum tshogs pa ni de dpe byad bzang ba'i phyir dang stobs phun sum tshogs pa ni mtha' med pa'i ye shes kyi stobs bzod pa nyid kyi phyir dang /
translated: The perfection of the major marks indicates the entity of a great man, the perfection of the minor marks beautifies it, the perfection of power is the acceptance of limitless knowledge, and the perfection of life is the duration of the body of the great man.

original: rdo rje'i snying po sku rus pa phun sum tshogs pa ni phas kyi rgol ba dag gis mi choms pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rdo rje'i snying po sku rus pa phun sum tshogs pa ni phas kyi rgol ba dag gis mi choms pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The vajra-essence, the skeleton, is the perfection of body, because it is not overcome by opponents.

original: de de yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi ni 'jig rten pa thams cad dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang / thun mong ma yin pa skyes bu chen po'i dngos pos bsdus pa ni sku phun sum tshogs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de de yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi ni 'jig rten pa thams cad dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang / thun mong ma yin pa skyes bu chen po'i dngos pos bsdus pa ni sku phun sum tshogs par rig par bya'o //
translated: The perfection of body of the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, should be understood as the perfection of the state of a great man, which is not common to all worldly persons, nor to the sravakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: 'khor los sgyur ba la yang lus phun sum tshogs pa yod par 'dod mod kyi /
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba la yang lus phun sum tshogs pa yod par 'dod mod kyi /
translated: Although it is accepted that a universal monarch also has a perfect body,

original: rnam pa thams cad dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i phyir skyes bu chen po'i dngos po phun sum tshogs pa zhes mi bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i phyir skyes bu chen po'i dngos po phun sum tshogs pa zhes mi bya'o //
translated: it is not called the perfection of the state of a great man, because it is not endowed with all the aspects.

original: mthu phun sum tshogs pa yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: mthu phun sum tshogs pa yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The perfection of power is also fourfold:

original: phyi'i yul sprul pa dang / yongs su sgyur ba dang / gnas pa la dbang ba nyid phun sum tshogs pa dang / tshe gtong ba dang / gnas pa la dbang ba nyid phun sum tshogs pa dang / nam mkha' dang bsgribs pa dang / thag ring por yang myur du 'gro ba dang /
analyzed: phyi'i yul sprul pa dang / yongs su sgyur ba dang / gnas pa la dbang ba nyid phun sum tshogs pa dang / tshe gtong ba dang / gnas pa la dbang ba nyid phun sum tshogs pa dang / nam mkha' dang bsgribs pa dang / thag ring por yang myur du 'gro ba dang /
translated: the perfection of the power to travel swiftly through space, through obstructions, and over long distances,üîΩthe perfection of the power to make many fit into a small space,

original: chung ngur mang po shong bar byed pa la dbang ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / rtag tu rmad du byung ba'i chos rnam pa sna tshogs phun sum tshogs pa ste /
analyzed: chung ngur mang po shong bar byed pa la dbang ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / rtag tu rmad du byung ba'i chos rnam pa sna tshogs phun sum tshogs pa ste /

translated: The uncontaminated path is the antidote to the latent states of the contaminants, and it is completely incompatible with them.

original: dge 'dun la bstod pas kyang yon tan phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa lnga bstan te /
analyzed: dge 'dun la bstod pas kyang yon tan phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa lnga bstan te /
translated: The praise of the Sa·πÖgha also teaches the five perfections of its qualities:

original: mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa'i 'ching ba las grol ba nyid dang mang po gzhan dang gzhan dag las khyad par 'phags pa nyid dang / yan lag bcu dang ldan pa nyid dang / yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa nyid dang /
analyzed: mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa'i 'ching ba las grol ba nyid dang mang po gzhan dang gzhan dag las khyad par 'phags pa nyid dang / yan lag bcu dang ldan pa nyid dang / yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa nyid dang /
translated: it is liberated from the bonds of the afflictions that are to be abandoned by seeing and by cultivation; it is superior to many other groups; it possesses ten limbs; it possesses eight limbs;

original: dbye ba rnam pa brgyad yin no //
analyzed: dbye ba rnam pa brgyad yin no //
translated: and it has eight divisions.

original: de la chags pa las 'das zhes bya ba'i tshig gis 'bras bu'i chos la gnas pa bstan te /
analyzed: de la chags pa las 'das zhes bya ba'i tshig gis 'bras bu'i chos la gnas pa bstan te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúgone beyond attachment‚Äù indicates the quality of abiding in the result.

original: de lta ma yin na 'das par mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na 'das par mi rung ngo //
translated: If that were not so, it would not be possible to go beyond.

original: tshogs pa dag las shin tu 'das gyur nas //
analyzed: tshogs pa dag las shin tu 'das gyur nas //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúhaving gone beyond the assemblies‚Äù indicates the quality of being superior to other groups.

original: zhes bya ba'i tshig gis ni sgrub pa'i chos dang bshad pa'i @66b chos la gnas pa yin par bstan te /üîΩde lta yin na ni de las 'das pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshig gis ni sgrub pa'i chos dang bshad pa'i @66b chos la gnas pa yin par bstan te / de lta yin na ni de las 'das pa yin te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúabiding in the Dharma of practice and the Dharma of teaching‚Äù indicates that the bodhisattva has transcended the stage of ordinary beings.

original: sgrub pa'i chos la gnas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrub pa'i chos la gnas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If he abides in the Dharma of practice, he has transcended the stage of ordinary beings.

original: bshad pa'i chos gsungs pa bzhin du rjes su 'brangs na ni legs par zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: bshad pa'i chos gsungs pa bzhin du rjes su 'brangs na ni legs par zhugs pa yin no //
translated: If he follows the Dharma of teaching as it is taught, he has entered the stage of the wise.

original: chags pa las 'das pa yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: chags pa las 'das pa yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: Transcendence of attachment is also of four kinds.

original: mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa ma lus pa las 'das pa ni dper na rgyun tu zhugs pa lta bu ste /üîΩsrid pa'i rtse mo pa'i tshogs gzhan dag ni de lta bu ma yin te /
analyzed: mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa ma lus pa las 'das pa ni dper na rgyun tu zhugs pa lta bu ste / srid pa'i rtse mo pa'i tshogs gzhan dag ni de lta bu ma yin te /
translated: Transcendence of all the passions that are to be eliminated by the path of insight, like the stream-winner.

original: ma spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The other groups of the summit of existence are not like that, because they have not yet eliminated the passions.

original: khams gsum gyis bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa las 'das pa ni dper na dgra bcom pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: khams gsum gyis bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa las 'das pa ni dper na dgra bcom pa lta bu ste /
translated: Transcendence of the passions of the three realms that are to be eliminated by the path of cultivation, like the arhat.

original: tshogs gzhan dag ni srid pa'i rtse mo las 'das pa ma yin no //
analyzed: tshogs gzhan dag ni srid pa'i rtse mo las 'das pa ma yin no //
translated: The other groups have not transcended the summit of existence.

original: chags pa las shin tu yang dag par 'das pa ni /
analyzed: chags pa las shin tu yang dag par 'das pa ni /
translated: The path of cultivation is the path that is completely beyond attachment.

original: dper na rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon du bya ba'i phyir 'jug pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: dper na rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon du bya ba'i phyir 'jug pa lta bu ste /
translated: For example, it is like the path that is engaged for the purpose of actualizing the fruit of stream-enterer.

original: de la chags pa thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa yod pa ma yin par 'dod kyang shin tu 'das pa ni yod pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de la chags pa thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa yod pa ma yin par 'dod kyang shin tu 'das pa ni yod pa kho na yin no //
translated: Although it is accepted that there is no complete transcendence of all attachments in that path, there is complete transcendence of some attachments.

original: de 'dra bar tshogs gzhan dag ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de 'dra bar tshogs gzhan dag ni ma yin no //
translated: But this is not the case for other collections of aggregates.

original: de'i rnam par smin pa'i sa las yang dag par 'das pa yang yin no //
analyzed: de'i rnam par smin pa'i sa las yang dag par 'das pa yang yin no //
translated: It is also completely beyond the level of its karmic maturation.

original: lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu la gnas pa kha cig yongs su nyams su zin kyang de'i rnam par smin pa'i sar yang slar skye ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu la gnas pa kha cig yongs su nyams su zin kyang de'i rnam par smin pa'i sar yang slar skye ba ni ma yin te /
translated: Even though some abiders in the fruit of once-returner, non-returner, and arhat may completely degenerate, they are not reborn in the level of its karmic maturation.

original: mthong ba'i chos kho nas de dag spong bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos kho nas de dag spong bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they abandon that level in this very life.

original: ji skad du 'bras bu nyams te 'chi ba ma yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ji skad du 'bras bu nyams te 'chi ba ma yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: As it is said, ‚ÄúThey do not die having degenerated from their fruit.‚Äù

original: de 'dra bar tshogs gzhan dag ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de 'dra bar tshogs gzhan dag ni ma yin no //
translated: The other groups are not like that.

original: chags pa las 'das pa yang tshogs gzhan dag las khyad par du gyur pa nyid yin par bstan to //
analyzed: chags pa las 'das pa yang tshogs gzhan dag las khyad par du gyur pa nyid yin par bstan to //
translated: And the one who has gone beyond attachment is also distinguished from the other groups.

original: legs par bzhugs pa yang rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: legs par bzhugs pa yang rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: Well-established is also fivefold:

original: tshul khrims kyis ni 'phags pa dgyes pa'i tshul khrims dang ldan pa'i phyir dang / tshe rabs gzhan du yang rjes su 'brel lo //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyis ni 'phags pa dgyes pa'i tshul khrims dang ldan pa'i phyir dang / tshe rabs gzhan du yang rjes su 'brel lo //
translated: By morality, because he possesses the morality pleasing to the noble ones, and it continues in other lives.

original: thos pas ni legs par gsungs pa'i chos thos pa las byung ba'i shes pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thos pas ni legs par gsungs pa'i chos thos pa las byung ba'i shes pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: By learning, because he possesses the knowledge arising from hearing the well-spoken Dharma.

original: bsams pas ni de la brten na dgongs pa can rnams la nges pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsams pas ni de la brten na dgongs pa can rnams la nges pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: By reflection, because he possesses certainty in the intended meaning of the scriptures based on that.

original: bsgoms pas ni bsgom pa'i lam zag pa med pa thob ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgoms pas ni bsgom pa'i lam zag pa med pa thob ba'i phyir ro //
translated: By cultivation, because he has attained the uncontaminated path of cultivation.

original: 'bras bus ni de'i 'bras bu spangs ba dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bus ni de'i 'bras bu spangs ba dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: By fruition, because he possesses the abandonment that is its fruit.

original: de yang mdor na rgyu dang bcas 'bras bu dang bcas pa legs par sgrub pa ji ltar rig par bstan to //üîΩyan lag bcu zhes gang gsungs pa la yan lag bcu ni /üîΩlam gyi yan lag brgyad dang / yang dag par rnam par grol ba dang / @67a * //
analyzed: de yang mdor na rgyu dang bcas 'bras bu dang bcas pa legs par sgrub pa ji ltar rig par bstan to // yan lag bcu zhes gang gsungs pa la yan lag bcu ni / lam gyi yan lag brgyad dang / yang dag par rnam par grol ba dang / @67a * //
translated: In brief, it is well taught as having a cause and having a result.üîΩThe ten members are the eight members of the path, right liberation, and right cognition of liberation.

original: yang dag par rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'o //
analyzed: yang dag par rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'o //
translated: The members are the eight members of the path, right liberation, and right cognition of liberation.

original: de dag ni rnam par gzhag pa la yan lag gtso bo ni yang dag ba'i lta ba ste /
analyzed: de dag ni rnam par gzhag pa la yan lag gtso bo ni yang dag ba'i lta ba ste /
translated: Among them, right view is the principal member in the classification of the path,

original: rab tu rnam par 'byed pa gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab tu rnam par 'byed pa gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the principal factor in the discernment of the truths.

original: mthong ba dang bsgom pa dang / mi slob ba'i lam gyi yan lag rnams rab tu ston par byed pa'i yan lag ni yang dag pa'i rtog pa ste /
analyzed: mthong ba dang bsgom pa dang / mi slob ba'i lam gyi yan lag rnams rab tu ston par byed pa'i yan lag ni yang dag pa'i rtog pa ste /
translated: Right thought is the member that shows the members of the path of seeing, cultivation, and no training,

original: yang dag pa'i dag kun nas bslad ba'i tshig gis rang gi khong du chud pa brjod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i dag kun nas bslad ba'i tshig gis rang gi khong du chud pa brjod pa'i phyir te /
translated: because it is the expression of one's own understanding through words that are not deceptive.

original: skye ba zad do //
analyzed: skye ba zad do //
translated: The expression the life of birth is destroyed,

original: tshangs par spyod pa bsten to zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa bsten to zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: the practice of pure conduct has been accomplished,üîΩis the expression of one's own understanding through words that are not deceptive.

original: yid ches par byed pa'i yan lag ni yang dag ba'i ngag dang las kyi mtha' dang 'tsho ba ste /
analyzed: yid ches par byed pa'i yan lag ni yang dag ba'i ngag dang las kyi mtha' dang 'tsho ba ste /
translated: The branch of faith is the three beginning with right speech.

original: yang dag pa'i tshig gis ni 'brel ba'i gtam rnam par nges par byed pa na 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab la mngon par yid ches par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i tshig gis ni 'brel ba'i gtam rnam par nges par byed pa na 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab la mngon par yid ches par 'gyur ro //
translated: By means of right speech, one has faith in supramundane wisdom when one ascertains the connected discourse.

original: yang dag pa'i las kyi mthas ni 'phags pa dgyes pa'i tshul khrims la mngon par yid ches par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i las kyi mthas ni 'phags pa dgyes pa'i tshul khrims la mngon par yid ches par 'gyur te /
translated: By means of right action, one has faith in the morality pleasing to the aryas,

original: srog gi phyir yang ma yin pa mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srog gi phyir yang ma yin pa mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one does not commit any offense even for the sake of one‚Äôs life.

original: yang dag pa'i 'tsho bas ni yo byad bsnyungs pa la yid ches par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i 'tsho bas ni yo byad bsnyungs pa la yid ches par 'gyur te /
translated: By means of right livelihood, one has faith in the austerity of few desires,

original: chos dang tshod zin pas chos gos la sogs pa tshol ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos dang tshod zin pas chos gos la sogs pa tshol ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because one seeks robes and so on in accordance with the Dharma and in moderation.

original: spong pa'i yan lag ni yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang / yang dag pa'i dran pa dang / yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin te /
analyzed: spong pa'i yan lag ni yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang / yang dag pa'i dran pa dang / yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin te /
translated: The branch of abandonment is the three beginning with right effort.

original: brtson 'grus brtsams na bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brtson 'grus brtsams na bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: When one has begun to make an effort, one is mindful in order to abandon the defilements that are to be abandoned by cultivation.

original: dran pa nye bar gnas na zhum pa dang rgod pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gnas na zhum pa dang rgod pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When one is mindful, one is concentrated in order to avoid the secondary defilements of depression and excitement.

original: ting nge 'dzin la brten na yon tan khyad par can mngon par sgrub pa'i gags dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la brten na yon tan khyad par can mngon par sgrub pa'i gags dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: When one is concentrated, one is liberated in order to avoid the obstacles to the realization of special qualities.

original: 'bras bu'i yan lag ni yang dag par grol ba'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i yan lag ni yang dag par grol ba'o //
translated: The member that is the result is perfect knowledge.

original: lam gyi 'bras bu yang rnam par gnyis su rnam pa gzhag ste /
analyzed: lam gyi 'bras bu yang rnam par gnyis su rnam pa gzhag ste /
translated: The result of the path is also presented in two ways:

original: nyon mongs pa spong pa ste rnams par grol ba dang / lhag par mos pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa spong pa ste rnams par grol ba dang / lhag par mos pa'o //
translated: abandonment of the defilements, which is liberation, and the special resolve.

original: de la lhag par mos pa ni mi slob pa'i yan lag tu rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: de la lhag par mos pa ni mi slob pa'i yan lag tu rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: The special resolve is presented as a member of the adept.

original: yan lag rnams kyis 'dus byas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yan lag rnams kyis 'dus byas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is conditioned by the members.

original: yongs su gcod pa'i yan lag ni yang dag par rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba ste /
analyzed: yongs su gcod pa'i yan lag ni yang dag par rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba ste /
translated: The member that is the discernment of reality is the seeing of the knowledge of perfect liberation.

original: rnam par grol lo snyam du des yang dag par rnam par grol ba yongs su gcod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par grol lo snyam du des yang dag par rnam par grol ba yongs su gcod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the determination of perfect liberation.

original: de ltar byas na mi slob pa'i dge 'dun ni rig pa dang zhabs su ldan pa dang de'i 'bras bu rnam par grol ba dang / rnam par @67b grol ba'i ye shes dang ldan pa'i yon tan phun sum tshogs par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar byas na mi slob pa'i dge 'dun ni rig pa dang zhabs su ldan pa dang de'i 'bras bu rnam par grol ba dang / rnam par @67b grol ba'i ye shes dang ldan pa'i yon tan phun sum tshogs par bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the Sangha of those beyond training is shown to be perfect in virtue, being endowed with knowledge and conduct, with the result of liberation, and with the knowledge of liberation.

original: yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa nyid ni slob pa'i dge 'dun gyi yon tan phun sum tshogs pa yin te /
analyzed: yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa nyid ni slob pa'i dge 'dun gyi yon tan phun sum tshogs pa yin te /
translated: The Sangha of those in training is perfect in virtue, being endowed with eight factors:

original: rig pa dang zhabs su ldan pa'i phyir dang / yang dag pa'i rnam par grol ba dang ye shes mthong ba gnyis med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rig pa dang zhabs su ldan pa'i phyir dang / yang dag pa'i rnam par grol ba dang ye shes mthong ba gnyis med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is endowed with knowledge and conduct, and because it is not a duality, i.e., perfect liberation and the insight of knowledge.

original: 'ching ba lhag ma lus pa ni slob pa yin no //
analyzed: 'ching ba lhag ma lus pa ni slob pa yin no //
translated: Those in training have remaining fetters.

original: de bas na de dag yang dag pa'i rnam par grol bar mi gzhag ste /
analyzed: de bas na de dag yang dag pa'i rnam par grol bar mi gzhag ste /
translated: Therefore, they are not established as being perfectly liberated.

original: 'ching ba phyogs gcig las grol ba ni grol ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'ching ba phyogs gcig las grol ba ni grol ba ma yin no //
translated: One who is liberated from only one part of the fetters is not liberated.

original: de med pa'i phyir rnam par grol lo snyam pa'i rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba med pa yin no //
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir rnam par grol lo snyam pa'i rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba med pa yin no //
translated: Because of the absence of that, there is no vision of the knowledge of liberation that thinks, ‚ÄúI am liberated.‚Äù

original: de mngon pa'i nga rgyal can gyi ye shes yin par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de mngon pa'i nga rgyal can gyi ye shes yin par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would follow that that is the knowledge of one who is full of pride.

original: dbye ba brgyad ni gnyi ga'i yon tan phun sum tshogs pa yin te /
analyzed: dbye ba brgyad ni gnyi ga'i yon tan phun sum tshogs pa yin te /
translated: The eight divisions are the perfection of the qualities of both.

original: 'bras bus lam dang lam gyis 'bras bu'i bye brag rab tu ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bus lam dang lam gyis 'bras bu'i bye brag rab tu ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they teach the distinction of the path by the fruit and the fruit by the path.

original: zhugs pa bzhi 'bras bu'i lam gyi dbye bas dbye'o //
analyzed: zhugs pa bzhi 'bras bu'i lam gyi dbye bas dbye'o //
translated: The four enterers are divided by the divisions of the path of the fruit.

original: 'bras bu'i lam gyi dbye ba yang nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po tha dad pa'i phyir dang rgyu bstsags pa tha dad pa'i phyir rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i lam gyi dbye ba yang nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po tha dad pa'i phyir dang rgyu bstsags pa tha dad pa'i phyir rig par bya'o //
translated: The divisions of the path of the fruit should be understood as the distinct antidotes to affliction and the distinct accumulations of causes.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa'i lam ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po dang / mthong ba'i lam tsam gyi rgyu nye bar bstsags pa yang yin no //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa'i lam ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po dang / mthong ba'i lam tsam gyi rgyu nye bar bstsags pa yang yin no //
translated: The path of the enterer for the purpose of manifesting the fruit of stream entry is the accumulation of the cause of the mere path of seeing and the antidote to the affliction to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa'i lam ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba 'dod pa'i khams na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa'i phyogs gcig gi gnyen po dang / mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam gyi rgyu nye bar bstsags pa yang yin no //
analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa'i lam ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba 'dod pa'i khams na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa'i phyogs gcig gi gnyen po dang / mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam gyi rgyu nye bar bstsags pa yang yin no //
translated: The path of entry to the result of once-returner is the antidote to one part of the afflictions that are to be abandoned by cultivation in the desire realm, and it is the accumulation of the causes of the paths of seeing and cultivation.

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa'i lam ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa bsgom pas spang bar bya ba ma lus pa'i gnyen po dang / mthong ba'i lam gyi rgyu nye bar bstsags pa dang / bsgom pa'i lam gyi rgyu lhag par nye bar bstsags pa yang yin no //
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa'i lam ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa bsgom pas spang bar bya ba ma lus pa'i gnyen po dang / mthong ba'i lam gyi rgyu nye bar bstsags pa dang / bsgom pa'i lam gyi rgyu lhag par nye bar bstsags pa yang yin no //
translated: The path of entry to the result of non-returner is the antidote to all the afflictions of the desire realm that are to be abandoned by cultivation, and it is the accumulation of the causes of the path of seeing and the special accumulation of the causes of the path of cultivation.

original: dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu mngon du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa'i lam ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po dang / mthong ba'i lam gyi rgyu nye bar bstsags pa dang / bsgom pa'i lam gyi rgyu lhag par nye bar bsags pa yang yin te /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu mngon du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa'i lam ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po dang / mthong ba'i lam gyi rgyu nye bar bstsags pa dang / bsgom pa'i lam gyi rgyu lhag par nye bar bsags pa yang yin te /
translated: The path of entry to the result of an arhat is the antidote to the afflictions of the form and formless realms that are to be abandoned by the path of meditation, it is the accumulation of the cause of the path of seeing, and it is the special accumulation of the cause of the path of meditation.

original: lam dang 'bras bu'i bye brag ni spangs ba tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lam dang 'bras bu'i bye brag ni spangs ba tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The distinction between the path and the result is due to the difference in what is abandoned.

original: mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu yin no //üîΩde nyid bsgom pas spang bar @68a * //
analyzed: mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu yin no // de nyid bsgom pas spang bar @68a * //
