original: 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba la rnam par shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba la rnam par shes pa gang zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúConditioned by volitional action is consciousness‚Äù ‚Äî what is consciousness?

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug ste /
translated: It is the six groups of consciousness.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: They are eye consciousness, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs zhes bya ba ni ming gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs zhes bya ba ni ming gang zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúConditioned by consciousness is name and form‚Äù ‚Äî what is name?

original: gzugs can ma yin pa'i phung po bzhi ste /
analyzed: gzugs can ma yin pa'i phung po bzhi ste /
translated: It is the four formless aggregates.

original: tshor ba'i phung po dang / 'du shes kyi phung po dang / 'du byed kyi phung po dang / rnam par shes pa'i phung po'o //
analyzed: tshor ba'i phung po dang / 'du shes kyi phung po dang / 'du byed kyi phung po dang / rnam par shes pa'i phung po'o //
translated: They are the feeling aggregate, the perception aggregate, the volitional formations aggregate, and the consciousness aggregate.

original: gzugs gang zhe na /üîΩgzugs gang yin pa ci yang rung /
analyzed: gzugs gang zhe na / gzugs gang yin pa ci yang rung /
translated: What is form?

original: de thams cad 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang / 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag rgyur byas pa ste /üîΩgzugs 'di dang snga mi'i ming gnyis gcig tu mngon par bsdus nas /
analyzed: de thams cad 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang / 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag rgyur byas pa ste / gzugs 'di dang snga mi'i ming gnyis gcig tu mngon par bsdus nas /
translated: Whatever form there is, all of it is included in the four great elements and what is derived from the four great elements.

original: ming dang gzugs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs zhes bya'o //
translated: This form and the former name are combined into one and called ‚Äúname and form.‚Äù

original: ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis skye mched drug ces bya ba la //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis skye mched drug ces bya ba la //
translated: The condition of name-and-form is the six sense spheres.

original: skye mched drug gang zhe na /
analyzed: skye mched drug gang zhe na /
translated: What are the six sense spheres?

original: nang gi skye mched drug ste /
analyzed: nang gi skye mched drug ste /
translated: They are the six internal sense spheres.

original: mig nang gi skye mched dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid nang gi skye mched do //
analyzed: mig nang gi skye mched dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid nang gi skye mched do //
translated: The eye is an internal sense sphere, the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind are internal sense spheres.

original: skye mched drug gi rkyen gyis reg pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: skye mched drug gi rkyen gyis reg pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The condition of the six sense spheres is contact.

original: reg pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: reg pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is contact?

original: reg pa'i tshogs drug ste /
analyzed: reg pa'i tshogs drug ste /
translated: It is the group of six contacts.

original: mig gi 'dus te reg pa dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'o //
analyzed: mig gi 'dus te reg pa dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'o //
translated: There is the contact of eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind.

original: reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba zhes bya ba la tshor ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba zhes bya ba la tshor ba gang zhe na /
translated: The condition of contact is feeling. What is feeling?

original: tshor ba ni gsum ste /üîΩbde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bde ba yang ma yin /
analyzed: tshor ba ni gsum ste / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bde ba yang ma yin /
translated: There are three kinds of feeling:

original: @70a * // sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: @70a * // sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'o //
translated: pleasant, unpleasant, and neither pleasant nor unpleasant.

original: tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa zhes bya ba la sred ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa zhes bya ba la sred ba gang zhe na /
translated: The condition of feeling is craving. What is craving?

original: sred pa ni gsum ste /
analyzed: sred pa ni gsum ste /
translated: There are three kinds of craving:

original: 'dod pa'i sred pa dang / gzugs kyi sred pa dang / gzugs med pa'i sred pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i sred pa dang / gzugs kyi sred pa dang / gzugs med pa'i sred pa'o //
translated: craving for the desire realm, craving for the form realm, and craving for the formless realm.

original: sred pa'i rkyen gyis len pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sred pa'i rkyen gyis len pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: ‚ÄúConditioned by craving is grasping‚Äù:

original: len pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: len pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is grasping?

original: len pa ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: len pa ni bzhi ste /
translated: There are four types of grasping:

original: 'dod pa nye bar len pa dang / lta ba nye bar len pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs nye bar len pa dang / bdag tu smra ba nye bar len pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa nye bar len pa dang / lta ba nye bar len pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs nye bar len pa dang / bdag tu smra ba nye bar len pa'o //
translated: grasping at desire, grasping at views, grasping at morality and spiritual disciplines, and grasping at the doctrine of self.

original: len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa zhes bya ba la srid pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa zhes bya ba la srid pa gang zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúConditioned by grasping is existence‚Äù: What is existence?

original: srid pa ni gsum ste /
analyzed: srid pa ni gsum ste /
translated: There are three types of existence:

original: 'dod pa'i srid pa dang / gzugs kyi srid pa dang / gzugs med pa'i srid pa'o ;üîΩ/ srid pa'i rkyen gyis skye ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i srid pa dang / gzugs kyi srid pa dang / gzugs med pa'i srid pa'o ; / srid pa'i rkyen gyis skye ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: existence in the desire realm, existence in the form realm, and existence in the formless realm.

original: skye ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: skye ba gang zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúConditioned by existence is birth‚Äù: What is birth?

original: sems can rnams gang yin pa de dang sems can gyi ris de dang de dag tu skye ba gang yin pa dang / shin tu skye ba dang / 'pho ba dang / rab tu 'byung ba dang / phung po so sor thob pa dang / khams so sor thob pa dang /
analyzed: sems can rnams gang yin pa de dang sems can gyi ris de dang de dag tu skye ba gang yin pa dang / shin tu skye ba dang / 'pho ba dang / rab tu 'byung ba dang / phung po so sor thob pa dang / khams so sor thob pa dang /
translated: It is the birth, the complete birth, the appearance, the manifestation, the acquisition, the appearance of the aggregates, the acquisition of the sense spheres, the acquisition of the elements, the manifestation of the aggregates, the arising of the life faculty, in such and such beings, in such and such classes of beings.

original: skye mched so sor thob pa dang / phung po rnams mngon par 'grub pa dang / srog gi dbang po rab tu skyes pa 'di ni skye ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: skye mched so sor thob pa dang / phung po rnams mngon par 'grub pa dang / srog gi dbang po rab tu skyes pa 'di ni skye ba zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called birth.

original: skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi zhes bya ba la /
translated: With birth as condition, aging and death

original: rga ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: rga ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is aging?

original: gang de'i spyi cer dang / skra dkar dang / gnyer ma 'tshigs pa dang / 'khogs pa dang / sgur po dang / dgu bo dang / 'khyor ba dang / sha gnag pa dang / lud pa lu ba dang / dbugs rgod pa dang / 'khar ba la brten pa dang /
analyzed: gang de'i spyi cer dang / skra dkar dang / gnyer ma 'tshigs pa dang / 'khogs pa dang / sgur po dang / dgu bo dang / 'khyor ba dang / sha gnag pa dang / lud pa lu ba dang / dbugs rgod pa dang / 'khar ba la brten pa dang /
translated: It is the state of being old, decrepit, toothless, wrinkled, bent, leaning on a stick,

original: mong rtul ba dang zhan pa dang / nyams pa dang / yongs su nyams pa dang / dbang po rnams rgud pa dang / mi gsal ba dang / 'du byed rnams rnying pa dang / 'jig par nye ba 'di ni rga ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mong rtul ba dang zhan pa dang / nyams pa dang / yongs su nyams pa dang / dbang po rnams rgud pa dang / mi gsal ba dang / 'du byed rnams rnying pa dang / 'jig par nye ba 'di ni rga ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The aging of sentient beings refers to their deterioration, weakness, frailty, decline, and the decline of their faculties. It refers to the aging of their formative forces and their approach to death.

original: 'chi ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'chi ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is death?

original: sems can gang yin pa de dang de dag sems can gyi ris de dang de dag nas 'chi ba dang 'pho ba dang 'jig pa dang / nad rmugs pa dang / tshe nyams pa dang / drod yal ba dang / srog gi dbang po 'gags pa dang /
analyzed: sems can gang yin pa de dang de dag sems can gyi ris de dang de dag nas 'chi ba dang 'pho ba dang 'jig pa dang / nad rmugs pa dang / tshe nyams pa dang / drod yal ba dang / srog gi dbang po 'gags pa dang /
translated: It is the passing away, the perishing, the dying, the termination, the falling away, the separation, the non-survival, the interruption of the life faculty, the casting off of the aggregates, the giving up of the vital force, and the casting off of the body of any sentient being from any class of sentient beings.

original: phung po rnams 'dor ba dang / shi ba dang / dus byad pa'i 'di ni shi ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: phung po rnams 'dor ba dang / shi ba dang / dus byad pa'i 'di ni shi ba zhes bya ste /
translated: This is called death.

original: shi ba 'di dang / snga ma rga ba gnyis gcig tu bsdus nas rga shi zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: shi ba 'di dang / snga ma rga ba gnyis gcig tu bsdus nas rga shi zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Death and the previously mentioned aging are combined into one member, namely, aging and death.

original: 'di ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i rnam par dbye ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i rnam par dbye ba'o //
translated: This is the analysis of dependent origination.

original: dge slong dag khyed la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i dang po dang rnam par dbye ba bshad par bya'o zhes ngas gang smras pa de dag ni ngas smras pa de dag yin no //
analyzed: dge slong dag khyed la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i dang po dang rnam par dbye ba bshad par bya'o zhes ngas gang smras pa de dag ni ngas smras pa de dag yin no //
translated: Monks, I have explained to you the first and the analysis of dependent origination. Those are the things I have explained.

original: ci'i phyir 'di bstan zhe na zhes bya ba ni mdo @70b sde mtha' dag ston pa'i dgos pa 'dri ste /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'di bstan zhe na zhes bya ba ni mdo @70b sde mtha' dag ston pa'i dgos pa 'dri ste /
translated: Why is this taught? means that the purpose of teaching the entire sutra is asked.

original: dgos pa med par ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnam pa chos mi ston pas mdo sde ston pa'i dgos pa brjod par bya dgos so //
analyzed: dgos pa med par ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnam pa chos mi ston pas mdo sde ston pa'i dgos pa brjod par bya dgos so //
translated: Since the Blessed Buddha does not teach the Dharma without purpose, the purpose of teaching the sutra must be stated.

original: sangs rgyas kyi bka'i dgos pa ni nges par sems can gyi spyod pa'i dbang du byas pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi bka'i dgos pa ni nges par sems can gyi spyod pa'i dbang du byas pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn't the purpose of the Buddha's teachings definitely based on the conduct of sentient beings?üîΩTherefore, it is not necessary to ask the purpose.

original: de bas na dri mi dgos so zhe na sems can gyi spyod pa yang mang du yod la /
analyzed: de bas na dri mi dgos so zhe na sems can gyi spyod pa yang mang du yod la /
translated: However, there are many types of sentient beings' conduct.

original: de bas na 'di gang gi gnyen por bstan pa'i dmigs mi phyed pas dgos pa nyid dri dgos te /
analyzed: de bas na 'di gang gi gnyen por bstan pa'i dmigs mi phyed pas dgos pa nyid dri dgos te /
translated: Therefore, since it is not determined for whom this is taught as an antidote, the purpose itself must be asked.

original: de'i phyir de ltar na sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'ba' zhig 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes smras so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar na sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'ba' zhig 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes smras so //
translated: Therefore, in order to demonstrate that ‚Äúthus there is the origination of this entire great mass of suffering,‚Äù he says:

original: de ltar na zhes bya ba ni ji skad du ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba nas skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi zhes bya ba'i bar du bstan pa'i rnam pa de dag gis na zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na zhes bya ba ni ji skad du ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba nas skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi zhes bya ba'i bar du bstan pa'i rnam pa de dag gis na zhes bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThus‚Äù refers to the manner in which it has been taught that ‚Äúconditioned by ignorance, there are volitions,‚Äù and so on, up to ‚Äúconditioned by birth, there is aging and death.‚Äù

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni skye ba dang rga shi la sogs pa dang / 'du byed la sogs pa'i zhes bstan to //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni skye ba dang rga shi la sogs pa dang / 'du byed la sogs pa'i zhes bstan to //
translated: ‚ÄúThis‚Äù refers to birth, aging and death, etc., and to the volitions, etc., that have been taught.

original: sdug bsngal gyi phung po zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi tshogs so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi phung po zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi tshogs so //
translated: ‚ÄúGreat mass of suffering‚Äù means a collection of suffering.

original: chen po zhes bya ba ni thog ma med pa'i dus can no //
analyzed: chen po zhes bya ba ni thog ma med pa'i dus can no //
translated: ‚ÄúEntire‚Äù means that it is without beginning.

original: 'ba' zhig ces bya ba ni bdag dang bdag gi dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: 'ba' zhig ces bya ba ni bdag dang bdag gi dang bral ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAlone‚Äù means that it is devoid of a self and what belongs to a self.

original: 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOrigination‚Äù means production.

original: spyod pa spang ba ni bstan pa dgos pa yin gyi /
analyzed: spyod pa spang ba ni bstan pa dgos pa yin gyi /
translated: The practice of abandoning is the purpose of the teaching,üîΩbut it is not the mere teaching of the entry into the truth of suffering.

original: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa rab tu 'jug pa tsam bstan pa ma yin no snyam nas bstan pa de yang ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa rab tu 'jug pa tsam bstan pa ma yin no snyam nas bstan pa de yang ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: What is the purpose of that teaching?

original: de'i phyir kha cig ni bdag med na ji ltar 'khor bar 'gyur zhes mi shes pa dang / the tshom dang / log par shes pa dang ldan pa de dag bstsal ba'i phyir ro zhe'o zhes smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir kha cig ni bdag med na ji ltar 'khor bar 'gyur zhes mi shes pa dang / the tshom dang / log par shes pa dang ldan pa de dag bstsal ba'i phyir ro zhe'o zhes smras te /
translated: Therefore, some say: ‚ÄúIn order to remove those who, not knowing, doubt, and have wrong knowledge, thinking, ‚ÄòIf there is no self, how can there be cyclic existence?‚Äô‚Äù

original: mdo sde 'di las ni 'khor bar 'jug pa'i rim pa 'di bstan pa yin la /
analyzed: mdo sde 'di las ni 'khor bar 'jug pa'i rim pa 'di bstan pa yin la /

original: de yang bdag med par ni 'ba' zhig ces gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang bdag med par ni 'ba' zhig ces gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and it is said that this is only in the absence of self.

original: de bas na de ni 'di'i dgos pa dmigs kyis bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na de ni 'di'i dgos pa dmigs kyis bstan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, that is the purpose of this teaching.

original: de la mi shes pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni ma 'dres pa'i ma rig pa bstan to //
analyzed: de la mi shes pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni ma 'dres pa'i ma rig pa bstan to //

original: the tshom gyi shes pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni the tshom dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: the tshom gyi shes pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni the tshom dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin te /

original: ci bdag med par yang 'khor ba yin nam /
analyzed: ci bdag med par yang 'khor ba yin nam /
translated: One wonders, ‚ÄúIs there cyclic existence without a self?

original: 'on te bdag yod pa yin snyam pa'o //
analyzed: 'on te bdag yod pa yin snyam pa'o //
translated: Or is there a self and cyclic existence?‚Äù

original: log par shes pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni bdag yod na ni 'khor bar 'gyur gyi bdag med na ni ma yin no zhes log par shes pa tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i ma rig pa bstan paüîΩyin no// @71a * //
analyzed: log par shes pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni bdag yod na ni 'khor bar 'gyur gyi bdag med na ni ma yin no zhes log par shes pa tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i ma rig pa bstan pa yin no// @71a * //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúendowed with a wrong consciousness‚Äù indicates that it is concomitant with the ignorance that is a wrong consciousness, which thinks, ‚ÄúIf there is a self, there is cyclic existence, but if there is no self, there is not.‚Äù

original: ma rig pa la spyod pa'i gnyen po ni 'di yin par mngon no //
analyzed: ma rig pa la spyod pa'i gnyen po ni 'di yin par mngon no //
translated: It is clear that this is the antidote to the activity of ignorance.

original: mi shes pa rnam par log na ni the tshom gyi shes pa dang / log par shes pa yang rnam par ldog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: mi shes pa rnam par log na ni the tshom gyi shes pa dang / log par shes pa yang rnam par ldog par 'gyur te /
translated: When ignorance is eliminated, the doubting consciousness and the wrong consciousness are also eliminated,

original: de kun nas bslang ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de kun nas bslang ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because they are motivated by ignorance.

original: de ltar de dag bstan pas ni mi shes pa dang / the tshom gyi shes pa dang log par shes pa rnams kun du 'byung ba rnam par ldog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar de dag bstan pas ni mi shes pa dang / the tshom gyi shes pa dang log par shes pa rnams kun du 'byung ba rnam par ldog par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, by teaching these, the arising of the ignorance, the knowledge of doubt, and wrong knowledge is completely stopped.

original: bsgom pa'i tshul gyis ni gtan nas ldog rnam par ldog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i tshul gyis ni gtan nas ldog rnam par ldog par 'gyur ro //

original: bdag ni bdag tu lta ba dang sred pa'i gnyen po'i phyir yin par mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni slob dpon rang gi bsam pa ston par byed do //
analyzed: bdag ni bdag tu lta ba dang sred pa'i gnyen po'i phyir yin par mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni slob dpon rang gi bsam pa ston par byed do //

original: de'i phyir de ltar na bdag med par sdug bsngal 'byung bar bstan pas stong pa nyid dang smon pa med pa dang / rjes su mthun par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar na bdag med par sdug bsngal 'byung bar bstan pas stong pa nyid dang smon pa med pa dang / rjes su mthun par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba smras te /

original: bdag med pa ni stong pa nyid dang / rjes su mthun par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag med pa ni stong pa nyid dang / rjes su mthun par bstan pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: de la stong pa nyid ni bdag med pa dang / stong pa'i rnam pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rnam pa yin no //

analyzed: sdug bsngal 'byung zhes bya ba ni smon pa med pa dang rjes su mthun par bstan pa'i phyir ro //

original: de yang stong pa nyid dang bdag med pa'i rnam pa gnyis dang / 'gog pa'i rnam pa rnams ma gtogs par mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal pa la sogs par mthong ba'i rnam pa can gyi ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: de yang stong pa nyid dang bdag med pa'i rnam pa gnyis dang / 'gog pa'i rnam pa rnams ma gtogs par mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal pa la sogs par mthong ba'i rnam pa can gyi ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: It is a concentration that has the aspects of seeing impermanence, suffering, etc., except for the two aspects of emptiness and selflessness and the aspect of cessation.

original: ci'i phyir mtshan ma med pa dang / rjes su mthun pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mtshan ma med pa dang / rjes su mthun pa ma yin zhe na /

original: 'di ltar 'di ni 'jug pa'i rim pa bstan pa brtsams pa yin gyi ldog pa'i rim pa ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di ni 'jug pa'i rim pa bstan pa brtsams pa yin gyi ldog pa'i rim pa ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because this is the teaching of the order of engagement, not the order of emergence.

original: de lta ma yin na rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum yin pas /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum yin pas /

analyzed: spyod pa'i bye brag gis gang zag bye brag tu bya ba'i phyir te /

original: bdag tu lta ba la spyod pa rnams dang / srid pa la sred pas spyod pa'i gdul bya rnams la bdag tu lta ba dang sred pa'i gnyen por 'di bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba la spyod pa rnams dang / srid pa la sred pas spyod pa'i gdul bya rnams la bdag tu lta ba dang sred pa'i gnyen por 'di bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is explained as the antidote to the view of self and craving for existence for disciples who engage in the view of self and craving for existence.

original: srid pa'i nyes pa ma rtogs pa rnams ni srid pa la sred pa lhag par 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: srid pa'i nyes pa ma rtogs pa rnams ni srid pa la sred pa lhag par 'byung bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba rnams ni nye bar len pa'i phung po rnams la bdag dang / @71b bdag gir mngon par zhen nas nyes pa ma mthong bas na mngon par zhen cing tshol bar byed do //
translated: Those who have the view of the perishable collection, through clinging to the appropriated aggregates as I and mine, do not see their faults and thus cling to them and seek them.

original: bdag tu lta ba mngon du song ba nyid kyis srid pa la srid pas yin par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba mngon du song ba nyid kyis srid pa la srid pas yin par khong du chud par bya'o //

translated: Previously, it was said that the aggregates are a mass of suffering.üîΩ

analyzed: sngar dgos pa ji ltar bstan pa bzhin du /

analyzed: dgos pa 'di yang yin par ci'i phyir mi 'dod /

original: dgos pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: dgos pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the purpose?üîΩTherefore, just as it is said in another s≈´tra,

original: de'i phyir ji skad du mdo gzhan las ji ltar 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos rnams yang dag pa ji lta ba de bzhin du yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis legs par mthong ba yin /üîΩlegs par rtogs par yid la byas /
analyzed: de'i phyir ji skad du mdo gzhan las ji ltar 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos rnams yang dag pa ji lta ba de bzhin du yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis legs par mthong ba yin / legs par rtogs par yid la byas /
translated: ‚ÄúHow is it that a learned noble disciple sees dependent origination and the phenomena that arise dependently just as they are with correct wisdom?üîΩHe correctly contemplates them.

original: legs par bstan /
analyzed: legs par bstan /

analyzed: legs par 'dris pa de ni ci bdag sngon gyi dus na byung ngam / ma byung ba yin /

original: sngon bdag ji lta bu zhig tu byung /
analyzed: sngon bdag ji lta bu zhig tu byung /

analyzed: bdag ji ltar byung bar gyur zhes de sngon gyi mthar rjes su 'brang ba ma yin /

original: ji lta bu zhig tu 'byung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhig tu 'byung bar 'gyur /

analyzed: de bzhin du k'a ty'a'i bu 'jig rten kun 'byung ba rnams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis ma mthong ba gang yin pa de ni 'jig rten la med pa nyid yin no zhes bya bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i
translated: Likewise, it would not be the case that the origin of the world is not seen by the perfect wisdom that is in accordance with reality, as KƒÅtyƒÅyana said:

original: bar du gsungs so //

analyzed: mdor na sngon gyi mtha' rdang phyi ma'i mtha' dang / dbus la rmongs pa bzlog pa dang / log par lta ba bzlog pa yang 'di'i dgos pa yin par bstan to //
translated: In brief, the purpose of this s≈´tra is to eliminate confusion about the prior limit, the later limit, and the middle, and to eliminate wrong views.

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis dgos pa yin par ma gsungs sam zhe na /

analyzed: 'dir bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan to zhes bya bas 'di skad bstan to //

original: gal te dgos pa'i rtsa ba brjod par bzhed pa ma yin na nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa yang lta ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu can du mi 'gyur ro //

translated: If the root purpose were not stated, then the affliction of affliction would not be the cause of the affliction of view.

original: de bas na 'jig tshogs la lta ba spangs pa'i phyir shing gi rtsa ba rgyas pa bcad pa bzhin du nyon mongs pa thams cad rnam par zhig par 'gyur zhing rim gyis mya ngan las 'das pa yang thob par 'gyur ro //

translated: Therefore, the arising of the later members in dependence on the earlier members is called dependent origination.

original: yan lag snga ma zhes bya ba ni sngar skyes pa la'o //
analyzed: yan lag snga ma zhes bya ba ni sngar skyes pa la'o //
translated: The earlier members are those that arise first.

original: brten nas zhes bya ba ni de yod na zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: brten nas zhes bya ba ni de yod na zhes bya ba yin te /

analyzed: rkyen de dang 'brel ba zhes bya ste /

original: yan lag snga ma 'jig pa'i bar du mchod pa ste /
analyzed: yan lag snga ma 'jig pa'i bar du mchod pa ste /

analyzed: rgyu 'jig pa dang 'bras bu'i bdag nyid kyi dus gnyis dus tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //

original: 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni rab tu skye ba'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni rab tu skye ba'o //

original: 'dir rten cing zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rgyu yod par ston par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir rten cing zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rgyu yod par ston par byed pa yin no //
translated: The term ‚Äúdependent‚Äù indicates that the cause exists.

original: 'brel pa'i sgra ni 'brel ba la bya'o ;
analyzed: 'brel pa'i sgra ni 'brel ba la bya'o ;

original: / de nyid kyi phyir 'di skad du rgyu yod na 'jig pa bar du ma chod par 'byung ba ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //

translated: Therefore, this is the meaning: ‚ÄúWhen the cause exists, the effect arises without interruption, and that is dependent origination.‚Äù

analyzed: de ltar byas na 'das pa las gang yang skye ba med do zhes bstan pa yin la /
translated: If this is the case, then nothing arises from the past.

original: 'bras bu'i dus na yang rgyu yod pa nyid du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i dus na yang rgyu yod pa nyid du mi 'gyur te /

translated: The activity of the causes that are co-operating causes, such as the shuttle, the thread, the water, and the weaver, is seen to give rise to the effect, the cloth, which does not exist.

original: skye ba'i gzhi 'jim gong rgyu ma tshang ba med pa rnams kyi byed pa yang de skye ba la mthong ba yin pas de la 'bras bu yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba grub pa yin no //üîΩgzhan yang 'di skyes pas zhes bya ba ni gzhan du yang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: skye ba'i gzhi 'jim gong rgyu ma tshang ba med pa rnams kyi byed pa yang de skye ba la mthong ba yin pas de la 'bras bu yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba grub pa yin no // gzhan yang 'di skyes pas zhes bya ba ni gzhan du yang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The activity of the lump of clay, the basis of the arising of the cloth, is also seen to give rise to the cloth. Therefore, the effect does not exist in it.

original: 'di skyes pas @77a * //
analyzed: 'di skyes pas @77a * //
translated: Moreover, the statement ‚Äúthis having arisen, that arises‚Äù means ‚Äúthat having arisen elsewhere, this arises.‚Äù

original: 'di skye ba ste zhes bya ba ma brjod na ni rgyu rtag pa dgag pa ma byas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di skye ba ste zhes bya ba ma brjod na ni rgyu rtag pa dgag pa ma byas par 'gyur te /
translated: If the statement ‚Äúthis having arisen, that arises‚Äù were not stated, the refutation of a permanent cause would not be accomplished.

original: skyes pa kho na rkyen gyis dngos por bstan pa'i phyir gtso bo dang skyes bu dang / dbang phyug dang / dus la rdul phra rab la sogs pa rtag pa rgyu yin pa rnams rab tu bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: skyes pa kho na rkyen gyis dngos por bstan pa'i phyir gtso bo dang skyes bu dang / dbang phyug dang / dus la rdul phra rab la sogs pa rtag pa rgyu yin pa rnams rab tu bkag pa yin no //
translated: The principal, the self, ƒ™≈õvara, time, the subtle particle, etc., which are permanent causes, are refuted.

original: 'di yod na 'di 'byung zhes bya ba ma brjod na ni nges par gtan la phab pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di yod na 'di 'byung zhes bya ba ma brjod na ni nges par gtan la phab pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is not said that when this exists, that comes to be, then the ascertainment is not definite.

original: gang skyes pas gang skye ba ni de kho na yod na de yod pa yin gyi bdag la sogs pa rtag pa las kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: gang skyes pas gang skye ba ni de kho na yod na de yod pa yin gyi bdag la sogs pa rtag pa las kyang ma yin te /
translated: When one thing arises due to the arising of another, it is only when that exists that it exists, not from a permanent self, etc.üîΩIf it were so, then the refutation of a permanent cause would not be made.

original: de lta na ni rgyu rtag pa dgag pa ma byas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni ji ltar bye brag pa dag na re ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi zhes bya ba bden te /
analyzed: de lta na ni rgyu rtag pa dgag pa ma byas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni ji ltar bye brag pa dag na re ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi zhes bya ba bden te /
translated: The Vai≈õe·π£ikas say: ‚ÄúIt is true that due to the condition of ignorance, formation arises, and due to the condition of birth, aging and death arise.

original: 'on kyang bdag yod na yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang bdag yod na yin no //
translated: However, it is when the self exists that they exist.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du dbang phyug la sogs pa rgyur smra ba dag dbang phyug la sogs pa yod na yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du dbang phyug la sogs pa rgyur smra ba dag dbang phyug la sogs pa yod na yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: In the same way, those who maintain that God, etc. are the cause say that if God, etc. exist, then all things are possible.

original: de'i phyir de lta na yang rgyu rtag pa dgag pa ma byas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de lta na yang rgyu rtag pa dgag pa ma byas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di smos so //
translated: Therefore, this is said: ‚ÄúEven so, the refutation of a permanent cause is not accomplished.‚Äù

original: mdor na don 'di lta ste sa bon la sogs pa rgyu mi rtag pa rnams zhing la sogs pa rgyu gzhan dang rjes su bsdongs pa'i rang gi mthu ni myu gu la sogs pa 'bras bu skye ba la rgyur 'gyur ba ni mngon sum du grub pa yin
analyzed: mdor na don 'di lta ste sa bon la sogs pa rgyu mi rtag pa rnams zhing la sogs pa rgyu gzhan dang rjes su bsdongs pa'i rang gi mthu ni myu gu la sogs pa 'bras bu skye ba la rgyur 'gyur ba ni mngon sum du grub pa yin
translated: In brief, this is the meaning: The power of impermanent causes, such as seeds, etc., in conjunction with other causes, such as fields, etc., is the cause of the arising of effects, such as sprouts, etc., and is established by direct perception.

original: te / rtag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: te / rtag pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not permanent.

original: lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu gzhan gyis yongs su zin pa'i rang gi mthu yang rtag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu gzhan gyis yongs su zin pa'i rang gi mthu yang rtag pa ma yin no //
translated: The power of the seed, etc., in conjunction with other cooperative causes is not permanent.üîΩAnother says that the other parts are taught in other s≈´tras.

original: gzhan na re yan lag gzhan dang gzhan ston pa yin zhe'o zhes bya ba ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan na re yan lag gzhan dang gzhan ston pa yin zhe'o zhes bya ba ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: ma rig pa yod na 'du byed 'byung ba yin la 'du byed rnams skyes pas rnam par shes pa skye ba yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa de bzhin du rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang po nas rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba mtha' dag gzung
analyzed: ma rig pa yod na 'du byed 'byung ba yin la 'du byed rnams skyes pas rnam par shes pa skye ba yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa de bzhin du rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang po nas rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba mtha' dag gzung
translated: When there is ignorance, the formative forces occur. When the formative forces have arisen, consciousness arises.

original: ba yin no //
analyzed: ba yin no //
translated: In this way, the entire dependent origination is grasped from beginning to end.

original: gzhan na re dum bu gsum rnam par bzhag pa yin no zhe'o zhes bya ba ni kha che rnam par smra ba dag yin te /
analyzed: gzhan na re dum bu gsum rnam par bzhag pa yin no zhe'o zhes bya ba ni kha che rnam par smra ba dag yin te /
translated: Others say that it is presented in three sections.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sngon dang phyi ma dang bar gyi mtha' la rmongs pa bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon dang phyi ma dang bar gyi mtha' la rmongs pa bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to counteract confusion about the beginning, end and middle.

original: 'di yod na 'di 'byung zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi mtha' yod pa na bar gyi mtha' yod pa yin no zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di yod na 'di 'byung zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi mtha' yod pa na bar gyi mtha' yod pa yin no zhes bya'o //
translated: When this exists, that comes to be means that when the prior limit exists, the middle limit exists.

original: 'di skyes pas 'di skye ba ste zhes bya ba ni bar gyi mtha' skyes pas phyi ma'i mtha' skye ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di skyes pas 'di skye ba ste zhes bya ba ni bar gyi mtha' skyes pas phyi ma'i mtha' skye ba yin no //
translated: From the arising of this, that arises means that when the middle limit has arisen, the subsequent limit arises.

original: de la ma rig pa dang 'du byed yan lag gnyis ni sngon gyi mtha' bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: de la ma rig pa dang 'du byed yan lag gnyis ni sngon gyi mtha' bsdus pa yin no //
translated: The two members ignorance and formative forces are included in the prior limit.

original: rnam par shes pa dang ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang sred pa dang len pa dang / srid pa dang yan lag brgyad ni bar gyi mthas bsdus pa yin @77b no ;
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang sred pa dang len pa dang / srid pa dang yan lag brgyad ni bar gyi mthas bsdus pa yin @77b no ;
translated: The eight members from consciousness to feeling are included in the middle.

original: / skye ba dang / rga shi yan lag gnyis ni phyi ma'i mthas bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: / skye ba dang / rga shi yan lag gnyis ni phyi ma'i mthas bsdus pa yin no //
translated: The two members birth and aging-and-death are included in the subsequent limit.

original: de la sngon gyi tshe 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i gnas skabs rnams ni ma rig pa'i sgras bstan te /
analyzed: de la sngon gyi tshe 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i gnas skabs rnams ni ma rig pa'i sgras bstan te /
translated: Among them, the states of passion, aversion, delusion, etc. in the past are indicated by the word ignorance,

original: dus 'das pa rnams mun pa'i rnam par gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus 'das pa rnams mun pa'i rnam par gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the past is characterized by darkness.

original: de nyid na bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dang mi g-yo ba'i las kyi gnas skabs rnams ni da ltar gyi skye ba mngon bar 'du byed pa'i don gyis 'du byed kyi sgras bstan to //
analyzed: de nyid na bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dang mi g-yo ba'i las kyi gnas skabs rnams ni da ltar gyi skye ba mngon bar 'du byed pa'i don gyis 'du byed kyi sgras bstan to //
translated: In that same text, the states of meritorious, nonmeritorious, and unshakable karma are taught by the term formations because they form the present birth.

original: da ltar skye ba'i tshe ma'i mngal du nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i phung po rnams ni rnam par shes pa yin te /
analyzed: da ltar skye ba'i tshe ma'i mngal du nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i phung po rnams ni rnam par shes pa yin te /
translated: The aggregates that link with the mother‚Äôs womb at the time of birth are consciousness.

original: nges pa'i tshig gi tshul gyis na skye ba'i don gyis de dag la rnam par shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig gi tshul gyis na skye ba'i don gyis de dag la rnam par shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In the sense of the meaning of birth, they are consciousness because they are consciousnesses that are born.

original: de'i 'og tu skye mched drug ma dod kyi bar du ming dang gzugs yin te /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu skye mched drug ma dod kyi bar du ming dang gzugs yin te /
translated: From that until the six sense bases are formed, it is name and form.

original: de tsam zhig skye bar rab tu bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de tsam zhig skye bar rab tu bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is taught because it is just that much that is clearly taught as being born.

original: de'i 'og tu gsum 'dus pa ma byung gi bar du mig la sogs pa'i dbang po mngon par grub pa ni skye mched drug yin te /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu gsum 'dus pa ma byung gi bar du mig la sogs pa'i dbang po mngon par grub pa ni skye mched drug yin te /
translated: From that until the three meeting has occurred, the faculties such as eyes that are fully formed are the six sense bases.

original: gzhi dang rten pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro//
analyzed: gzhi dang rten pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro//
translated: This is because the basis and the support are fully formed.

original: lus dang yid kyi skye mched gnyis ni ming dang gzugs kyi gnas skabs nyid na med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus dang yid kyi skye mched gnyis ni ming dang gzugs kyi gnas skabs nyid na med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the two media of body and mind do not exist in the state of name-and-form.

original: de'i 'og tu reg pa rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu reg pa rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: After that, contact is established,

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i rgyu kun yongs su gcod par nus pa yin te /
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i rgyu kun yongs su gcod par nus pa yin te /
translated: because the causes of pleasure, suffering, etc. are able to be discerned,

original: gnas yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir yin gyi rnam par shes pa dang ming dang gzugs kyi gnas skabs gnyis na reg pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gnas yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir yin gyi rnam par shes pa dang ming dang gzugs kyi gnas skabs gnyis na reg pa ni ma yin no //
translated: because the basis is complete, but not in the two states of consciousness and name-and-form.

original: de la brten nas tshor ba rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: de la brten nas tshor ba rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: After that, feeling is established,

original: kun du 'khrig pa'i 'dod chags kun nas 'byung ba'i phyir dang / rgyu yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir yin gyi /
analyzed: kun du 'khrig pa'i 'dod chags kun nas 'byung ba'i phyir dang / rgyu yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir yin gyi /
translated: because the cause is complete, and because the passion of sexual desire arises.

original: sngar yang tshor ba ni med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sngar yang tshor ba ni med pa ma yin no //
translated: But it is not the case that feeling does not exist previously.

original: de nas 'khrig pa nye bar spyod pa'i 'dod chags kun du 'byung ba'i gnas skabs na sred pa rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: de nas 'khrig pa nye bar spyod pa'i 'dod chags kun du 'byung ba'i gnas skabs na sred pa rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: After that, craving is established in the state in which the passion of sexual intercourse arises,

original: 'khrig pa'i longs spyod kyi bde ba de'i tshe 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khrig pa'i longs spyod kyi bde ba de'i tshe 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the pleasure of sexual union arises at that time.

original: de'i tshe longs spyod thob pa'i tshol ba byung ba na len pa rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe longs spyod thob pa'i tshol ba byung ba na len pa rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: When the search for the enjoyment of the objects of desire arises at that time, grasping is established.

original: de'i tshe 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang gti mug la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa yongs su smin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang gti mug la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa yongs su smin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because at that time the afflictions such as passion, hatred, and delusion are fully developed.

original: de nas srid pa rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: de nas srid pa rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: Then, becoming is established.

original: 'di ltar len pa'i rkyen gyis yang srid pa'i las rab tu sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar len pa'i rkyen gyis yang srid pa'i las rab tu sogs pa yin no //
translated: Because, conditioned by grasping, the karma that produces the new existence is set into motion.

original: de nas tshe phyi ma la yang srid par skye ba'i don gyis skye ba rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de nas tshe phyi ma la yang srid par skye ba'i don gyis skye ba rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Then, birth is established by the meaning of being born into the next life.

original: de nas rga shi yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas rga shi yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: Then, aging and death should be understood.

original: de dag tsam gyis don byas pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde ni ma rig pa la sogs pa de dag @78a * //
analyzed: de dag tsam gyis don byas pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde ni ma rig pa la sogs pa de dag @78a * //
translated: Because the purpose is accomplished by just those.üîΩThat is, the twelve members are established in the order in which they arise in the beginning, middle, and end of the three lifetimes.

original: rkyen yin pa'i tshig kho nas gnyi ga grub pas zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste yan lag gzhan dang gzhan dum bu gsum rnam par gzhag pa yang zhes ston to //
analyzed: rkyen yin pa'i tshig kho nas gnyi ga grub pas zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste yan lag gzhan dang gzhan dum bu gsum rnam par gzhag pa yang zhes ston to //
translated: The words ‚Äúbecause of the word ‚Äòcondition‚Äô both are established‚Äù show that the three segments are established as other members.

original: ji ltar yan lag gzhan dang gzhan 'grub ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar yan lag gzhan dang gzhan 'grub ce na /
translated: How are the other members established?

original: 'di ltar ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed /
analyzed: 'di ltar ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed /
translated: Thus, ‚Äúwith ignorance as condition there are the karmic predispositions,‚Äù

original: 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba nas /
translated: ‚Äúwith the karmic predispositions as condition there is consciousness,‚Äù

original: skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi zhes smos pa yin no //
analyzed: skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi zhes smos pa yin no //
translated: and so on up to ‚Äúwith birth as condition there is old age and death.‚Äù

original: dum bu gsum rnam par gzhag pa yang 'grub pa yin te /
analyzed: dum bu gsum rnam par gzhag pa yang 'grub pa yin te /
translated: The three segments are also established.

original: 'di ltar ma rig pa 'du byed ni sngon gyi mtha'i dum bu yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar ma rig pa 'du byed ni sngon gyi mtha'i dum bu yin no //
translated: Thus, ignorance and the karmic predispositions are the segment of the past.

original: rnam par shes pa nas srid pa'i bar ni bar gyi mtha'i dum bu yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa nas srid pa'i bar ni bar gyi mtha'i dum bu yin no //
translated: Consciousness up to existence are the segment of the present.

original: skye ba dang rga shi ni phyi ma'i mtha'i dum bu yin pas so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa der yang yan lag gzhan dang gzhan dum bu gsum rnam par gzhag pa med pas gnyis mi brjod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni spre'u lta bu'i
analyzed: skye ba dang rga shi ni phyi ma'i mtha'i dum bu yin pas so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa der yang yan lag gzhan dang gzhan dum bu gsum rnam par gzhag pa med pas gnyis mi brjod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni spre'u lta bu'i
translated: But since the other members are not arranged in three parts, it would follow that two members would not be mentioned.

original: mdo sde las so //
analyzed: mdo sde las so //
translated: This is like the simian argument.

original: ji ltar yan lag gzhan dang gzhan med pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar yan lag gzhan dang gzhan med pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that there are no other members?

original: yan lag bcu gnyis rjod par mi bzhed pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: yan lag bcu gnyis rjod par mi bzhed pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: Because it does not mention twelve members.

original: / de nyid kyi phyir dum bu gsum rnam par gzhag pa yang med par 'grub pa yin no //
analyzed: / de nyid kyi phyir dum bu gsum rnam par gzhag pa yang med par 'grub pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is established that the arrangement in three parts does not exist.üîΩThe meaning of the condition as direct antecedent and the condition as cause is taught.

original: mngon sum dang brgyud pa'i rkyen gyi dngos po ston pa yin no zhes bya ba ni 'di yod na 'di 'byung zhes bya ba ni mngon sum gyi rkyen gyi dngos po ston te /
analyzed: mngon sum dang brgyud pa'i rkyen gyi dngos po ston pa yin no zhes bya ba ni 'di yod na 'di 'byung zhes bya ba ni mngon sum gyi rkyen gyi dngos po ston te /
translated: The meaning of the condition as direct antecedent is taught in the statement, ‚ÄúWhen this exists, that comes to be.‚Äù

original: ji ltar ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: ji ltar ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed ces bya ba ste /
translated: The meaning of the condition as cause is taught in the statement, ‚ÄúWith ignorance as condition, there are volitions.‚Äù

original: ma rig pa las de ma thag tu de dag 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma rig pa las de ma thag tu de dag 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they arise immediately after ignorance.

original: 'di skyes pas 'di skye ba ste zhes bya ba ni brgyud pa'i rkyen gyi dngos po ston te /
analyzed: 'di skyes pas 'di skye ba ste zhes bya ba ni brgyud pa'i rkyen gyi dngos po ston te /
translated: The phrase because this arises, that arises indicates the nature of a condition as a sequence.

original: 'di ltar 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: For example, with formations as a condition, there is consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa la sogs pa la ni ma rig pa brgyud ba'i sgo nas rkyen gyi dngos por 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa la sogs pa la ni ma rig pa brgyud ba'i sgo nas rkyen gyi dngos por 'gyur te /
translated: Ignorance is a condition for formations and so on, in the sense of a sequential condition.

original: 'bras bu la sa bon bzhin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu la sa bon bzhin no //
translated: It is like a seed in relation to a fruit.

original: 'di ltar gang de skyes pa ma yin na ni de'i rkyen gyis 'du byed kyang ma yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang de skyes pa ma yin na ni de'i rkyen gyis 'du byed kyang ma yin la /
translated: For example, if a seed does not exist, a fruit does not arise from that seed as a condition.

original: 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes par yang mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes par yang mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: If formations do not exist, consciousness does not arise with formations as a condition.

original: rga shi'i bar du yang rgyas par sbyar ro zhe na /
analyzed: rga shi'i bar du yang rgyas par sbyar ro zhe na /
translated: The same should be applied extensively to aging and death.

original: de dag dgag pa yang de nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni de ni ma rig pa la sogs pa de dag rkyen yin pa'i tshig kho nas gnyi ga grub pas zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag dgag pa yang de nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni de ni ma rig pa la sogs pa de dag rkyen yin pa'i tshig kho nas gnyi ga grub pas zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The phrase the refutation of these is also the same indicates that both are established by the statement that ignorance and so on are conditions.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed ces bya bas ni mngon sum gyi dngos po bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed ces bya bas ni mngon sum gyi dngos po bstan pa yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúwith ignorance as condition there are volitions‚Äù indicates the direct condition.

original: de'i rkyen can gyi 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa zhes bya bas ni brgyud pa'i rkyen gyi dngos po nges par byas pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i rkyen can gyi 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa zhes bya bas ni brgyud pa'i rkyen gyi dngos po nges par byas pa yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúwith volitions as condition: consciousness‚Äù indicates the indirect condition.üîΩThe Monkey Sutta also states:

analyzed: spre'u lta bu'i mdo las kyang srid pa na mngon @78b sum gyi rkyen gyi dngos po ni bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i reg pa la brten nas bde ba'i tshor ba skye'o zhes bya ba de la sogs pa gsungs pa'i phyir brgyud pa'i rkyen gyi dngos po yod

original: pa ma yin pas /

original: gzhan dag na re tshig dang pos ni rgyun gyis rgyu gnas pa sngon du song ba'i 'bras bu gnas pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rgyun gyis zhes smras te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re tshig dang pos ni rgyun gyis rgyu gnas pa sngon du song ba'i 'bras bu gnas pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rgyun gyis zhes smras te /

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /

analyzed: ji srid du rgyun gyis rgyu gnas par 'dug pa de srid du rgyun kho nas 'bras bu gnas pa yin no //

original: rgyun gyis zhes smos pa ni skad cig ma ni gzhan du gnas par mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyun gyis zhes smos pa ni skad cig ma ni gzhan du gnas par mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúcontinuum‚Äù is mentioned because it is not logical that an instant endures.

original: 'dir rgyu 'bras 'brel pa la rgyun gyis sgras bstan to //
analyzed: 'dir rgyu 'bras 'brel pa la rgyun gyis sgras bstan to //
translated: Here, the connection between cause and effect is indicated by the word ‚Äúcontinuum.‚ÄùüîΩSince it is not known by what cause that enduring of the effect is, the second line is stated: ‚ÄúFrom the arising of this, that arises.‚Äù

original: 'bras bu gnas pa de yang rgyu gang gis yin pa mi shes pas de'i phyir gnyis pas ni zhes bya ba ni 'di skyes pas 'di skye ba ste zhes bya ba yin te /

original: rgyu skyes pas 'bras bu skye ba yin no zhes smra'o zhe na der rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba brtsams pa la gnas pa 'chad pa 'brel ba ci yod ces bya ba ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: rgyu skyes pas 'bras bu skye ba yin no zhes smra'o zhe na der rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba brtsams pa la gnas pa 'chad pa 'brel ba ci yod ces bya ba ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid ni rnam pa gsum ste /

analyzed: skye ba dang 'jig pa dang gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba'o //

analyzed: de la rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba gnas par 'chad pa'i skabs 'brel ba yod pa ma yin te /

original: skabs ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skabs ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not the context.üîΩBut if that also is just arising,

original: 'on te de yang skye ba kho na yin na ni zhes bya ba la de yang zhes bya ba ni gnas pa la sbyar te skad cig ma la ni gzhan du gnas pa yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'on te de yang skye ba kho na yin na ni zhes bya ba la de yang zhes bya ba ni gnas pa la sbyar te skad cig ma la ni gzhan du gnas pa yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //

original: de ltar byas na der rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba brtsams pa la gnas pa 'chad pa 'brel ba ci yod ces bya ba de'i lan btab pa yin te /

original: gnas pa ni skye ba'i rnam grangs yin pa'i phyir gnas pa yang khongs su gtogs pa kho na yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na de'i phyir slob dpon gyis 'di yod na 'di 'byung 'di skyes pas 'di skye zhes bya ba'i tshig gnyis la don la bye brag ciüîΩyod ces smras so //
analyzed: gnas pa ni skye ba'i rnam grangs yin pa'i phyir gnas pa yang khongs su gtogs pa kho na yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na de'i phyir slob dpon gyis 'di yod na 'di 'byung 'di skyes pas 'di skye zhes bya ba'i tshig gnyis la don la bye brag ciüîΩyod ces smras so //
translated: is that abiding is a synonym for arising, and because abiding is included in arising, there is no difference in meaning between the two phrases, ‚ÄúWhen this exists, that arises‚Äù and ‚ÄúFrom the arising of this, that arises.‚ÄùüîΩTherefore the master says, ‚ÄúWhat is the difference in meaning between these two phrases?‚Äù

original: gnyi gas kyang rgyu sngon du song ba can gyi skye ba yin par bstan pas so //
analyzed: gnyi gas kyang rgyu sngon du song ba can gyi skye ba yin par bstan pas so //

original: gal te rgyun thog mar skyes pa'i bye brag la brten nas 'di dag smra na de'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te rgyun thog mar skyes pa'i bye brag la brten nas 'di dag smra na de'i phyir /

analyzed: gal te rgyun skyes pa dang gnas pa yin snga ma skyes pa skye ba yin te /
translated: If the arising of the continuum and the endurance of the continuum are the arising of the former and the endurance of the former,

analyzed: sngar skye la phyis gnas pa yin pas skye ba ma bshad par gnas pa'i dus ci'i phyir bshad ces bya ba smras te /
translated: why is the time of endurance explained without explaining the arising?

original: sngar skye la zhes bya ba ni dang por skyes pa'o //
analyzed: sngar skye la zhes bya ba ni dang por skyes pa'o //
translated: Arising earlier refers to arising first.

original: phyis gnas pa yin pas zhes bya ba ni rgyun gyi skyes pa sngon du song ba can gyi rgyun gyis gnas @79a * //
analyzed: phyis gnas pa yin pas zhes bya ba ni rgyun gyi skyes pa sngon du song ba can gyi rgyun gyis gnas @79a * //
translated: Endurance later refers to the endurance of the continuum that is preceded by the arising of the continuum.

original: pa yin pas dus log par 'chad pa rigs pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: pa yin pas dus log par 'chad pa rigs pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Therefore it is illogical to explain the time in a confused way.

original: 'di skyes pas 'di skye zhing 'di yod na 'di 'byung zhes bya ba ni rigs par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di skyes pas 'di skye zhing 'di yod na 'di 'byung zhes bya ba ni rigs par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: It is logical to say, ‚ÄúThis arises due to the arising of that‚Äù and ‚ÄúThis occurs when that exists.‚Äù

original: nur nur po dang nar nar po la sogs pa dang / zho dang 'o ma la sogs pa yang skyes te gnas pa yin na rgyu gang zhig gnas pa yod na yod do zhes 'di brjod par bya zhes bya ba ni nar nar po dang nur nur po la sogs pa la ma gtogs pa rgyu gnas sngon du songüîΩba can nam /
analyzed: nur nur po dang nar nar po la sogs pa dang / zho dang 'o ma la sogs pa yang skyes te gnas pa yin na rgyu gang zhig gnas pa yod na yod do zhes 'di brjod par bya zhes bya ba ni nar nar po dang nur nur po la sogs pa la ma gtogs pa rgyu gnas sngon du song ba can nam /
translated: This is stated because the cause that exists prior to the kalala, arbuda and so on, or the cause that exists prior to milk, curd and so on, is not separate from the kalala, arbuda and so on, or milk, curd and so on.

original: 'o ma dang zho la sogs pa ma gtogs pa rgyu gnas pa sngon du song ba can gyi nur nur po dang nar nar po la sogs pa'am zho dang 'o ma la sogs pa gnas pa ni yod pa ma yin te /üîΩnur nur po rnam par zhig na nar nar por 'gyur /

translated: The kalala and arbuda and so on that exist prior to the cause that exists, or the milk, curd and so on that exist prior to the cause that exists, do not exist.üîΩWhen the kalala disintegrates, it becomes the arbuda.

original: nar nar po rnam par zhig na gor gor por 'gyur /
analyzed: nar nar po rnam par zhig na gor gor por 'gyur /
translated: When the arbuda disintegrates, it becomes the pe≈õƒ´.

original: gor gor po rnam par zhig na mkhrang por 'gyur ba yin la 'o ma zhig na zhor 'gyur zhing zho zhig na dar bar 'gyur ba la sogs pa yin na de'i phyir 'dir rgyu gnas pa gang yin pa brjod par bya dgos la gang gi phyir nar nar
analyzed: gor gor po rnam par zhig na mkhrang por 'gyur ba yin la 'o ma zhig na zhor 'gyur zhing zho zhig na dar bar 'gyur ba la sogs pa yin na de'i phyir 'dir rgyu gnas pa gang yin pa brjod par bya dgos la gang gi phyir nar nar
translated: Therefore, you must state what is the cause of endurance here.

original: po la sogs pa'i rgyun gyi mtshan nyid gnas pa yin zhes bya /üîΩgang yang rgyu zas la sogs pa gnas pa sngon du song ba can gyi nur nur po dang nar nar po la sogs pa gnas pa yin no zhes brjod na yang zas la sogs pa'i rkyen ji srid du rjes su 'jug pa de srid du nur nur po
analyzed: po la sogs pa'i rgyun gyi mtshan nyid gnas pa yin zhes bya / gang yang rgyu zas la sogs pa gnas pa sngon du song ba can gyi nur nur po dang nar nar po la sogs pa gnas pa yin no zhes brjod na yang zas la sogs pa'i rkyen ji srid du rjes su 'jug pa de srid du nur nur po
translated: If you say that endurance is the characteristic of the continuum of the oval shape and so on,üîΩthen even the endurance of the oval shape and so on that is preceded by the endurance of its cause, such as food, would be the endurance of the continuum of the oval shape and so on.üîΩBut if you say that the oval shape and so on endure for as long as the conditions of food and so on continue to operate,

original: dang nar nar po la sogs pa de dag gnas pa yin par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: dang nar nar po la sogs pa de dag gnas pa yin par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: then it follows that the oval shape and so on would endure for as long as the conditions of food and so on continue to operate.

original: de ni 'dod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni 'dod pa ma yin no //
translated: But that is unacceptable.

original: de bas na rgyu gang zhig gnas pa yod na yod do zhes 'dir brjod par bya grib ma dang 'od dang / autpal la sogs pa rgyu gnas pa sngon du song ba can gyi gnas pa yin par mthong ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: de bas na rgyu gang zhig gnas pa yod na yod do zhes 'dir brjod par bya grib ma dang 'od dang / autpal la sogs pa rgyu gnas pa sngon du song ba can gyi gnas pa yin par mthong ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But isn‚Äôt it seen that the existence of a shadow, light, a lotus, etc., is preceded by the existence of their causes?

analyzed: mthong ba ni bden te yod pa ma yin par yang rgyu gnas na 'bras bu gnas pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is seen, but it is not the case that when a cause exists, its effect exists, because it is seen that when a cause does not exist, its effect exists.

original: 'di yod na 'di 'byung zhes nges par brjod par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di yod na 'di 'byung zhes nges par brjod par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: It is not certain that when this exists, that arises.

original: tshogs pa'am rkyen sngar byung bas grib ma dang / 'od dang autpa la la sogs pa yin pas de dag rgyu gnas pa sngon du song ba can gyi gnas pa yin par yang ma grub pa yin no zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshogs pa'am rkyen sngar byung bas grib ma dang / 'od dang autpa la la sogs pa yin pas de dag rgyu gnas pa sngon du song ba can gyi gnas pa yin par yang ma grub pa yin no zhes bya'o //
translated: Since a shadow, light, a lotus, etc., arise from the prior collection or condition, it is not established that their existence is preceded by the existence of their causes.

original: pha rol po dag na re zhes bya ba ni tshig dang po kun gyis rnam pa gzhan bstan pa yin no snyam du sems na'o na ni rgyu med pa can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pha rol po dag na re zhes bya ba ni tshig dang po kun gyis rnam pa gzhan bstan pa yin no snyam du sems na'o na ni rgyu med pa can du 'gyur ro //
translated: If you think that the opponent says this because he thinks that the first statement teaches a different kind of existence, then the existence of the effect would be causeless.

original: ci zhe na 'bras bu skye ba'o /
analyzed: ci zhe na 'bras bu skye ba'o /
translated: What? The effect arises.

original: 'di ltar 'di skyes pas 'di skye ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di skyes pas 'di skye ba ste /
translated: Thus, because this arises, that arises.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu yod na rgyu 'jig par smra'o zhes grags @79b pa yin no zhe na'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu yod na rgyu 'jig par smra'o zhes grags @79b pa yin no zhe na'o //
translated: Therefore, it is well known that the cause perishes when the effect exists.

original: 'bras bu rgyu med pa can nyid yin par ji ltar dogs she na /
analyzed: 'bras bu rgyu med pa can nyid yin par ji ltar dogs she na /
translated: How can it be suspected that the effect is without a cause?

original: rgyu'i tshig med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rgyu'i tshig med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the word cause is not stated.

original: ji ltar rgyu 'jig pa'i rgyu ni smras kyi 'bras bu skye ba'i ni ma smras pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar rgyu 'jig pa'i rgyu ni smras kyi 'bras bu skye ba'i ni ma smras pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The cause of the destruction of the cause is stated, but the cause of the arising of the effect is not stated.

original: gzhan du bstan pa med pa la gzhan du ston pa ni rang dga'i tshig tsam du zad de mdo ma yin pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba ni ;
analyzed: gzhan du bstan pa med pa la gzhan du ston pa ni rang dga'i tshig tsam du zad de mdo ma yin pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba ni ;
translated: The statement that the effect exists when the cause perishes is mere sophistry, because it is not taught elsewhere, and because it is not a s≈´tra.

original: 'di yod na 'di 'byung zhes bya bas 'dir gzhan du bstan pa med de gzhan du bstan pa med pa kho na la 'bras bu yod na rgyu 'jig go zhes gzhan du ston te /
analyzed: 'di yod na 'di 'byung zhes bya bas 'dir gzhan du bstan pa med de gzhan du bstan pa med pa kho na la 'bras bu yod na rgyu 'jig go zhes gzhan du ston te /
translated: The statement ‚ÄúWhen this exists, that arises‚Äù is not taught elsewhere, and it is taught elsewhere that the effect exists when the cause perishes, but only where it is not taught.

original: 'bras bu yod na rgyu 'jig go zhes ston pa ni rang gi tshig tsam du zad do //
analyzed: 'bras bu yod na rgyu 'jig go zhes ston pa ni rang gi tshig tsam du zad do //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThe effect exists when the cause perishes‚Äù is mere sophistry.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na mdo ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na mdo ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Why? Because it is not a s≈´tra.

original: mdo las ni 'bras bu yod na rgyu 'jig par bstan pa ma yin gyi 'o na ci zhe na rgyu yod na 'bras bu yod pa kho nar bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: mdo las ni 'bras bu yod na rgyu 'jig par bstan pa ma yin gyi 'o na ci zhe na rgyu yod na 'bras bu yod pa kho nar bstan pa yin te /
translated: The s≈´tra does not teach that if the effect exists, the cause ceases, but rather it teaches that if the cause exists, the effect exists.

original: 'di yod na 'di 'byung 'di skyes pas 'di skye ba ste /
analyzed: 'di yod na 'di 'byung 'di skyes pas 'di skye ba ste /
translated: If this exists, that arises; due to the arising of this, that arises.

original: 'di lta ste ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed ces bya ba nas /
analyzed: 'di lta ste ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed ces bya ba nas /
translated: For example, due to the condition of ignorance, formation arises, and so on, up to

original: skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: due to the condition of birth, aging and death arise.

original: gal te 'bras bu yod na rgyu 'jig par 'gyur ba la dgongs pa yin na ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu yod na rgyu 'jig par 'gyur ba la dgongs pa yin na ni 'di lta ste /
translated: If it is the intention that if the effect exists, the cause ceases, then it would say,

analyzed: 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis ma rig pa 'jig par 'gyur zhes gsungs par 'gyur ro //
translated: due to the condition of formation, ignorance ceases.

original: rgyu zhig pa skye ba ma yin la 'bras bu la brten pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu zhig pa skye ba ma yin la 'bras bu la brten pa yang ma yin te /
translated: A ceased cause does not arise and it is not the basis of the effect.

original: skad cig ma'i chos 'jig pa la rkyen med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba zhes bya ba yin na ;
analyzed: skad cig ma'i chos 'jig pa la rkyen med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba zhes bya ba yin na ;

original: rgyu 'jig pa ni skye ba ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu 'jig pa ni skye ba ma yin te /
translated: The destruction of a cause is not a birth,

original: 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid du chud pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid du chud pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is included among the characteristics of conditioned phenomena.

original: skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir 'bras bu la brten pa ma yin na /
analyzed: skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir 'bras bu la brten pa ma yin na /
translated: If it is not dependent on an effect because it is momentary,

analyzed: 'di ji ltar rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba yin /
translated: how can it be dependent origination?

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba 'chad par rtsom pa la 'jig pa ston pa 'brel ba ci yod ces bya ba ni 'brel ba yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba 'chad par rtsom pa la 'jig pa ston pa 'brel ba ci yod ces bya ba ni 'brel ba yod pa ma yin te /
translated: What is the connection between the explanation of dependent origination and the teaching on destruction?

original: skabs ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skabs ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no connection, because it is not the right occasion.

original: skad cig ma'i chos 'jig pha la rkyen yod na skyon ci yod ce na /
analyzed: skad cig ma'i chos 'jig pha la rkyen yod na skyon ci yod ce na /
translated: If there is a condition for the destruction of momentary phenomena, what is wrong with that?

original: skad cig ma 'jig pa la gnod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: skad cig ma 'jig pa la gnod par 'gyur te /

analyzed: 'bras bu'i skad cig ma'i tshe rgyu yod pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //

original: rgyu'i gnas skabs na 'bras bu skye bzhin pa yin la rgyu 'jig pa'i gnas skabs na 'bras bu skyes pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: rgyu'i gnas skabs na 'bras bu skye bzhin pa yin la rgyu 'jig pa'i gnas skabs na 'bras bu skyes pa ma yin nam /
translated: At the time of the cause, the effect is in the process of arising. At the time of the cessation of the cause, the effect has arisen.

analyzed: gal te de lta na 'o na ni 'bras bu ni rgyu 'jig pa'i rgyu yin par 'grub par mi 'gyur te /

analyzed: skye bzhin pa'i gnas skabs ni med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //

original: rgyu 'jig bzhin pa'i gnas skabs kyang @80a * //
analyzed: rgyu 'jig bzhin pa'i gnas skabs kyang @80a * //
translated: How could the time of the cessation of the cause

analyzed: 'bras bu'i rgyu yin par ji 'gyur te /
