original: 'jig bzhin pa'i gnas skabs ni yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'jig bzhin pa'i gnas skabs ni yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the time of cessation is not existent.

original: da ltar gyi dngos po ni 'jig pa la mngon du phyogs pa'i phyir 'jig bzhin pa'i gnas skabs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: da ltar gyi dngos po ni 'jig pa la mngon du phyogs pa'i phyir 'jig bzhin pa'i gnas skabs zhes bya'o //
translated: The present thing is called the time of cessation because it is directed toward cessation.

original: phyis de ma thag tu 'bras bu skad cig ma 'byung bar 'gyur ba ni 'bras bu skye bzhin pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: phyis de ma thag tu 'bras bu skad cig ma 'byung bar 'gyur ba ni 'bras bu skye bzhin pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The moment immediately after that, the effect arises in a moment, which is called the arising of the effect.

original: skye bzhin pa yin pa ltar skye bzhin pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye bzhin pa yin pa ltar skye bzhin pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The effect that arises in the very next moment is called ‚Äúarising,‚Äù because it is as if it were arising.

original: gal te don 'di yin par gyur na ni zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu yod na rgyu 'jig par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smras pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gal te don 'di yin par gyur na ni zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu yod na rgyu 'jig par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smras pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: If this were the meaning, then the cause would cease if the effect exists, as you have stated.

original: de ltar byas na shin tu don gsal bar khong du chud par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni 'di mi 'byung ba ni 'di mi 'byung zhes bya ba rnam par 'jig pa 'di'i tshig yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar byas na shin tu don gsal bar khong du chud par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni 'di mi 'byung ba ni 'di mi 'byung zhes bya ba rnam par 'jig pa 'di'i tshig yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it were so, then the meaning would be very clear, because this statement ‚Äúif this does not occur, that does not occur‚Äù is a statement of the destruction of this.

original: de ltar ma byas na gtan la phebs par mi 'gyur te /üîΩci 'bras bu yod na rgyu 'jig pa yin nam /
analyzed: de ltar ma byas na gtan la phebs par mi 'gyur te / ci 'bras bu yod na rgyu 'jig pa yin nam /
translated: If it were not so, it would not be established.üîΩWould the cause cease if the effect exists?

original: 'on te rgyu yod na 'bras bu yin zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te rgyu yod na 'bras bu yin zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Or would the effect exist if the cause exists?

original: ji ltar reg pa dang / tshor ba'am myu gu dang grib ma lta bu'i zhes bya ba ni lhan cig 'byung ba'i rkyen gyis zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: ji ltar reg pa dang / tshor ba'am myu gu dang grib ma lta bu'i zhes bya ba ni lhan cig 'byung ba'i rkyen gyis zhes sbyar ro //
translated: arise together, so too do the members of dependent origination.üîΩThe first two examples are well known in the world.

original: de la dpe gnyis ni 'jig rten na grags pa tha dad pas bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de la dpe gnyis ni 'jig rten na grags pa tha dad pas bstan pa yin no //
translated: The third and fourth examples are from the sutras.üîΩThe third example is from the Sutra on Dependent Origination, which states:

original: ji ltar srid pa las skye ba lta bu dang sa bon las myu gu lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni ci zhe na /üîΩrkyen sngar skyes pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar srid pa las skye ba lta bu dang sa bon las myu gu lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni ci zhe na / rkyen sngar skyes pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Just as arising occurs from existence, and a sprout from a seed.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i mdo 'dir ni de dag 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i mdo 'dir ni de dag 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: The fourth example is from the Sutra on the Parable of the Wolf, which states:

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: Just as a wolf is born from a wolf, a dog from a dog, and a hyena from a hyena.

original: 'di las ni lhan cig 'byung ba'i rkyen kyang yod de /
analyzed: 'di las ni lhan cig 'byung ba'i rkyen kyang yod de /
translated: The first example is from the Sutra on Dependent Origination, which states:

original: ji ltar tshor ba'i reg ba lta bu'o //üîΩsngar byung ba yang yod de /
analyzed: ji ltar tshor ba'i reg ba lta bu'o // sngar byung ba yang yod de /
translated: Just as feeling arises from contact.üîΩThe second example is from the Sutra on Dependent Origination, which states:

original: ji ltar skye ba'i srid pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji ltar skye ba'i srid pa lta bu'o //
translated: Just as existence arises from grasping.

original: spre'u lta bu'i mdo las ni 'grub par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: spre'u lta bu'i mdo las ni 'grub par mi 'gyur te /
translated: The third example is from the Sutra on the Parable of the Wolf, which states:üîΩJust as a wolf is born from a wolf, a dog from a dog, and a hyena from a hyena.

original: lhan cig 'byung ba'i rkyen kho na bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i reg pa la brten nas bde ba'i tshor ba skye'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba'i rkyen kho na bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i reg pa la brten nas bde ba'i tshor ba skye'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said, ‚ÄúFeeling of pleasure arises in dependence on contact that is a condition for the experience of pleasure.‚Äù

original: de dag ni tshig dang po med par yang smra ba gnyi ga dgag pa 'grub pas de dag ni don ma yin no zhes bya ba la tshig dang po ni 'di yod na 'di 'byung zhes gang gsungs pa de yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni tshig dang po med par yang smra ba gnyi ga dgag pa 'grub pas de dag ni don ma yin no zhes bya ba la tshig dang po ni 'di yod na 'di 'byung zhes gang gsungs pa de yin no //
translated: Since both assertions are established without the first phrase, those are not the meanings of the first phrase. The first phrase is ‚ÄúWhen this exists, that exists.‚Äù

original: 'di skyes pas 'di skye zhes bya ba 'di kho nas rgyu med pa dang / rgyu rtag par smra ba dgag pa 'grub par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di skyes pas 'di skye zhes bya ba 'di kho nas rgyu med pa dang / rgyu rtag par smra ba dgag pa 'grub par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the statement ‚ÄúWhen this arises, that arises‚Äù alone establishes the refutation of the assertion of causeless arising and the assertion of permanent causes.

original: ma spangs pa'i phyir dang / mi rtag pa'i rkyen las skye ba'i don gyis tshig gnyis smos te zhes rgyas par 'byung ba la ma rig pa la sogs pa ma spangs pa'i rkyen las skye ba'i don gyis 'di yod na 'di 'byung zhes bya ba'i tshig dang po 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: ma spangs pa'i phyir dang / mi rtag pa'i rkyen las skye ba'i don gyis tshig gnyis smos te zhes rgyas par 'byung ba la ma rig pa la sogs pa ma spangs pa'i rkyen las skye ba'i don gyis 'di yod na 'di 'byung zhes bya ba'i tshig dang po 'di gsungs so //
translated: Because they are not abandoned and because they arise from the condition of impermanence, two phrases are stated.üîΩThe first phrase, ‚ÄúWhen this exists, that comes to be,‚Äù is stated because they arise from the condition of not abandoning ignorance and so on.

original: mi @80b rtag pa kho na las skye ba'i don gyis 'di skyes pas 'di skye ba ste zhes bya ba'i tshig gnyis pa gsungs so //
analyzed: mi @80b rtag pa kho na las skye ba'i don gyis 'di skyes pas 'di skye ba ste zhes bya ba'i tshig gnyis pa gsungs so //
translated: The second phrase, ‚ÄúFrom the arising of that, this arises,‚Äù is stated because they arise from the meaning of impermanence alone.

original: mdo'i don 'di yin te mi rtag pa'i don 'di las skye yang ma spangs pa las yin gyi thams cad las ma yin no //
analyzed: mdo'i don 'di yin te mi rtag pa'i don 'di las skye yang ma spangs pa las yin gyi thams cad las ma yin no //
translated: The meaning of the sutra is this: Although they arise from this meaning of impermanence, they arise from that which is not abandoned, not from everything.

original: ji skad du phra rgyas ma spangs pa'i phyir dang yul so sor nye bar gnas pa'i phyir zhes rgyas par gsungs te /
analyzed: ji skad du phra rgyas ma spangs pa'i phyir dang yul so sor nye bar gnas pa'i phyir zhes rgyas par gsungs te /
translated: As it is said, ‚ÄúBecause negative tendencies are not abandoned and because objects are present,‚Äù and so on.

original: srid pa'i yan lag gi dbang du byas te ma spangs pa bstan to //
analyzed: srid pa'i yan lag gi dbang du byas te ma spangs pa bstan to //
translated: This teaches that they are not abandoned from the perspective of the links of existence.

original: 'on kyang dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa dang ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dang / de la dmigs pa'i 'dun pa dang 'dod chags ma spangs pa ni skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin no zhes ston pa ni 'di yod na 'di 'byung zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa dang ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dang / de la dmigs pa'i 'dun pa dang 'dod chags ma spangs pa ni skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin no zhes ston pa ni 'di yod na 'di 'byung zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúwhen this exists, that comes to be‚Äù teaches that they are homogeneous causes when they are not abandoned.

original: ma spangs pa'i phyir zhes bstan pa yin par ji ltar mngon zhe na /
analyzed: ma spangs pa'i phyir zhes bstan pa yin par ji ltar mngon zhe na /
translated: How do we know that the phrase ‚Äúbecause they are not abandoned‚Äù is taught?

original: de'i phyir yod na zhes bya ba ni ma spangs pa la bya ste zhes bya bar rgyas par smras so //
analyzed: de'i phyir yod na zhes bya ba ni ma spangs pa la bya ste zhes bya bar rgyas par smras so //
translated: Therefore he says, ‚ÄúWhen this exists‚Äù means when it is not abandoned.

original: ci 'dod pa dang / 'dun pa yod bzhin du zhes bya ba ni ma spangs bzhin du zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ci 'dod pa dang / 'dun pa yod bzhin du zhes bya ba ni ma spangs bzhin du zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúwhen desire and aspiration exist‚Äù means when they are not abandoned.

original: g-yo ba med pa'i rkyen byung ba'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni spyod pa med pa dang / bya ba byed pa med pa'i rkyen las byung ba'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba'i don gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: g-yo ba med pa'i rkyen byung ba'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni spyod pa med pa dang / bya ba byed pa med pa'i rkyen las byung ba'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba'i don gang yin pa ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúarises due to the condition of a nonmoving condition‚Äù means that it arises due to the condition of a condition that is not engaged in activity and does not perform a function.

original: 'di las g-yo ba dang bral bas g-yo ba med pa'o //
analyzed: 'di las g-yo ba dang bral bas g-yo ba med pa'o //
translated: It is unmoving because it is free from movement.

original: g-yo ba med pa yang yin rkyen kyang de yin pas g-yo ba med pa'i rkyen no //
analyzed: g-yo ba med pa yang yin rkyen kyang de yin pas g-yo ba med pa'i rkyen no //
translated: It is the condition of the unmoving because it is the condition of the unmoving.

original: g-yo ba med pa'i rkyen las byung ba ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'di'i g-yo ba med pa'i rkyen las byung ba'i mtshan nyid de //
analyzed: g-yo ba med pa'i rkyen las byung ba ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'di'i g-yo ba med pa'i rkyen las byung ba'i mtshan nyid de //

original: de gang yin pa ni g-yo ba med pa'i rkyen las byung ba'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de gang yin pa ni g-yo ba med pa'i rkyen las byung ba'i mtshan nyid do //

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i skabs su ni gang la brten nas gang @81b 'byung ba de'i rkyen ni de yin par bstan to zhes bya ba ni 'di ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i ched du byas pa yin no //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i skabs su ni gang la brten nas gang @81b 'byung ba de'i rkyen ni de yin par bstan to zhes bya ba ni 'di ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i ched du byas pa yin no //
translated: In the context of dependent origination, whatever originates in dependence on something is taught to be a condition of that.

original: de bas na 'di ltar nges par 'di las 'bras bu 'grub pa kho na yin pas de ni de'i rkyen ces bstan to //
analyzed: de bas na 'di ltar nges par 'di las 'bras bu 'grub pa kho na yin pas de ni de'i rkyen ces bstan to //
translated: Therefore, since the effect is definitely established from that, it is taught that that is its condition.

original: de ltar na grub par 'gyur te skabs ji lta ba bzhin bstan pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgzhan dag na re rgyu smos na ni de ma thag pa'i rkyen la sogs pa 'dzin par mi 'gyur ro zhe na zhes bya ba ni de ma thag pa dang dmigs pa dang bdag po'i rkyen rnams smos pas 'gyur ba ni 'du byed la sogs pa'i ma rig
analyzed: de ltar na grub par 'gyur te skabs ji lta ba bzhin bstan pa'i phyir ro // gzhan dag na re rgyu smos na ni de ma thag pa'i rkyen la sogs pa 'dzin par mi 'gyur ro zhe na zhes bya ba ni de ma thag pa dang dmigs pa dang bdag po'i rkyen rnams smos pas 'gyur ba ni 'du byed la sogs pa'i ma rig
translated: Thus, it is established because it is taught according to the context.üîΩOthers say: If cause is mentioned, the immediately preceding condition and so on are not included.

original: pa la sogs pa'i yan lag rnams yin te /
analyzed: pa la sogs pa'i yan lag rnams yin te /
translated: The immediately preceding condition and the objective condition and the dominant condition are included by mentioning the conditions of ignorance and so on and the limbs of formation and so on.

original: ji ltar srid par de ma thag pa dang dmigs pa dang bdag po'i rkyen rnams yin la rkyen gyi sgras ni spyir rnam pa bzhi char yang rkyen gyi sgrar bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar srid par de ma thag pa dang dmigs pa dang bdag po'i rkyen rnams yin la rkyen gyi sgras ni spyir rnam pa bzhi char yang rkyen gyi sgrar bstan pa yin no //
translated: The word condition generally teaches all four types.

original: de'i phyir gzhi dang byed rgyu smos na nyes ba ci yod ces smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhi dang byed rgyu smos na nyes ba ci yod ces smras te /
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚ÄúWhat is wrong with stating the basis and causal condition?‚Äù

original: gzhi dang byed rgyu'i sgra gnyis la rkyen gyis khyab pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhi dang byed rgyu'i sgra gnyis la rkyen gyis khyab pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the two words basis and causal condition are pervaded by the word condition.

original: rgyu'i sgra gzhan la yang mthong ste zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i rkyen nyi tshe la ma yin par ston to //
analyzed: rgyu'i sgra gzhan la yang mthong ste zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i rkyen nyi tshe la ma yin par ston to //
translated: The word cause is also seen in other contexts. This shows that it is not only the causal condition.

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba bskyed par bya ba'i phyir rgyu gnyis rkyen gnyis yin la zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi sgra dang nang du tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba bskyed par bya ba'i phyir rgyu gnyis rkyen gnyis yin la zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi sgra dang nang du tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'o //
translated: For the sake of generating right view, there are two causes and two conditions. The other sound and proper mental attention are the causal condition and objective condition, respectively, for generating right view.

original: gzhan gyi sgra ni yang dag pa'i lta ba'i rgyu'i rkyen ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sgra ni yang dag pa'i lta ba'i rgyu'i rkyen ma yin no //
translated: Other sound is not the causal condition for right view.

original: 'o na ci zhe na dmigs pa'i rkyen no //
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na dmigs pa'i rkyen no //
translated: What is it? It is the objective condition.

original: de bzhin du na nag du tshul bzhin yid la byed pa ni yang dag pa'i lta ba zag pa med pa'i rgyu'i rkyen ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du na nag du tshul bzhin yid la byed pa ni yang dag pa'i lta ba zag pa med pa'i rgyu'i rkyen ma yin no //
translated: Likewise, proper mental attention in the dark is not the causal condition of the uncontaminated right view.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is it then?

original: bdag po'i rkyen no //
analyzed: bdag po'i rkyen no //
translated: It is the dominant condition.

original: de bzhin du tshangs pa bdag ni rgyur smra ba ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshangs pa bdag ni rgyur smra ba ste /
translated: Similarly, BrahmƒÅ said, ‚ÄúI am the cause, I am the maker, I am the best, I am the highest, I am the primary one, I am the primary god.üîΩI am the cause of this world.

original: rgyu ston par byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa ni rgyu'i rkyen 'ba' zhig gsungs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu ston par byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa ni rgyu'i rkyen 'ba' zhig gsungs pa ma yin no //
translated: ‚Äù He did not say that he is the causal condition alone.

original: 'o na ci zhe na rkyen thams cad do //
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na rkyen thams cad do //
translated: What did he say? He said that he is all the conditions.

original: sogs pa'i sgra gzhan nas rgyu'i sgra yod pa la yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgra gzhan nas rgyu'i sgra yod pa la yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù should be applied to the word ‚Äúcause‚Äù in other passages as well.

original: de ltar na rgyu'i sgra 'di ni rgyu'i rkyen kho na la 'jug pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na rgyu'i sgra 'di ni rgyu'i rkyen kho na la 'jug pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the word ‚Äúcause‚Äù is not used only for the causal condition.

original: de bas na de dag rna lan du mi rung ste /
analyzed: de bas na de dag rna lan du mi rung ste /
translated: Therefore, those passages are not suitable as examples,

original: rgyu smos pas de ma thag pa la sogs pa'i rkyen smos pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu smos pas de ma thag pa la sogs pa'i rkyen smos pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because by mentioning the cause, the immediately preceding condition and so on are also mentioned.

original: ma rig pa la sogs pa ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ma yin gyi'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: ma rig pa la sogs pa ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ma yin gyi'o na ci zhe na /
translated: Ignorance and so on are not dependent origination. What are they?

original: rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba yin no zhes bya ba ni mdo sde gzhan gyi rjes su 'brangs te skad smras so //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba yin no zhes bya ba ni mdo sde gzhan gyi rjes su 'brangs te skad smras so //
translated: The statement they originate in dependence is made in accordance with another sutra.

original: kha che rnam par smra ba dag ni ma rig pa la sogs pa de dag nyid rgyu dang 'bras bur phye nas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba zhes brjod do //
analyzed: kha che rnam par smra ba dag ni ma rig pa la sogs pa de dag nyid rgyu dang 'bras bur phye nas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba zhes brjod do //
translated: The Kashmiri Vaibhasikas say that the members beginning with ignorance and ending with aging and death are called dependent origination and originating in dependence when they are distinguished as cause and effect.

original: de nyid kyi phyir slob dpon @82a * //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir slob dpon @82a * //
translated: For that reason, the master Vasubandhu says, Thus, the Lord has stated in another sutra.üîΩ The members beginning with ignorance and ending with aging and death are called dependent origination and originating in dependence when they are distinguished as cause and effect.üîΩThe statement they originate in dependence is made in accordance with another sutra.üîΩ The Kashmiri Vaibhasikas say that the members beginning with ignorance and ending with aging and death are called dependent origination and originating in dependence when they are distinguished as cause and effect.

original: gyis de ltar ni bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo sde gzhan las gsungs te zhes rgyas par smras so //
analyzed: gyis de ltar ni bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo sde gzhan las gsungs te zhes rgyas par smras so //
translated: For that reason, the master Vasubandhu says, Thus, the Lord has stated in another sutra.üîΩ The members beginning with ignorance and ending with aging and death are called dependent origination and originating in dependence when they are distinguished as cause and effect.üîΩThe statement they originate in dependence is made in accordance with another sutra.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i rnam par dbye ba gang zhe na zhes bya ba nas brtsams te ma rig pa la sogs pa rnam par dbye ba ston to //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i rnam par dbye ba gang zhe na zhes bya ba nas brtsams te ma rig pa la sogs pa rnam par dbye ba ston to //
translated: The Kashmiri Vaibhasikas say that the members beginning with ignorance and ending with aging and death are called dependent origination and originating in dependence when they are distinguished as cause and effect.üîΩFor that reason, the master Vasubandhu says, Thus, the Lord has stated in another sutra.

original: ma rig pa la sogs pa ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ma yin gyi /üîΩ'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: ma rig pa la sogs pa ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ma yin gyi / 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: The members beginning with ignorance and ending with aging and death are called dependent origination and originating in dependence when they are distinguished as cause and effect.

original: rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba yin no zhes gang gsungs pa /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba yin no zhes gang gsungs pa /
translated: The statement they originate in dependence is made in accordance with another sutra.üîΩ The Kashmiri Vaibhasikas say that the members beginning with ignorance and ending with aging and death are called dependent origination and originating in dependence when they are distinguished as cause and effect.üîΩFor that reason, the master Vasubandhu says, Thus, the Lord has stated in another sutra.

original: 'di la dgongs pa ci yod ce na /
analyzed: 'di la dgongs pa ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the intention here?

original: de'i phyir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni byung ba'i chos rnams ni spyi'i mtshan nyid yin te zhes rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni byung ba'i chos rnams ni spyi'i mtshan nyid yin te zhes rgyas par smos so //
translated: Therefore he says: ‚ÄúThe term ‚Äòdependently arisen‚Äô is a general characteristic of arisen phenomena.‚Äù

original: ma byung ba las 'byung ba'o zhes bya ba ni rgyu tshogs pa sngar yod na phyis 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: ma byung ba las 'byung ba'o zhes bya ba ni rgyu tshogs pa sngar yod na phyis 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don gang yin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúArisen from what was not previously existent‚Äù means that when the previously existent collection of causes is later existent, it is arisen.

original: ma rig pa la sogs pa thams cad kyang ma byung ba las byung ba yin pa de bas na rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni byung ba rnams kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid yin na /
analyzed: ma rig pa la sogs pa thams cad kyang ma byung ba las byung ba yin pa de bas na rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni byung ba rnams kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid yin na /
translated: Since all of ignorance and so on are arisen from what was not previously existent, the term ‚Äúdependently arisen‚Äù is a general characteristic of arisen phenomena.üîΩHow can it be taught as a different classification?

original: de rnam par dbye ba gzhan du ji ltar bstan par nus zhes bya ba ni de ma byung ba las byung ba'o zhes bya ba ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos rnam par dbye ba med pa rnam pa gzhan du logs shig tu rnam par dbye zhing
analyzed: de rnam par dbye ba gzhan du ji ltar bstan par nus zhes bya ba ni de ma byung ba las byung ba'o zhes bya ba ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos rnam par dbye ba med pa rnam pa gzhan du logs shig tu rnam par dbye zhing
translated: ‚ÄúArisen from what was not previously existent‚Äù is a different classification of the phenomena of dependent origination that is not a different classification of them as something else.

original: / bstan par ji ltar nus 'dir dgongs pa ni de ni de dag las gzhan du rnam par gzhag par mi nus te /
analyzed: / bstan par ji ltar nus 'dir dgongs pa ni de ni de dag las gzhan du rnam par gzhag par mi nus te /
translated: How can it be taught? The intention is that it cannot be presented as other than those.

original: de la brtags pa'i chos yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de la brtags pa'i chos yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Because it is a fabricated phenomenon.

original: ji ltar rgas par gyur ba las gzhan du rga bar gyur pa ji ltar bstan par nus zhes bya ba ni skra dkar la sogs pa'i rtags las de mngon pa yin gyi de dag las gzhan du ni bstan par mi nus te /
analyzed: ji ltar rgas par gyur ba las gzhan du rga bar gyur pa ji ltar bstan par nus zhes bya ba ni skra dkar la sogs pa'i rtags las de mngon pa yin gyi de dag las gzhan du ni bstan par mi nus te /
translated: How can aging be taught as other than one who has become aged? It is evident from the signs of aging, such as gray hair, and so on, but it cannot be taught as other than those.

original: de'i dbye ba med par dbye bar ga la nus zhes bya ba lta bu'o //üîΩgzhan yang mi rtag pa nyid ni mi rtag pa las gzhan du dmigs kyis dbye bar mi nus te /
analyzed: de'i dbye ba med par dbye bar ga la nus zhes bya ba lta bu'o // gzhan yang mi rtag pa nyid ni mi rtag pa las gzhan du dmigs kyis dbye bar mi nus te /
translated: How can it be taught as a division of that which is not a division of it?

original: brtags pa'i chos yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brtags pa'i chos yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, impermanence cannot be distinguished as other than the impermanent because it is a fabricated phenomenon.

original: mi rtag pa'i chos dbye ba med pa yang de'i dbye ba bstan par mi nus te /
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i chos dbye ba med pa yang de'i dbye ba bstan par mi nus te /
translated: And the impermanent cannot be taught as a division of that which is not a division of it.

original: dngos po med pa ni ngo bo gcig pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po med pa ni ngo bo gcig pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because a non-entity is a single entity.

original: de dag ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid gsum po 'di dag yin te /
analyzed: de dag ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid gsum po 'di dag yin te /
translated: These are the three characteristics of conditioned phenomena.

original: 'di lta ste skye ba dang 'jig pa dang gnas pa gzhan du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste skye ba dang 'jig pa dang gnas pa gzhan du gyur pa'o //
translated: They are origination, passing away, and duration-change.

original: de la skye ba ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i dang por bshad pas rab tu bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de la skye ba ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i dang por bshad pas rab tu bstan pa yin no //
translated: Among them, origination is indicated by the first of the dependent originations.

original: gnas pa gzhan du gyur pa nyid ni rga ba rnam par 'byed pas so //
analyzed: gnas pa gzhan du gyur pa nyid ni rga ba rnam par 'byed pas so //
translated: Duration-change is indicated by the analysis of aging.

original: 'jig pa ni 'chi ba rnam par 'byed pas so //
analyzed: 'jig pa ni 'chi ba rnam par 'byed pas so //
translated: Passing away is indicated by the analysis of death.

original: de la skye ba zhes bstan pa ni ma byung ba @82b las byung bas bye brag tu byas pa'i dngos po la bya bar mngon pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de la skye ba zhes bstan pa ni ma byung ba @82b las byung bas bye brag tu byas pa'i dngos po la bya bar mngon pa yin gyi /
translated: Among them, origination is understood as the distinction of a thing that was not previously existent.

original: dngos po tsam ni ma yin no //üîΩgnas pa gzhan du gyur pa nyid //
analyzed: dngos po tsam ni ma yin no // gnas pa gzhan du gyur pa nyid //
translated: It is not just a thing.üîΩDuration-change is understood as the distinction of the prior and subsequent parts of a continuum.

original: ces bstan pa ni rgyun gyi snga phyi'i bye brag la bya bar mngon pa yin gyi rgyun tsam ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ces bstan pa ni rgyun gyi snga phyi'i bye brag la bya bar mngon pa yin gyi rgyun tsam ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not just a continuum.

original: 'jig pa zhes bstan pa ni byung nas med pa la bya bar mngon pa tsam yin gyi med pa kho na ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jig pa zhes bstan pa ni byung nas med pa la bya bar mngon pa tsam yin gyi med pa kho na ni ma yin no //
translated: The term ‚Äúdestruction‚Äù is merely a designation for what has arisen and then ceased; it does not refer to nonexistence.

original: der rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba gang yin pa de ni zhes bya ba la der zhes bya ba ni mdo sde der ro //
analyzed: der rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba gang yin pa de ni zhes bya ba la der zhes bya ba ni mdo sde der ro //
translated: That which is dependent origination there is dependent origination here.

original: 'dir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang po yin par gsungs so zhes bya ba ni mdo sde 'dir ro //
analyzed: 'dir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang po yin par gsungs so zhes bya ba ni mdo sde 'dir ro //
translated: The first dependent origination is stated here.

original: mdo sde der ni 'di yod pas 'di 'byung 'di skyes pas 'di skye ba ste zhes bya ba 'di nyid rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yin par gsungs la 'dir ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang po yin par gsungs so //
analyzed: mdo sde der ni 'di yod pas 'di 'byung 'di skyes pas 'di skye ba ste zhes bya ba 'di nyid rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yin par gsungs la 'dir ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang po yin par gsungs so //
translated: In that sutra, dependent origination is stated to be ‚Äúwhen this exists, that comes to be; from the arising of this, that arises.‚Äù Here, the first dependent origination is stated.

original: der rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos ma rig pa la sogs pa gang yin pa de ni 'dir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yin par gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: der rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos ma rig pa la sogs pa gang yin pa de ni 'dir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yin par gsungs pa yin no //
translated: That which is dependent origination there, the factors of dependent origination such as ignorance, is stated to be dependent origination here.

original: ji ltar khyed la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i rnam par dbye ba bshad par bya'o zhes gsungs nas ma rig pa la sogs pa'i rnam par dbye ba 'chad pa'i phyir ma rig pa la sogs pa ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yin par gsungs pa yin
analyzed: ji ltar khyed la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i rnam par dbye ba bshad par bya'o zhes gsungs nas ma rig pa la sogs pa'i rnam par dbye ba 'chad pa'i phyir ma rig pa la sogs pa ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yin par gsungs pa yin
translated: Just as you have explained the analysis of dependent origination, so I will explain the analysis of ignorance and so on.

original: / de'i phyir chos kyi rnam grangs 'di ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la dgongs pa yin pas zhes rgyas par gsungs te /
analyzed: / de'i phyir chos kyi rnam grangs 'di ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la dgongs pa yin pas zhes rgyas par gsungs te /
translated: Therefore this doctrinal formulation is intended for dependent origination.

original: yi ge yang skabs bzhin du nye bar gdags so zhes ji skad smos pa yin no //
analyzed: yi ge yang skabs bzhin du nye bar gdags so zhes ji skad smos pa yin no //
translated: The words are also applied as appropriate.üîΩIn order to teach its brief and extensive forms.

original: de'i mdo dang rgyas pa bstan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bstan pa dang bshad pa zhes bya ba'i don gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de'i mdo dang rgyas pa bstan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bstan pa dang bshad pa zhes bya ba'i don gang yin pa'o //
translated: The meaning of teaching and explanation.

original: byung ba dang 'byung ba dag kyang don tha dad par kha cig rtog pa zhes bya ba ni chos mngon pa pa dag go //
analyzed: byung ba dang 'byung ba dag kyang don tha dad par kha cig rtog pa zhes bya ba ni chos mngon pa pa dag go //
translated: Some think that occurrence and origination have different meanings.

original: de dag las kyang bsal ba yin te zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ji ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: de dag las kyang bsal ba yin te zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ji ltar yin zhe na /
translated: and also from those, it is distinguished.

original: de'i phyir brtags pa'i chos yin pa nyid ston pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir brtags pa'i chos yin pa nyid ston pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: In order to teach that it is a phenomenon that is imputed, he says:

original: gang 'di rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rnam par dbye ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: gang 'di rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rnam par dbye ba nas brtsams te /
translated: because it teaches the differentiation of dependent origination,

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos rnam par dbye ba ston pa ni rten cing 'bral par 'byung ba de brtags pa'i chos yin pa nyid du ston par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos rnam par dbye ba ston pa ni rten cing 'bral par 'byung ba de brtags pa'i chos yin pa nyid du ston par byed pa yin te /
translated: the teaching of the differentiation of dependent origination phenomena teaches that dependent origination is a phenomenon that is imputed.

original: de ni tha dad par 'gyur ba de la de nyid kyi rnam par dbye ba 'chad par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni tha dad par 'gyur ba de la de nyid kyi rnam par dbye ba 'chad par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it explains the differentiation of that dependent origination in terms of its distinct aspects.

original: tshig la tshig 'byung ba zhes bya ba tshig gang las she na /
analyzed: tshig la tshig 'byung ba zhes bya ba tshig gang las she na /
translated: In the phrase ‚Äúthe occurrence of words from words,‚Äù from what words do words occur?

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos rnams gang zhe na /
translated: What are dependent origination phenomena?

original: ma rig @83a * //
analyzed: ma rig @83a * //
translated: Ignorance.

original: pa nas rga shi'i bar du gang gsungs pa gang yin pa de las tshig 'byung ba ni gal te ma rig pa yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yin na zhes rgyas par 'byung ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: pa nas rga shi'i bar du gang gsungs pa gang yin pa de las tshig 'byung ba ni gal te ma rig pa yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yin na zhes rgyas par 'byung ba 'di yin no //
translated: The words that are found in the sutra are: ‚ÄúIf ignorance also arises in dependence on something, then what is its cause? What is its condition? What is its basis?‚Äù

original: rgyu dang bcas rkyen dang bcas gzhi dang bcas pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs las ji ltar byas she na /
analyzed: rgyu dang bcas rkyen dang bcas gzhi dang bcas pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs las ji ltar byas she na /
translated: How is this to be understood in the Dharma-discourse with cause, with condition, with basis?

original: dge slong dag ma rig pa yang rgyu dang bcas pa rkyen dang bcas pa nges par skyed pa dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: dge slong dag ma rig pa yang rgyu dang bcas pa rkyen dang bcas pa nges par skyed pa dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúMonks, ignorance has a cause, has a condition, has a basis.

original: dge slong dag ma rig pa'i rgyu ni gang rkyen ni gang nges par skyed pa ci zhe na /üîΩma rig pa'i rgyu ni tshul bzhin ma yin par yid la byed pa yin no //
analyzed: dge slong dag ma rig pa'i rgyu ni gang rkyen ni gang nges par skyed pa ci zhe na / ma rig pa'i rgyu ni tshul bzhin ma yin par yid la byed pa yin no //
translated: Monks, what is the cause of ignorance? What is its condition? What is its basis?üîΩThe cause of ignorance is incorrect mental attention.

original: rkyen yang tshul bzhin ma yin par yid la byed pa yin no //üîΩnges par skyed pa yang tshul bzhin ma yin par yid la byed pa yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rkyen yang tshul bzhin ma yin par yid la byed pa yin no //üîΩnges par skyed pa yang tshul bzhin ma yin par yid la byed pa yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The condition of ignorance is incorrect mental attention.üîΩThe basis of ignorance is incorrect mental attention.‚Äù

original: gsus po che'i mdo las sgrib pa lnga yang yin par gsungs te /
analyzed: gsus po che'i mdo las sgrib pa lnga yang yin par gsungs te /
translated: The Mahasutiia Sutra mentions five hindrances.

original: de la sgrib pa lnga ni ma rig pa'i bdag nyid 'thob cing gnas par bya ba'i phyir sgrub par byed cing de'i rgyun rjes su gnas par byed pa'i don gyis yin no //
analyzed: de la sgrib pa lnga ni ma rig pa'i bdag nyid 'thob cing gnas par bya ba'i phyir sgrub par byed cing de'i rgyun rjes su gnas par byed pa'i don gyis yin no //
translated: The five hindrances are so called because they are the cause of the acquisition and the maintenance of the nature of ignorance, because they are the cause of the continuation and the maintenance of its stream.

original: sgrib pa lnga ni 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang gnod sems dang rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa dang / rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang the tshom mo //
analyzed: sgrib pa lnga ni 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang gnod sems dang rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa dang / rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang the tshom mo //
translated: The five hindrances are will for sensuality, malice, stolidity, excitedness-regret, and applied-thought.

original: tshigs su bcad pa gsum pa las //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa gsum pa las //
translated: Three verses on the analysis of the three poisons.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug rnams la tshigs su bcad pa gsum mo //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug rnams la tshigs su bcad pa gsum mo //
translated: There are three verses on the three poisons of greed, hatred, and delusion.

original: chags pa pos ni chos mi shes //
analyzed: chags pa pos ni chos mi shes //
translated: The greedy one does not know the Dharma.

original: zhes rgyas par 'byung ba de bzhin du khros pa po dang rmongs pa chos mi shes zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes rgyas par 'byung ba de bzhin du khros pa po dang rmongs pa chos mi shes zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Just as the greedy one does not know the Dharma, so also the angry one and the deluded one do not know the Dharma.

original: reg pa yang spyi'i rkyen yin par bstan te zhes bya ba ni 'du byed kyi phung po'i rkyen nyid yin pa'i sgo nas kyang 'du byed kyi phung po'i nang du 'dus pa yin no //
analyzed: reg pa yang spyi'i rkyen yin par bstan te zhes bya ba ni 'du byed kyi phung po'i rkyen nyid yin pa'i sgo nas kyang 'du byed kyi phung po'i nang du 'dus pa yin no //
translated: This is because it is included within the aggregate of formation from the point of view of being a condition for the aggregate of formation.üîΩThe origin of the contaminants is said to be the origin of ignorance.

original: ma rig pa kun 'byung ba las zag pa kun 'byung zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa ni zag pa'i nang du gtogs pa'i phyir ma rig pa kun 'byung ba las zag pa kun 'byung zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: ma rig pa kun 'byung ba las zag pa kun 'byung zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa ni zag pa'i nang du gtogs pa'i phyir ma rig pa kun 'byung ba las zag pa kun 'byung zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is because ignorance is included within the contaminants.üîΩIgnorance arises in dependence on ignorance alone.

original: ma rig pa kho na la brten nas ma rig pa 'byung ba yin gyi zhes bya ba ni slob dpon gyis rang gi bsam pa ston par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: ma rig pa kho na la brten nas ma rig pa 'byung ba yin gyi zhes bya ba ni slob dpon gyis rang gi bsam pa ston par byed pa yin no //
translated: This is the master‚Äôs own opinion.üîΩBecause it arises from delusion alone.

original: rmongs pa kho na las de skye ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni tshul bzhin ma yin par yid la byed pa sgrib pa dang log par lta ba dang 'dod chags la sogs pa skye ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: rmongs pa kho na las de skye ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni tshul bzhin ma yin par yid la byed pa sgrib pa dang log par lta ba dang 'dod chags la sogs pa skye ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: This means that incorrect mental activity, obscuration, wrong views, attachment, and so on arise.

original: tshul bzhin ma yin par yid la byed pa la sogs pa ni rmongs pa med par skye ba ma yin no //
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin par yid la byed pa la sogs pa ni rmongs pa med par skye ba ma yin no //
translated: Improper mental attention, etc., do not arise without delusion.

original: de bas na tshul bzhin ma yin par yid la byed pa la sogs pa las skye ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na tshul bzhin ma yin par yid la byed pa la sogs pa las skye ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, they do not arise from improper mental attention, etc.

original: @83b gal te de lta yin na sngar glengs pa'i mdo sde rnams ji ltar drang zhe na /
analyzed: @83b gal te de lta yin na sngar glengs pa'i mdo sde rnams ji ltar drang zhe na /
translated: If that is so, how do you interpret the sutra cited above?

original: de'i phyir rang gi rigs gcig las gcig 'byung ba na tshul bzhin ma yin par yid la byed pa la sogs pas lhag par rgyas par 'byung bar byed de zhes smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang gi rigs gcig las gcig 'byung ba na tshul bzhin ma yin par yid la byed pa la sogs pas lhag par rgyas par 'byung bar byed de zhes smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said that when one of the same type arises, improper mental attention, etc., cause it to increase excessively.

original: de'i phyir sa bon rgyas pa ni lhag par spang dka' ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir sa bon rgyas pa ni lhag par spang dka' ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that the seed increases because it is difficult to eliminate.

original: ji lta ji ltar tshul bzhin ma yin par yid la byed pa dang / sgrib pa dang log par lta ba dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa kun du 'byung ba de lta de ltar ma rig pa'i sa bon yongs su rgyas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji lta ji ltar tshul bzhin ma yin par yid la byed pa dang / sgrib pa dang log par lta ba dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa kun du 'byung ba de lta de ltar ma rig pa'i sa bon yongs su rgyas par 'gyur ro //
translated: To the extent that there is improper mental attention, obscuration, wrong views, and the arising of attachment, etc., to that extent the seed of ignorance increases.

original: yongs su rgyas pa na shin tu spang dka' ba yin te /
analyzed: yongs su rgyas pa na shin tu spang dka' ba yin te /
translated: When it is fully developed, it is very difficult to abandon.

original: de ltar na lhag par rgyas par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na lhag par rgyas par byed pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is a special development.

original: yang na tshul bzhin ma yin par yid la byed pa la sogs pa kun du 'byung bas ma rig pa'i gnyen po kun du 'byung ba'i gags byas te gnyen po med pa'i ma rig pa'i sa bon ni shin tu rgyas pa yin no //
analyzed: yang na tshul bzhin ma yin par yid la byed pa la sogs pa kun du 'byung bas ma rig pa'i gnyen po kun du 'byung ba'i gags byas te gnyen po med pa'i ma rig pa'i sa bon ni shin tu rgyas pa yin no //
translated: Or else, the seed of ignorance is fully developed because it obstructs the arising of the counteragent to ignorance through the arising of incorrect mental activity, etc.

original: ji lta ji ltar rgyas par gyur pa de lta de ltar shin tu spang dka' ba yang yin te /
analyzed: ji lta ji ltar rgyas par gyur pa de lta de ltar shin tu spang dka' ba yang yin te /
translated: The more it is developed, the more difficult it is to abandon.

original: de ltar na sa bon rgyas pa ni lhag par spang dka' ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na sa bon rgyas pa ni lhag par spang dka' ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, the seed is said to be fully developed because it is a special difficulty to abandon.

original: de ltar na de yang de'i rkyen yin par gsungs so zhes bya ba ni tshul bzhin ma yin par yid la byed pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de ltar na de yang de'i rkyen yin par gsungs so zhes bya ba ni tshul bzhin ma yin par yid la byed pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Thus, it is said that this is also a condition for that, i.e., incorrect mental activity, etc.

original: 'o na mdo sde 'dir zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste 'chad par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'o na mdo sde 'dir zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste 'chad par byed pa'o //
translated: Now, in this sutra, i.e., in the explanation of this sutra, it is said that:

original: de la yang gzhan brjod par bya dgos par 'gyur la zhes bya ba ni thug pa med par 'gyur ba ston par byed do //
analyzed: de la yang gzhan brjod par bya dgos par 'gyur la zhes bya ba ni thug pa med par 'gyur ba ston par byed do //
translated: And that would require another explanation. This shows that there would be an infinite regress.

original: 'o na mdo sde 'dir de'i rkyen ci'i phyir ma gsungs zhes rgol ba 'di bzlog par 'gyur ba gang nas bstan te /
analyzed: 'o na mdo sde 'dir de'i rkyen ci'i phyir ma gsungs zhes rgol ba 'di bzlog par 'gyur ba gang nas bstan te /
translated: But where is it taught that this objection is to be refuted, namely, ‚ÄúWhy is the condition of that not stated in this s≈´tra?‚Äù

original: skye ba'i rim ba bstan pa brtsam par bya yang na skye ba'i rim pa bstan pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: skye ba'i rim ba bstan pa brtsam par bya yang na skye ba'i rim pa bstan pa med pa yin no //
translated: Either the order of arising should be stated, or the order of arising should not be stated.

original: gang gi don du yan lag bcu gnyis bstan pa zhes bya ba ni 'chad par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi don du yan lag bcu gnyis bstan pa zhes bya ba ni 'chad par byed pa yin no //
translated: For what purpose are the twelve members taught? This is the explanation.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: gang gis 'phen pa dang gang gi phyir dang gang gi de 'byung ba dang de yang nyes dmigs gang yin pa zhes bya ba de dag ni yan lag bcu gnyis bstan pa yin pas de la ni ma rig pa'i rkyen bstan pa dgos pa med de yan lag
analyzed: gang gis 'phen pa dang gang gi phyir dang gang gi de 'byung ba dang de yang nyes dmigs gang yin pa zhes bya ba de dag ni yan lag bcu gnyis bstan pa yin pas de la ni ma rig pa'i rkyen bstan pa dgos pa med de yan lag
translated: Because of that which impels, that for the sake of which, that from which it arises, and that which is the disadvantage of that. Since these are the twelve members, there is no need to teach the condition of ignorance,

original: bcu gnyis kho nas de'i don bstan zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bcu gnyis kho nas de'i don bstan zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the meaning of that is already taught by the twelve members alone.

original: de yang phyis bstan par bya'o zhes bya ba ni de ni dgos pa'i dbang du byas te bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang phyis bstan par bya'o zhes bya ba ni de ni dgos pa'i dbang du byas te bstan pa yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthis will be explained later‚Äù indicates that the explanation is based on the needs of the instruction.

original: ma rig pa'i rkyen rang gi rigs yin yang zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa'i rig ni rkyen yin te /üîΩji skad du ma rig pa kho na la brten nas ma rig pa @84a * //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rkyen rang gi rigs yin yang zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa'i rig ni rkyen yin te / ji skad du ma rig pa kho na la brten nas ma rig pa @84a * //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúeven though ignorance is the condition of the formations‚Äù indicates that ignorance is the condition of the formations.üîΩAs the sutra states, ‚ÄúIgnorance alone is the condition of the formations.‚Äù

original: 'byung ba yin gyi zhes rgyas par smos pa yin no //üîΩ'dir yan lag rnams kyi rkyen rang gi rigs brjod par 'dod pa ma yin gyi 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'byung ba yin gyi zhes rgyas par smos pa yin no // 'dir yan lag rnams kyi rkyen rang gi rigs brjod par 'dod pa ma yin gyi 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe condition of the formations is ignorance‚Äù indicates that the formations arise in dependence on ignorance.üîΩThe present passage does not intend to state that the condition of the members is their own species.

original: rigs mi mthun pa rkyen yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: rigs mi mthun pa rkyen yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: What, then, does it intend? It intends to show that the condition is of a different species.

original: de lta ma yin na ni ming dang gzugs kyang ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen yin pa dang / skye mched drug kyang skye mched drug gi rkyen yin no zhes brjod par bya dgos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ni ming dang gzugs kyang ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen yin pa dang / skye mched drug kyang skye mched drug gi rkyen yin no zhes brjod par bya dgos par 'gyur ro //
translated: If this were not so, it would be necessary to say that name-and-form is the condition of name-and-form, and that the six sense bases are the condition of the six sense bases.

original: 'khor ba thog ma yod par 'gyur ba dang zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa las snga rol du yan lag gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khor ba thog ma yod par 'gyur ba dang zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa las snga rol du yan lag gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Samsara would have a beginning. This is because there would be no other members prior to ignorance.

original: yan lag lhag par 'gyur ba ni gal te ma rig pa la rkyen yod na zhes bsams pa'o //
analyzed: yan lag lhag par 'gyur ba ni gal te ma rig pa la rkyen yod na zhes bsams pa'o //
translated: There would be an excess of members. This is because if ignorance has a condition, it would not be the first member.

original: de dag la thug pa med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni de dag gi yan lag rnams so //
analyzed: de dag la thug pa med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni de dag gi yan lag rnams so //
translated: There would be an infinite regress of these. These refer to the members.

original: de lta ma yin na gang yin pa de'i rkyen ma smos pa'i phyir 'khor ba thog ma yod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba skyon de gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na gang yin pa de'i rkyen ma smos pa'i phyir 'khor ba thog ma yod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba skyon de gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were not so, then the error that samsara would have a beginning would still apply, because the condition of that which is not so would not be mentioned.

original: lan ni tshul bzhin ma yin par yid la byed pa ma rig pa'i rkyen yin no zhes mdo sde gzhan las 'byung ba sngar bstan zin to zhes bya ba 'dis 'khor ba thog ma yod pa ma yin no zhes ston par byed do //
analyzed: lan ni tshul bzhin ma yin par yid la byed pa ma rig pa'i rkyen yin no zhes mdo sde gzhan las 'byung ba sngar bstan zin to zhes bya ba 'dis 'khor ba thog ma yod pa ma yin no zhes ston par byed do //
translated: The response is that it has been previously explained that the sutra declares that incorrect mental activity is the condition of ignorance. This shows that samsara does not have a beginning.

original: yan lag lhag pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: yan lag lhag pa yang ma yin te /
translated: There is also no excess of members.

original: len pa'i nang du de 'dus pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la tshul bzhin ma yin par yid la byed pa de ci zhe na /
analyzed: len pa'i nang du de 'dus pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la tshul bzhin ma yin par yid la byed pa de ci zhe na /
translated: What is that improper mental attention?

original: yan lag lhag par 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: yan lag lhag par 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: It is not that there is an excess of limbs.

original: thug pa med par yang mi 'gyur te /üîΩde gnyis gcig la gcig rkyen byed pa'i phyir bya dang sgo nga bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dper na bya las sgo nga sgo nga las bya yang bya las sgo nga yang sgo nga las bya yin pas gcig gi rkyen gcig yin pa'i phyir thog ma yod
analyzed: thug pa med par yang mi 'gyur te / de gnyis gcig la gcig rkyen byed pa'i phyir bya dang sgo nga bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dper na bya las sgo nga sgo nga las bya yang bya las sgo nga yang sgo nga las bya yin pas gcig gi rkyen gcig yin pa'i phyir thog ma yod
translated: And there is no infinite regress,üîΩbecause those two are conditions for each other, like a chicken and its eggs.

original: pa ma yin pa dang yan lag lhag pa dang thug pa med pa'i nyes pa med pa yang yin pa de bzhin no //
analyzed: pa ma yin pa dang yan lag lhag pa dang thug pa med pa'i nyes pa med pa yang yin pa de bzhin no //
translated: For example, a chicken comes from an egg, and an egg comes from a chicken, and since one is the condition for the other, there is no fault of an infinite regress or an excess of limbs.

original: de gnyis gcig la gcig rkyen yin par ji ltar rig par bya zhe na de'i phyir 'di lta ste dgos pa yid la byed pa ni zhes rgyas par gsungs te 'di ltar rgyu dang bcas rkyen dang bcas nges par skyed pa dang bcas pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs
analyzed: de gnyis gcig la gcig rkyen yin par ji ltar rig par bya zhe na de'i phyir 'di lta ste dgos pa yid la byed pa ni zhes rgyas par gsungs te 'di ltar rgyu dang bcas rkyen dang bcas nges par skyed pa dang bcas pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs
translated: The category of dharmas that are produced with a cause and with conditions, that are definitely produced,

original: de nyid las gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyid las gsungs so //
translated: is taught in the same text.üîΩThe attention of habituation is born from delusion.

original: bsgos pa yid la byed pa ni rmongs pa las skyes pa yin no zhes bya ba de la bsgos pa zhes bya ba tshig gis tshul bzhin ma yin par yid la byed pa 'di nyid bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: bsgos pa yid la byed pa ni rmongs pa las skyes pa yin no zhes bya ba de la bsgos pa zhes bya ba tshig gis tshul bzhin ma yin par yid la byed pa 'di nyid bstan pa yin te /
translated: The word ‚Äúhabituation‚Äù in this passage teaches that attention is improper mental activity.

original: nyon mongs pa can du bsgos pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can du bsgos pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is habituated to afflictions.

original: rmongs pa las skyes pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gis ma rig pa ni de'i rkyen yin par bstan pa yin te /
