original: nyung ba'i don la tshod ma lan tshva med pa dang / gzhon nu ma lto med ces bya ba lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni res 'ga' zhig lan tshva med pa'i tshod ma zhes byas na 'di yang yod pa 'gog pa yin mod kyi /
analyzed: nyung ba'i don la tshod ma lan tshva med pa dang / gzhon nu ma lto med ces bya ba lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni res 'ga' zhig lan tshva med pa'i tshod ma zhes byas na 'di yang yod pa 'gog pa yin mod kyi /
translated: The meaning of small is like saying ‚Äúvegetables without salt‚Äù and ‚Äúa young woman without a womb.‚Äù

original: nyung ba'i don la yang de mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: nyung ba'i don la yang de mthong ba yin no //
translated: This is sometimes seen in the meaning of small, but it is also seen in the meaning of separation.

original: bral ba'i don la ni dge slong med pa'i gnas dang / chu med pa'i dgon pa zhes bya ba lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni dge slong nyung ba yang dge slong med do //üîΩchu nyung ba la yang chu med do zhes nyung ba'i don la yang 'di mthong ste /
analyzed: bral ba'i don la ni dge slong med pa'i gnas dang / chu med pa'i dgon pa zhes bya ba lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni dge slong nyung ba yang dge slong med do // chu nyung ba la yang chu med do zhes nyung ba'i don la yang 'di mthong ste /
translated: The meaning of separation is like saying ‚Äúa place without monks‚Äù and ‚Äúa desert without water.‚Äù

original: 'dod mod kyi bral ba'i don la yang mthong ba yin no /
analyzed: 'dod mod kyi bral ba'i don la yang mthong ba yin no /
translated: This is sometimes seen in the meaning of small, but it is also seen in the meaning of separation.üîΩThe meaning of antidote is like saying ‚Äúwithout merit‚Äù and ‚Äúwithout fame.‚Äù

original: gnyen po'i don la ni bsod nams med pa dang / grags pa med pa zhes bya ba lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni bsod nams dang grags pa gnyis kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi don la bya ste /
analyzed: gnyen po'i don la ni bsod nams med pa dang / grags pa med pa zhes bya ba lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni bsod nams dang grags pa gnyis kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi don la bya ste /
translated: This is to be taken as the meaning of the opposite of both merit and fame.

original: phyogs dang 'gal ba la mi mthun pa'i phyogs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phyogs dang 'gal ba la mi mthun pa'i phyogs zhes bya'o //
translated: The opposite of a side is called a counter-side.

original: 'di ltar dngos po med pa ni 'du byed skye ba'i bdag po'i rkyen nyid du mi rigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gang gi don du byas nas rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed ces brjod pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po med pa ni 'du byed skye ba'i bdag po'i rkyen nyid du mi rigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gang gi don du byas nas rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed ces brjod pa'o //
translated: Thus, the non-existence of a thing is not tenable as the dominant condition for the arising of a formation.

original: gal te ma rig pa 'gags pas 'du byed 'gag go zhes brjod pa'i 'gag pa yang ma rig pa dngos po ci yang med pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te ma rig pa 'gags pas 'du byed 'gag go zhes brjod pa'i 'gag pa yang ma rig pa dngos po ci yang med pa yin na /
translated: If the cessation of formations is described as the cessation of ignorance, and if ignorance is a non-existent thing,

original: rig pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rig pa ma yin no //
translated: it is not a condition.

original: ldog pa'i phyogs kyi dbang du byas nas rig pa med pa tsam ni yang dngos po med par 'gyur bar mi rigs so //
analyzed: ldog pa'i phyogs kyi dbang du byas nas rig pa med pa tsam ni yang dngos po med par 'gyur bar mi rigs so //
translated: In terms of the counter-side, the mere absence of ignorance is not tenable as a non-existent thing.

original: mdo sde gzhan las kun du sbyor ba dang / 'ching ba la sogs pa nyid yin par gsungs pa yang ci zhe na /
analyzed: mdo sde gzhan las kun du sbyor ba dang / 'ching ba la sogs pa nyid yin par gsungs pa yang ci zhe na /
translated: But in another sutra, ignorance is said to be a fetter, a bondage, and so on.

original: rig pa'i dngos po med pa tsam yin na mi rigs so //
analyzed: rig pa'i dngos po med pa tsam yin na mi rigs so //
translated: If it is the mere absence of ignorance, it is not tenable.

original: sogs pa'i sgras phra rgyas dang / kun nas dkris pa la sogs pa gzung ngo ;
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras phra rgyas dang / kun nas dkris pa la sogs pa gzung ngo ;
translated: The words ‚Äúand so on‚Äù include the latent afflictions, entanglements, and so on.

original: / sdug bsngal sna tshogs la sbyar ba'i don gyis kun du sbyor ba yin no //
analyzed: / sdug bsngal sna tshogs la sbyar ba'i don gyis kun du sbyor ba yin no //
translated: They are fetters because they bind one to various kinds of suffering.

original: khams gsum las ni 'da' ba'i don gyis 'ching ba'o //
analyzed: khams gsum las ni 'da' ba'i don gyis 'ching ba'o //
translated: They are bonds because they do not allow one to transcend the three realms.

original: phra mor rjes su 'jug cing phra rgyas kyi don gyis phra rgyas so //üîΩde dag ni rig pa'i dngos po med pa tsam yin na mi rigs so //
analyzed: phra mor rjes su 'jug cing phra rgyas kyi don gyis phra rgyas so // de dag ni rig pa'i dngos po med pa tsam yin na mi rigs so //
translated: They are latent because they follow one as something subtle and latent.üîΩBut if they are mere non-existences of the nature of cognition, it is not reasonable that they be causes.

original: rig pa'i dngos po med pa tsam yin na ci zhe na tshul bzhin ma yin par yid la byed pa rgyu yin par yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: rig pa'i dngos po med pa tsam yin na ci zhe na tshul bzhin ma yin par yid la byed pa rgyu yin par yang mi rigs te /
translated: If they are mere non-existences of the nature of cognition, it is not reasonable that they be causes of incorrect mental activity.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dngos po med pa la rgyu yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang / 'dus byas rnams ni skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir dang / dngos po med pa ni bdag med pa yin pa'i yang phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po med pa la rgyu yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang / 'dus byas rnams ni skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir dang / dngos po med pa ni bdag med pa yin pa'i yang phyir ro //
translated: Because a cause does not exist for a non-existent, because conditioned things are momentary, and because a non-existent is without self.

original: de dag gis ni snga na med pa yang bkag pa yin @86b no ;
analyzed: de dag gis ni snga na med pa yang bkag pa yin @86b no ;
translated: They also refute the view that they are non-existent prior to their origination.

original: /'di ltar dngos po med pa ni 'du byed skye ba'i bdag po'i rkyen nyid du mi rigs pa'i phyir ro zhes smos pa gang yin pa der re zhig 'dod ma chags pa ni 'jig rten pa'i chos kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rkyen du ji ltar 'gyur te zhes
analyzed: /'di ltar dngos po med pa ni 'du byed skye ba'i bdag po'i rkyen nyid du mi rigs pa'i phyir ro zhes smos pa gang yin pa der re zhig 'dod ma chags pa ni 'jig rten pa'i chos kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rkyen du ji ltar 'gyur te zhes
translated: Here, first, how could non-attachment to desire be the condition for the afflictions of worldly phenomena?

original: rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: rgyas par smos so //
translated: Thus it is said in detail.

original: de ni rnam par rtog pa de'i zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ni rnam par rtog pa de'i zhes bya ba ni /
translated: That is merely the object of that conception means:

original: 'dod ma chags pa rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod ma chags pa rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: Non-attachment is the conception.

original: dmigs pa tsam smos pa ni skye ba'i rkyen gyis dngos po 'gog par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: dmigs pa tsam smos pa ni skye ba'i rkyen gyis dngos po 'gog par byed pa yin no //
translated: By merely mentioning the object, the arising of a conditioned phenomenon is refuted.

original: gal te 'di rnam par rtog pa dang skye ba'i rkyen yin na ni brgyud pa'i sgo nas nyon mongs pa'i rkyen yang yin par 'gyur ba zhig na dper na 'dus ma byas ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa tsam yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te 'di rnam par rtog pa dang skye ba'i rkyen yin na ni brgyud pa'i sgo nas nyon mongs pa'i rkyen yang yin par 'gyur ba zhig na dper na 'dus ma byas ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa tsam yin gyi /
translated: If this were the condition for conception and arising, it would be the condition for afflictions indirectly. However, for example, the unconditioned is merely the object of mental consciousness,

original: skye pa'i rkyen ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: skye pa'i rkyen ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: but not the condition for arising.

original: rnam par rtog pa de las rnyed pa 'dod pa rnams kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni ma rnyed par rnam par rtog pa las so //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa de las rnyed pa 'dod pa rnams kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni ma rnyed par rnam par rtog pa las so //
translated: From that conceptualization, those who desire gain become defiled. This is from the conceptualization of non-gain.

original: rnyed pa 'dod pa rnams zhes bya ba ni rnyed pa la chags pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: rnyed pa 'dod pa rnams zhes bya ba ni rnyed pa la chags pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Those who desire gain are those who possess attachment to gain.

original: de dag gis ni rnyed pa la rnam par rtog pa bye brag tu byas so //
analyzed: de dag gis ni rnyed pa la rnam par rtog pa bye brag tu byas so //
translated: They have distinguished the conceptualization of gain.

original: ma rig pa yang rmongs pa zhes mdo sde gzhan las bstan la zhes bya ba 'di yang skyon gzhan yin te /
analyzed: ma rig pa yang rmongs pa zhes mdo sde gzhan las bstan la zhes bya ba 'di yang skyon gzhan yin te /
translated: Ignorance is also taught in other s≈´tras as delusion. This is another fault.

original: gal te rmongs pa ni rig pa med pa'i dngos po tsam yin na rmongs pa med pa rig pa'i mtshan nyid dag ci rmongs pa'i dngos po med pa tsam yin nam /
analyzed: gal te rmongs pa ni rig pa med pa'i dngos po tsam yin na rmongs pa med pa rig pa'i mtshan nyid dag ci rmongs pa'i dngos po med pa tsam yin nam /
translated: If delusion is merely the non-existence of knowledge, is non-delusion, which has the characteristic of knowledge, merely the non-existence of the thing that is delusion?

original: rmongs pa med pa tsam ni ma yin pas de ltar mi 'dod pa ste rmongs pa med pa ni shes rab kyi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir rig pa yin no //
analyzed: rmongs pa med pa tsam ni ma yin pas de ltar mi 'dod pa ste rmongs pa med pa ni shes rab kyi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir rig pa yin no //
translated: Non-delusion is not merely the absence of delusion, so it is not accepted in that way. Non-delusion is knowledge because it has the nature of wisdom.

original: 'on te ma rmongs pa rig pa'i mtshan nyid ni rmongs pa'i gnyen po yin na de gnyi ga yang dngos po med pa la rig pa ma yin te zhes bya ba'i gnyi ga ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te ma rmongs pa rig pa'i mtshan nyid ni rmongs pa'i gnyen po yin na de gnyi ga yang dngos po med pa la rig pa ma yin te zhes bya ba'i gnyi ga ci zhe na /
translated: What are the two?

original: dngos po med pa dang gnyen po'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa dang gnyen po'o //
translated: Non-existence and the antidote.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de'i phyir dngos po med pa ni skye ba med pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po med pa ni skye ba med pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚Äúbecause a non-existent entity is devoid of arising.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar gang skye ba dang ldan pa de kho na dngos po med pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang skye ba dang ldan pa de kho na dngos po med pa yin gyi /
translated: Thus, only that which is endowed with arising is a non-existent entity.

original: dngos po med pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po med pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not a non-existent entity.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i gnyen po yang lam gyi dngos po yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i gnyen po yang lam gyi dngos po yin gyi /
translated: And the antidote to attachment, etc. is an entity of the path.

original: dngos po med pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po med pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not a non-existent entity.

original: dngos po med pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: dngos po med pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: A non-existent entity is also of two kinds:

original: snga na med pa dang zhig nas med pa'o //
analyzed: snga na med pa dang zhig nas med pa'o //
translated: prior non-existence and subsequent non-existence.

original: de la zhig nas med pa ni skye ba dang ldan pa rnams la yin par mngon sum du grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de la zhig nas med pa ni skye ba dang ldan pa rnams la yin par mngon sum du grub pa yin no //
translated: With respect to that, it is established by direct perception that subsequent non-existence is of those things that are endowed with arising.

original: skye ba dang ldan pa yin na yang skye ba'i gnyen po yin te /
analyzed: skye ba dang ldan pa yin na yang skye ba'i gnyen po yin te /
translated: But even though it is associated with birth, it is the counteragent to birth.

original: dper na 'dod chags la sogs pa'i lam lta bu'o //üîΩsnga na med pa ni skye ba dang ldan pa @87a * //
analyzed: dper na 'dod chags la sogs pa'i lam lta bu'o // snga na med pa ni skye ba dang ldan pa @87a * //
translated: For example, it is like the path of desire, etc.

original: yang ma yin no //
analyzed: yang ma yin no //
translated: It is not non-existent prior to that, and it is not associated with birth.

original: de ltar na re zhig 'dzin pa ma yin pa dang ldan pa dang / dngos po ma yin pa dang ldan pa ni ma rig pa yin par mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig 'dzin pa ma yin pa dang ldan pa dang / dngos po ma yin pa dang ldan pa ni ma rig pa yin par mi 'thad do //
translated: Thus, ignorance is not tenable as that which is not a grasper, nor as that which is not an entity.

original: srog chags ma yin pa dang gzugs can ma yin pa zhes bya ba bzhin du /
analyzed: srog chags ma yin pa dang gzugs can ma yin pa zhes bya ba bzhin du /
translated: Like the expression ‚Äúnon-living being‚Äù and ‚Äúnon-form,‚Äù

original: rig pa las gzhan pa gang yin pa de yang ma rig pa yin te /
analyzed: rig pa las gzhan pa gang yin pa de yang ma rig pa yin te /
translated: that which is other than knowledge is also ignorance.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mig la sogs pa la yang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa la yang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because it would follow, absurdly, that the eye, etc.

original: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna la sogs pa de dag kyang rig pa las gzhan yin pas so //
analyzed: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna la sogs pa de dag kyang rig pa las gzhan yin pas so //
translated: are also ignorance, for the eye, ear, nose, etc. are also other than knowledge.

original: mig la sogs pa la thal bar gyur na nyes pa ci yod ce na /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa la thal bar gyur na nyes pa ci yod ce na /
translated: What is wrong with the eye, etc. being ignorance?

original: 'jug pa dang ldog par thal ba'i nyes pa yod de /
analyzed: 'jug pa dang ldog par thal ba'i nyes pa yod de /
translated: The fault of engaging and disengaging would follow.

original: gal te re zhig mig la sogs pa ma rig pa'i mtshan nyid yin par 'dod na rtag tu yod par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te re zhig mig la sogs pa ma rig pa'i mtshan nyid yin par 'dod na rtag tu yod par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If you assert that the eyes, etc. are the characteristics of ignorance, it follows that they would always exist,

original: dgra bcom pa la yang de yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa la yang de yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they exist even for arhats.

original: 'on te mig la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid ma rig pa yin na /
analyzed: 'on te mig la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid ma rig pa yin na /
translated: But if ignorance is the characteristic of the eyes, etc.

original: mig la sogs pa ni ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa yin pa'i phyir ma rig pa ma spangs kyang ldog par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa ni ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa yin pa'i phyir ma rig pa ma spangs kyang ldog par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: it follows that the eyes, etc. would cease even without abandoning ignorance, because the eyes, etc. are unobscured neutral states.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa yang mig la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa yang mig la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid yin par 'gyur te /
translated: Also, attachment, etc. would be the characteristics of the eyes, etc.

original: ma rig pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the characteristics of ignorance.

original: mig la sogs pa yang 'dod chags la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid yin na ni des na rtag tu yod par thal ba'i skyon de kho na de bzhin du gnas pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa yang 'dod chags la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid yin na ni des na rtag tu yod par thal ba'i skyon de kho na de bzhin du gnas pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: If the eyes, etc. are the characteristics of attachment, etc. then the error of their always existing would remain just as it was before,

original: dgra bcom pa la yang de yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa la yang de yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they exist even for arhats.

original: rig pa dang 'dra ba'i chos gzhan yang bram ze ma yin pa dang / gzhon nu ma yin pa bzhin du ma rig pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rig pa dang 'dra ba'i chos gzhan yang bram ze ma yin pa dang / gzhon nu ma yin pa bzhin du ma rig pa ma yin te /
translated: Another factor similar to knowledge is not ignorance, just as a non-brahmin and a non-youth are not a brahmin or a youth.

original: de med pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba ni rig pa dang 'dra ba chos gzhan de med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba ni rig pa dang 'dra ba chos gzhan de med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because it does not exist means because another factor similar to knowledge does not exist.

original: gal te yang dge ba'i shes rab 'ga' zhig yod la /
analyzed: gal te yang dge ba'i shes rab 'ga' zhig yod la /
translated: If there were any wholesome wisdom that is not knowledge,

original: rig pa yang ma yin na ni de rig pa dang 'dra bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: rig pa yang ma yin na ni de rig pa dang 'dra bar 'gyur na /
translated: it would be similar to knowledge.

original: de yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But that does not exist.

original: brgya zhig la shes rab yod la /
analyzed: brgya zhig la shes rab yod la /
translated: If there were any wisdom that is not knowledge,

original: rig pa dang 'dra bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: rig pa dang 'dra bar 'gyur na /
translated: it would be similar to knowledge.

original: de yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But that does not exist.

original: 'on te shes rab nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa dang chos 'dra bar rtog par byed na de'i phyir nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa lung du ma bstan pa'i shes rab kyi rdzas kyang ma rig pa yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te shes rab nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa dang chos 'dra bar rtog par byed na de'i phyir nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa lung du ma bstan pa'i shes rab kyi rdzas kyang ma rig pa yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If you imagine that non-afflicted wisdom is similar to a factor, then non-afflicted, neutral wisdom would be ignorance.

original: des ci nyes she na dgra bcom pa la yang yod par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: des ci nyes she na dgra bcom pa la yang yod par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: What is wrong with that? It follows that even arhats would have ignorance.

original: de la yod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la yod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it exists for them.

original: 'dir gcig kho nar nyon mongs pa can ma rig pa yin par brjod par 'dod na yang /
analyzed: 'dir gcig kho nar nyon mongs pa can ma rig pa yin par brjod par 'dod na yang /
translated: Even though it is asserted that only one is afflicted ignorance,

original: de ji ltar nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa lung du ma bstan pa'i shes rab kyi rdzas yin par 'gyur /
analyzed: de ji ltar nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa lung du ma bstan pa'i shes rab kyi rdzas yin par 'gyur /
translated: how could it be a substance of nonafflicted indeterminate wisdom?

original: @87b rig pa yang nyon mongs pa can la bdag po byed pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: @87b rig pa yang nyon mongs pa can la bdag po byed pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, afflicted wisdom does not act as the dominant condition.

original: smad pa'i rig pa yang chung ma ma yin pa dang / bu ma yin pa bzhin du ma rig pa ma yin te /
analyzed: smad pa'i rig pa yang chung ma ma yin pa dang / bu ma yin pa bzhin du ma rig pa ma yin te /
translated: Also, inferior wisdom is not ignorance, just as a nonwife is not a wife and a nonchild is not a child.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de med pa'i phyir zhes smos te /
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir zhes smos te /
translated: Because it does not exist.

original: smad pa'i rig pa de med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: smad pa'i rig pa de med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is said that because inferior wisdom does not exist, it is not ignorance.

original: gal te rig pa 'ga' zhig yod la smad pa yin par gyur na ni de ma rig pa yin no zhes rnam par gzhag tu rung ste /
analyzed: gal te rig pa 'ga' zhig yod la smad pa yin par gyur na ni de ma rig pa yin no zhes rnam par gzhag tu rung ste /
translated: If some wisdom existed and it were inferior, it would be tenable to posit it as ignorance.

original: dper na chung ma yod la smad pa yin pa'i phyir chung ma ma yin no zhes bya ba bzhin du rung na de yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dper na chung ma yod la smad pa yin pa'i phyir chung ma ma yin no zhes bya ba bzhin du rung na de yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: For example, it is not a wife because it exists and is despised, but that is not the case.

original: 'on te dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa'i phyir smad pa yin no zhes brjod na de gcig tu dge ba yin pa'i phyir ji ltar nyon mongs pa'i bdag po byed par 'thad la /
analyzed: 'on te dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa'i phyir smad pa yin no zhes brjod na de gcig tu dge ba yin pa'i phyir ji ltar nyon mongs pa'i bdag po byed par 'thad la /
translated: If you say that it is despised because it is contaminated virtue, then how could it be the dominant condition of the afflictions, since it is exclusively virtuous?

original: dgra bcom pa la yang yod pa'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa can yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa la yang yod pa'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa can yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: And because it exists even for arhats, it would be an affliction.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi shes rab kyi rdzas kyang ma rig pa yin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gal te shes rab tsam rig pa yin par rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi shes rab kyi rdzas kyang ma rig pa yin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gal te shes rab tsam rig pa yin par rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: Also, the substance of afflicted wisdom would be ignorance, because it is posited as wisdom that is not clear.üîΩWhat is wrong with that?

original: / ci nyes she na zhes bya ba ni de lta yin na nyes pa ci yod ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: / ci nyes she na zhes bya ba ni de lta yin na nyes pa ci yod ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: If that is so, what is wrong with that?

original: de'i phyir nyon mongs pa can gyi lta ba ma rig pa yin par 'gyur ro zhes smras so /
analyzed: de'i phyir nyon mongs pa can gyi lta ba ma rig pa yin par 'gyur ro zhes smras so /
translated: Therefore it is said that afflicted view would be ignorance.

original: // / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i dang po dang rnam par dbye ba bstan pa rgya cher 'grel pa /
analyzed: // / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i dang po dang rnam par dbye ba bstan pa rgya cher 'grel pa /
translated: The Commentary on the Exposition of the First and Divisions of Dependent Origination

original: bam po gsum pa /
analyzed: bam po gsum pa /
translated: Fascicle Three

original: ci nyes she na zhes bya ba ni des cir 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ci nyes she na zhes bya ba ni des cir 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: What is wrong with that? It means what is the point of that?

original: de'i phyir so sor ma rig pa'i phra rgyas dang / lta ba'i phra rgyas zhes mi brjod par 'gyur ro //üîΩde'i phyir gal te de las gzhan pa'i nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i shes rab ma rig pa yin par 'gyur ro zhes smras so //
analyzed: de'i phyir so sor ma rig pa'i phra rgyas dang / lta ba'i phra rgyas zhes mi brjod par 'gyur ro // de'i phyir gal te de las gzhan pa'i nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i shes rab ma rig pa yin par 'gyur ro zhes smras so //
translated: Therefore, it would not be called the ignorance that is an independently circulating proclivity, nor would it be called the proclivity to false views.üîΩTherefore, it is said that if it is ignorance that is the discernment associated with other defilements, then what is wrong with that?

original: ci nyes she na de'i phyir ma 'dres pa'i ma rig pa med par 'gyur ro zhes smras te /
analyzed: ci nyes she na de'i phyir ma 'dres pa'i ma rig pa med par 'gyur ro zhes smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that unmixed ignorance would not exist.

original: smad pa'i shes rab ma rig pa yin par bstan na smad pa yin na ji ltar nyon mongs pa can ma yin par 'gyur /
analyzed: smad pa'i shes rab ma rig pa yin par bstan na smad pa yin na ji ltar nyon mongs pa can ma yin par 'gyur /
translated: If it is taught that reproachable discernment is ignorance, then how can it be non-defiled?

original: de ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: It is of two kinds.

original: lta ba'i mtshan nyid dang de las gzhan pa'i nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'o //
analyzed: lta ba'i mtshan nyid dang de las gzhan pa'i nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'o //
translated: It is the characteristic of view and it is associated with other defilements.

original: de ni lta ba yin pa dang 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa gzhan dang mtshungs par 'gyur pa zhes bya 'o //
analyzed: de ni lta ba yin pa dang 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa gzhan dang mtshungs par 'gyur pa zhes bya 'o //
translated: It is called view and it is associated with other defilements such as attachment.

original: de la lta ba'i mtshan nyid ni lta ba'i phra rgyas so //
analyzed: de la lta ba'i mtshan nyid ni lta ba'i phra rgyas so //
translated: The characteristic of view is the proclivity of view.üîΩThat associated with other defilements is the proclivity of ignorance.

original: de las gzhan pa'i nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa ni ma rig pa'i phra rgyas yin nam 'dres pa'i ma rig pa ni nyon mongs pa gang dang gang 'grogs @88a * //üîΩpa ma yin pas de ni ma rig pa ma yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa ni ma rig pa'i phra rgyas yin nam 'dres pa'i ma rig pa ni nyon mongs pa gang dang gang 'grogs @88a * // pa ma yin pas de ni ma rig pa ma yin par 'gyur te /
translated: But if ignorance is not mixed with any other defilement, it would not be ignorance,

original: ma rig pa'i mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would not have the characteristic of ignorance.

original: yang skyon gzhan 'di yod de mi dge ba'i lta ba log par lta ba la sogs pa yang mi dge ba'i rtsa ba rmongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang skyon gzhan 'di yod de mi dge ba'i lta ba log par lta ba la sogs pa yang mi dge ba'i rtsa ba rmongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, this other fault would ensue: wrong views and other nonvirtuous views would not be associated with the root of nonvirtue, delusion.

original: lta ba yang shes rab yin la rmongs pa yang de las gzhan pa'i nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: lta ba yang shes rab yin la rmongs pa yang de las gzhan pa'i nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin te /
translated: View is wisdom, and delusion is concomitant with other afflictions.

original: shes rab dang ma rig pa zhes smras pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab dang ma rig pa zhes smras pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is said that wisdom and ignorance are different.

original: shes rab kyi rdzas gnyis mtshungs par ldan pa yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi rdzas gnyis mtshungs par ldan pa yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Two substances of wisdom do not coexist,

original: rdzas mnyam pa nyid nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdzas mnyam pa nyid nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are definitely equal in substance.

original: rig pa chung ba yang lan tshva med pa la sogs pa bzhin du ma rig pa yin te /
analyzed: rig pa chung ba yang lan tshva med pa la sogs pa bzhin du ma rig pa yin te /
translated: Also, a small amount of knowledge is ignorance, like a small amount of salt.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de'i phyir lugs las bzlog pa'i brgyad pa la sogs pa rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa'i rig pa zag pa med pa'i shes rab ma rdzogs pa'i rig pa yang ma rig pa yin par gyur te re zhes smras so //
analyzed: de'i phyir lugs las bzlog pa'i brgyad pa la sogs pa rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa'i rig pa zag pa med pa'i shes rab ma rdzogs pa'i rig pa yang ma rig pa yin par gyur te re zhes smras so //
translated: Therefore, the reverse order of the eight is stated: ‚ÄúEven the knowledge that is not complete, the uncontaminated wisdom of one who has entered to manifest the fruit of stream entry, is ignorance.‚Äù

original: de ltar gyur na nyes pa ci yod ce na so so'i skye bo'i bzhin du nyon mongs pa can yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar gyur na nyes pa ci yod ce na so so'i skye bo'i bzhin du nyon mongs pa can yin par 'gyur te /
translated: What is wrong with that? It would be afflicted, like an ordinary being.

original: ma rig pa yod pa'i phyir dang 'phags pa rnams la yang yang srid pa 'phen pa yod par 'gyur ba zhig na ma rig pas byas pa'i yang srid ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ma rig pa yod pa'i phyir dang 'phags pa rnams la yang yang srid pa 'phen pa yod par 'gyur ba zhig na ma rig pas byas pa'i yang srid ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Because ignorance exists, and because it would follow that even ƒÅryas would project rebirth, but they do not project rebirth created by ignorance.

original: ma rig pa'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the antidote to the affliction of ignorance.

original: 'on te so so'i skye bo rnams kyi dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa yang rig pa chung bas ma yin no zhes de ni rig pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on te so so'i skye bo rnams kyi dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa yang rig pa chung bas ma yin no zhes de ni rig pa ma yin no //
translated: But if you say that the virtue of ordinary beings is not non-ignorance because it is contaminated, that is not so.

original: de ni gcig tu nyon mongs can nyid la sogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni gcig tu nyon mongs can nyid la sogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is exclusively afflicted and so on.

original: rig pa dang bral ba gang yin pa de yang dge slong med pa'i gnas dang chu med pa'i dgon pa bzhin du ma rig pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rig pa dang bral ba gang yin pa de yang dge slong med pa'i gnas dang chu med pa'i dgon pa bzhin du ma rig pa ma yin te /
translated: And that which is devoid of knowledge is not ignorance, like a place without monks or a desert without water.

original: rig pa ma skyes pa'i rgyu so so'i skye bo'i rgyud kyi mig la sogs pa thams cad kyang ma rig pa yin par gyur ta re de ltar gyur na ni rnam par byang ba'i phyogs med pa'i skyon du 'gyur te /
analyzed: rig pa ma skyes pa'i rgyu so so'i skye bo'i rgyud kyi mig la sogs pa thams cad kyang ma rig pa yin par gyur ta re de ltar gyur na ni rnam par byang ba'i phyogs med pa'i skyon du 'gyur te /
translated: and the eyes and so on of ordinary beings, which are the causes of nonarisen vidya, would become ignorance.

original: ma rig pa'i mtshan nyid mig la sogs pa rnams rtag tu 'brel ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i mtshan nyid mig la sogs pa rnams rtag tu 'brel ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If that were so, there would be the fault of the absence of the side of purification because the characteristics of ignorance would always be related to the eyes and so on.

original: ji skad du sems nyon mongs par byed pa'i phyir dang sgrib pa yin pa'i phyir dang / dge ba dang mi mthun pa'i phyir dang / dge ba la skabs 'tshol ba'i phyir dang / bral ba ma yin pa ni 'dir phra rgyas zhes bshad do //
analyzed: ji skad du sems nyon mongs par byed pa'i phyir dang sgrib pa yin pa'i phyir dang / dge ba dang mi mthun pa'i phyir dang / dge ba la skabs 'tshol ba'i phyir dang / bral ba ma yin pa ni 'dir phra rgyas zhes bshad do //
translated: As it is said, ‚ÄúBecause it afflicts the mind, because it is an obscuration, because it is incompatible with virtue, because it seeks opportunities for virtue, and because it is not free from the mental afflictions, it is explained to be ananusaya.‚Äù

original: rig pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs chos gzhan ni ma rig pa yin no zhes bya bar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rig pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs chos gzhan ni ma rig pa yin no zhes bya bar rig par bya ste /
translated: It should be understood that ignorance is a phenomenon that is incompatible with vidya.

original: bsod nams ma yin pa dang / @88b grags pa ma yin pa lta bu dang zhes bya bas lhag ma 'di grub pa yin te /
analyzed: bsod nams ma yin pa dang / @88b grags pa ma yin pa lta bu dang zhes bya bas lhag ma 'di grub pa yin te /
translated: The remaining are established by ‚Äúlike nonmerit and nonfame.‚Äù

original: ji ltar bsod nams kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs chos gzhan la bsod nams yin no zhes bya ba dang / grags pa mi mthun pa'i phyir la grags pa ma yin no zhes bya ba de bzhin du rig pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa chos gzhan la ma rig pa zhes bya'o //üîΩmi dge ba'i chos thams cad ni dge ba'i chos rnams kun du 'byung ba dang mi mthun pa yin par 'dod du zin kyang 'on kyang ma rig pa kho na mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin par brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: ji ltar bsod nams kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs chos gzhan la bsod nams yin no zhes bya ba dang / grags pa mi mthun pa'i phyir la grags pa ma yin no zhes bya ba de bzhin du rig pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa chos gzhan la ma rig pa zhes bya'o // mi dge ba'i chos thams cad ni dge ba'i chos rnams kun du 'byung ba dang mi mthun pa yin par 'dod du zin kyang 'on kyang ma rig pa kho na mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin par brjod par bya ste /
translated: Just as merit is called a dharma that is contrary to demerit, and fame is called a dharma that is contrary to disrepute, so a dharma that is contrary to knowledge is called ignorance.

original: de ni de dag gi snga rol ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni de dag gi snga rol ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Although all nonvirtuous dharmas are considered contrary to the arising of virtuous dharmas, ignorance alone is called the contrary condition because it is the first of those dharmas.

original: ji skad du rmongs pa kho nas skye ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang de bzhin du ma rig pa kun 'byung ba las zag pa kun 'byung ba yin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ji skad du rmongs pa kho nas skye ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba dang de bzhin du ma rig pa kun 'byung ba las zag pa kun 'byung ba yin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: As it is said, ‚ÄúBecause of delusion alone, they are born,‚Äù and ‚ÄúThe arising of the contaminants is due to the arising of ignorance.‚Äù

original: rig pa ni shes bya'i rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi rnam pa phyin ci ma log par yang dag par mthong ba'i rnam pa gsal bar gyur ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rig pa ni shes bya'i rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi rnam pa phyin ci ma log par yang dag par mthong ba'i rnam pa gsal bar gyur ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because knowledge is the clear manifestation of the aspect of the correct seeing of the undistorted aspects of the general and specific characteristics of objects of knowledge.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs nye ba'i dbang du byas nas yang dag par rab tu mi mthong ba'i rnam pa nyid ni ma rig pa yin te /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs nye ba'i dbang du byas nas yang dag par rab tu mi mthong ba'i rnam pa nyid ni ma rig pa yin te /
translated: In terms of the proximate factors of instability, the aspect of not seeing correctly is ignorance.

original: mun pa'i rnam pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mun pa'i rnam pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it has the aspect of darkness.

original: de bas na de ni rig pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs zhes bya bar grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na de ni rig pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs zhes bya bar grub pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is established that it is the counteragent to knowledge.

original: ji ltar chags pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni chags pa med pa yin zhing zhe sdang gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni zhe sdang med pa yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar chags pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni chags pa med pa yin zhing zhe sdang gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni zhe sdang med pa yin te /
translated: Just as the counteragent to attachment is nonattachment and the counteragent to hatred is nonhatred,

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni nye ba'i dbang du byas nas kun du 'byung ba'i rnam pa dgra zla yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni nye ba'i dbang du byas nas kun du 'byung ba'i rnam pa dgra zla yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the counteragent to a factor of instability is an antidote that arises in terms of the proximate factors of instability.

original: de'i ngo bo yang gang zhe na zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa de'i 'o //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo yang gang zhe na zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa de'i 'o //
translated: What is its nature?

original: de'i phyir re zhig byams pa'i rnam pa'i sems la chags pa med pa'i rang gi ngo bo yang gang zhig yin /
analyzed: de'i phyir re zhig byams pa'i rnam pa'i sems la chags pa med pa'i rang gi ngo bo yang gang zhig yin /
translated: Therefore, first of all, what is the nature of nonattachment in a mind that has the aspect of loving-kindness?

original: mi sdug pa'i rnam pa la zhe sdang med pa yang gang zhig yin zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: mi sdug pa'i rnam pa la zhe sdang med pa yang gang zhig yin zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: And what is the nature of nonhatred in a mind that has the aspect of ugliness?

original: byams pa'i rnam pa ni sems kyis sems can bdag gir byed pa bzhin yin na der chags pa med pa'i rang gi ngo bo yongs su bcad par mi nus so //
analyzed: byams pa'i rnam pa ni sems kyis sems can bdag gir byed pa bzhin yin na der chags pa med pa'i rang gi ngo bo yongs su bcad par mi nus so //
translated: The aspect of loving-kindness is the mind‚Äôs taking sentient beings as its own, but it is impossible to define the nature of nonattachment in that.

original: mi sdug pa'i rnam pas yongs su spong bar byed pa bzhin yin na de la zhe sdang med pa'i rang gi ngo bo nges par bya bar mi nus te /
analyzed: mi sdug pa'i rnam pas yongs su spong bar byed pa bzhin yin na de la zhe sdang med pa'i rang gi ngo bo nges par bya bar mi nus te /
translated: The aspect of ugliness is the mind‚Äôs rejection of sentient beings, but it is impossible to define the nature of nonhatred in that.

original: de gnyis la ni de gnyis te chags pa dang zhe sdang mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi mtshan nyid med pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba la de gnyis la ni zhes bya ba ni chags pa med pa dang / zhe sdang med pa gnyis la'o //
analyzed: de gnyis la ni de gnyis te chags pa dang zhe sdang mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi mtshan nyid med pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba la de gnyis la ni zhes bya ba ni chags pa med pa dang / zhe sdang med pa gnyis la'o //
translated: For those two, nonattachment and nonhatred, do not have the characteristic of being counteragents to attachment and hatred.

original: de gnyis te zhes bya ba ni byams pa dang mi sdug pa'i rnam pa'i sems de gnyis te /
analyzed: de gnyis te zhes bya ba ni byams pa dang mi sdug pa'i rnam pa'i sems de gnyis te /
translated: The two are the two minds of loving kindness and repulsiveness.üîΩ

original: chags pa dang zhe sdang mi @89a * //üîΩmthun pa'i phyogs kyi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chags pa dang zhe sdang mi @89a * // mthun pa'i phyogs kyi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: These two, i.e., the mind of loving-kindness and the mind of the aspect of ugliness, are the characteristics of the adverse factors of attachment and hostility, respectively.üîΩAttachment and hostility are the adverse factors of nonattachment and nonhostility, respectively.

original: chags pa dang zhe sdang mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi mtshan nyid 'di gnyis ni go rims bzhin du chags pa med pa dang / zhe sdang med pa 'di gnyis kyi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi mtshan nyid chags pa dang zhe sdang yin no //
analyzed: chags pa dang zhe sdang mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi mtshan nyid 'di gnyis ni go rims bzhin du chags pa med pa dang / zhe sdang med pa 'di gnyis kyi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi mtshan nyid chags pa dang zhe sdang yin no //
translated: These two characteristics of the adverse factors of nonattachment and nonhostility are, respectively, the characteristics of the favorable factors of nonattachment and nonhostility, since attachment and hostility are adverse factors.

original: chags pa dang zhe sdang gi gnyen po yang chags pa med pa dang zhe sdang med pa gnyis yin la chags pa dang zhe sdang gnyis ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs su bstan to //
analyzed: chags pa dang zhe sdang gi gnyen po yang chags pa med pa dang zhe sdang med pa gnyis yin la chags pa dang zhe sdang gnyis ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs su bstan to //
translated: Nonattachment and nonhostility are the antidotes to attachment and hostility, respectively, and attachment and hostility are taught as adverse factors.

original: re zhig gnyen po gang yin pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyang de yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: re zhig gnyen po gang yin pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyang de yin nam zhe na /
translated: Are those that are antidotes also adverse factors?

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin la gnyen po ma yin pa yang yod de /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin la gnyen po ma yin pa yang yod de /
translated: There are adverse factors that are not antidotes.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi chos rnams yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi chos rnams yin no //
translated: They are afflicted phenomena.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi mtshan nyid kyang sngar mi mthun pa'i phyogs nye ba'i dbang du byas nas kun nas 'byung ba'i rnam pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin no zhes bstan zin to //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi mtshan nyid kyang sngar mi mthun pa'i phyogs nye ba'i dbang du byas nas kun nas 'byung ba'i rnam pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin no zhes bstan zin to //
translated: The characteristic of the counteragent has already been taught above in the section on the near enemy, in the statement: ‚ÄúThe aspect of origination is the counteragent to the near enemy.‚ÄùüîΩWho is able to discern the clear form of the eye faculty and so on?

original: mig la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams kyi gzugs dang ba'i rang gi ngo bo yang des par bya ba su zhig nus zhes bya ba ni yul gzugs dang ba'i rang gi ngo bo ma gtogs par gzhan gzugs dang ba'i rang gi ngo bo grub pa ma yin noüîΩzhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams kyi gzugs dang ba'i rang gi ngo bo yang des par bya ba su zhig nus zhes bya ba ni yul gzugs dang ba'i rang gi ngo bo ma gtogs par gzhan gzugs dang ba'i rang gi ngo bo grub pa ma yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: This means that apart from the clear form of the object, the clear form of the eye faculty and so on is not established.üîΩIt is ascertained that it exists from the performance of the action of seeing.

original: mthong ba'i bya ba byed pa las ni zhes bya ba ni mthong ba dang thos pa dang snom pa dang / ro myong ba dang reg pa'i bya ba byed pa las de yod par nges par bya ste /
analyzed: mthong ba'i bya ba byed pa las ni zhes bya ba ni mthong ba dang thos pa dang snom pa dang / ro myong ba dang reg pa'i bya ba byed pa las de yod par nges par bya ste /
translated: This means that it is ascertained that it exists from the performance of the action of seeing, hearing, smelling, tasting, and touching.

original: de dag gi mig dang rna ba la sogs pa yod par mngon pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: de dag gi mig dang rna ba la sogs pa yod par mngon pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: The meaning is that their eyes, ears, etc. exist.

original: long ba la sogs pa la mthong ba la sogs pa'i bya ba byed pa med pa'i phyir dang lus dang sems kyi gnas skabs kyi bye brag las kyang gnyid log pa la yod pa nyid du nges par gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: long ba la sogs pa la mthong ba la sogs pa'i bya ba byed pa med pa'i phyir dang lus dang sems kyi gnas skabs kyi bye brag las kyang gnyid log pa la yod pa nyid du nges par gzung bar bya'o //
translated: Because the blind, etc. do not perform the function of seeing, etc. and because of the difference in the condition of body and mind, it is ascertained that sleep exists.

original: 'dir kha cig smras pa dbang po lnga ni 'jug cing yid rang dbang med par 'jug pa ni gnyid yin no zhe'o //
analyzed: 'dir kha cig smras pa dbang po lnga ni 'jug cing yid rang dbang med par 'jug pa ni gnyid yin no zhe'o //
translated: Here, some say: The five sense-faculties engage and the mind engages without independence.

original: kha cig na re lus 'dzin mi nus par sems bsdus pa yin no zhe'o //
analyzed: kha cig na re lus 'dzin mi nus par sems bsdus pa yin no zhe'o //
translated: Some say: The mind is withdrawn without the ability to hold the body.

original: gtsor ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab dang zhes bya ba ni de ni mnyam par gzhag pa zag pa med pa yin pa'i phyir don dam par rig pa zhes bya'o ;
analyzed: gtsor ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab dang zhes bya ba ni de ni mnyam par gzhag pa zag pa med pa yin pa'i phyir don dam par rig pa zhes bya'o ;
translated: The foremost is supramundane wisdom, because that is equipoise that is uncontaminated, it is called knowledge in the ultimate sense.

original: / rnam par grol bar song ba yang yin te /
analyzed: / rnam par grol bar song ba yang yin te /
translated: It is also called liberation,

original: nye na shin tu nyon mongs pa spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: nye na shin tu nyon mongs pa spangs pa yin no //
translated: because it is the abandonment of the afflictions.

original: de dang rjes su mthun pa dang zhes bya ba ni de'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir zhes pa'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: de dang rjes su mthun pa dang zhes bya ba ni de'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir zhes pa'i tha tshig ste /
translated: In conformity with that means that is its cause.

original: 'bras bu'i rgyur brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i rgyur brjod pa yin no //
translated: It is called the cause of the result.üîΩFor the sake of that means for the sake of supramundane wisdom.

original: de'i ched du byed pa dang zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab kyi ched du byed pa @89b zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i ched du byed pa dang zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab kyi ched du byed pa @89b zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is the means for attaining supramundane wisdom.

original: de yongs su sbyor bar byed pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes thob pa'i thabs su gyur pa thos pa las byung ba la sogs pa'i shes rab ni rig pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de yongs su sbyor bar byed pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes thob pa'i thabs su gyur pa thos pa las byung ba la sogs pa'i shes rab ni rig pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Wisdom derived from hearing and so on is called knowledge since it is the method for attaining supramundane wisdom.

original: rgyu la 'bras bu nye bar btags pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu la 'bras bu nye bar btags pa yin no //
translated: The cause is designated as the result.

original: de dag gi mtshan nyid brjod pa ni yid ches pa'i tshig tshad ma la nges pa skyes pa ni thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab bo //
analyzed: de dag gi mtshan nyid brjod pa ni yid ches pa'i tshig tshad ma la nges pa skyes pa ni thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab bo //
translated: The statement of their characteristics is as follows: Wisdom derived from hearing is the arising of certainty in the valid cognition of trustworthy words.

original: rig pas dpyod pa las skyes pa ni bsams pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: rig pas dpyod pa las skyes pa ni bsams pa las byung ba'o //
translated: Wisdom derived from contemplation arises from the analysis of reasoning.

original: ting nge 'dzin las byung ba ni bsgoms pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin las byung ba ni bsgoms pa las byung ba'o //
translated: That which arises from concentration is born of meditation.

original: byung ba zhes bya ba ni rgyu yin pa la bya ste /
analyzed: byung ba zhes bya ba ni rgyu yin pa la bya ste /
translated: The term ‚Äúborn‚Äù should be understood as cause,

original: dper na zas las byung ba ni srog yin no //
analyzed: dper na zas las byung ba ni srog yin no //
translated: just as life is born of food,

original: rtsa las byung ba ni ba glang yin no zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: rtsa las byung ba ni ba glang yin no zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: and a bull is born of a cow.

original: gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bus gsungs pa'i mdo las kyang zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni 'dir gtsor dgongs pa ston pa yin no //
analyzed: gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bus gsungs pa'i mdo las kyang zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni 'dir gtsor dgongs pa ston pa yin no //
translated: The elder ≈öƒÅriputra‚Äôs s≈´tra is quoted at length here to show the intended meaning.

original: ji lta ba bzhin du rig pa yin pa dang zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni tshor ba dang rig pa dang shes pa zhes bya ba rnam grangs so //
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du rig pa yin pa dang zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni tshor ba dang rig pa dang shes pa zhes bya ba rnam grangs so //
translated: ‚ÄúKnowledge as it really is‚Äù is quoted at length. Feeling, perception, and knowledge are synonyms.

original: ji lta ba bzhin zhes bya ba phyin ci ma log pa'i don gyis so //
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin zhes bya ba phyin ci ma log pa'i don gyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúAs it really is‚Äù means without error.

original: de yang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab dang / de'i rjes las thob pa yang yin par bstan te /
analyzed: de yang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab dang / de'i rjes las thob pa yang yin par bstan te /
translated: It is taught that this is supramundane wisdom and the wisdom attained subsequently to it.

original: de dag kyang ji lta ba bzhin du rig pa yin no zhes 'dir nges pa'i tshig sgrub pa'i tshul du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang ji lta ba bzhin du rig pa yin no zhes 'dir nges pa'i tshig sgrub pa'i tshul du rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, it should be understood here in the sense of the derivation of the term.

original: de bas rnam par grol bar 'gro ba'am zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab kyis dang / de yongs su sbyong bar gyur pas kyang rim gyis rnam par grol bar 'gro zhing mya ngan las 'das pa thob par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de bas rnam par grol bar 'gro ba'am zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab kyis dang / de yongs su sbyong bar gyur pas kyang rim gyis rnam par grol bar 'gro zhing mya ngan las 'das pa thob par byed pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called knowledge because it goes to liberation, i.e., it goes to nirvana by means of supramundane wisdom and by means of the purification of that.

original: gtan tshigs des na rig pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gtan tshigs des na rig pa zhes bya ste /
translated: For that reason, it is called knowledge.

original: nges tshig ces bya ba ni rig pa'i rnam par nges pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: nges tshig ces bya ba ni rig pa'i rnam par nges pa'i tshig go //
translated: The derivation of the term is the derivation of the term knowledge.

original: rig par ram zhes bya ba ci zhe na /
analyzed: rig par ram zhes bya ba ci zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of knowledge?

original: des 'gro zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: des 'gro zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: It is connected with the term goes.

original: zag pa med pa'i shes rab yongs su sbyong bar gyur pa de 'gro zhing thob par 'gyur ba'i gtan tshigs des kyang rig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i shes rab yongs su sbyong bar gyur pa de 'gro zhing thob par 'gyur ba'i gtan tshigs des kyang rig pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called knowledge because it goes to the purification of uncontaminated wisdom and because it goes to the attainment of that.

original: ji ltar rigs par zhes bya ba ni ji ltar srid pa ji skad du brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar rigs par zhes bya ba ni ji ltar srid pa ji skad du brjod pa yin no //
translated: In whatever way is the way it is possible, as it has been described.

original: gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bus gsungs pa'i mdo de las kyang zhes rgyas par 'byung ba la mdo de las ni gang gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bus gsungs pa rab tu shes pa rab tu shes pa zhes rgya cher 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bus gsungs pa'i mdo de las kyang zhes rgyas par 'byung ba la mdo de las ni gang gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bus gsungs pa rab tu shes pa rab tu shes pa zhes rgya cher 'byung ba'o //
translated: The passage from the sutra spoken by the elder Sariputra is quoted in full in the commentary.

original: de ni shes pa'i don yin pa'i phyir rig pa zhes bya ba'i khams ni rig pa dang shes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de ni shes pa'i don yin pa'i phyir rig pa zhes bya ba'i khams ni rig pa dang shes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The element called vidya is called knowledge and consciousness.üîΩSince it is the meaning of knowledge, it is called vidya.

original: 'di rig pa yin pa de bas na rig pa zhes rnam par bshad pa'i rnam grangs ston par byed do //
analyzed: 'di rig pa yin pa de bas na rig pa zhes rnam par bshad pa'i rnam grangs ston par byed do //
translated: The term vidya is explained as follows.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩrab tu shes @90a * //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / rab tu shes @90a * //
translated: Why is that?üîΩIt is called vidya because it causes knowledge.

original: par byed pa zhes brjod pa ni shin tu grags pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: par byed pa zhes brjod pa ni shin tu grags pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is well known that it is called vidya because it causes knowledge.

original: bya ba byed pa gzhan med par byed pa po ston pa ji ltar rigs te zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni shes rab las ma gtogs par bya ba byed pa gzhan med par rab tu shes par byed do zhes bya ba byed pa po ston pa ji ltar
analyzed: bya ba byed pa gzhan med par byed pa po ston pa ji ltar rigs te zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni shes rab las ma gtogs par bya ba byed pa gzhan med par rab tu shes par byed do zhes bya ba byed pa po ston pa ji ltar
translated: How can it be said that it is the agent of causing knowledge without any other instrument of action?

original: rigs te 'di ltar skad cig ma la ni rab tu shes par byed pa'i byed pa po gzhan yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rigs te 'di ltar skad cig ma la ni rab tu shes par byed pa'i byed pa po gzhan yod pa ma yin no //
translated: It is reasonable, because in the case of the momentary, there is no other agent that is the instigator.

original: ji ltar mi rigs zhes de'i phyir 'di ltar lhag ma'i sbyor ba mthong ba ni med pa yin no zhe na zhes smras te /
analyzed: ji ltar mi rigs zhes de'i phyir 'di ltar lhag ma'i sbyor ba mthong ba ni med pa yin no zhe na zhes smras te /
translated: If you ask, ‚ÄúWhy is it unreasonable?‚Äù then it is said, ‚ÄúBecause the application of the remainder is not seen.‚Äù

original: 'jig rten na yang tshes pa'i bya ba byed pa ma gtogs par tshos zin pa la byed pa po'i sbyor ba mthong ba yod pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'jig rten na yang tshes pa'i bya ba byed pa ma gtogs par tshos zin pa la byed pa po'i sbyor ba mthong ba yod pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: In the world, apart from the performance of the action of cooking, the application of the agent is not seen in relation to that which is cooked.

original: 'di nyid gtsug lag las sgras ci chad gnyis kyi rjes su bsgrub par bya'o zhes rab tu sbyor ba 'di mthong ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'di nyid gtsug lag las sgras ci chad gnyis kyi rjes su bsgrub par bya'o zhes rab tu sbyor ba 'di mthong ba ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt this seen in the treatises, where it is said, ‚ÄúThe two are established in dependence on each other‚Äù?

original: ci'i phyir 'di ltar lhag ma'i sbyor ba mthong ba ni med pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di rjod par byed /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'di ltar lhag ma'i sbyor ba mthong ba ni med pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di rjod par byed /
translated: Why do you say, ‚ÄúBecause the application of the remainder is not seen‚Äù?

original: 'on te gtsug lag rang bzo ste tshad ma ma yin na ni sgra'i bstan bcos las lhag ma bstan pa yin no zhes de yang tshad mar byed pa ci'i phyir tshad ma yin /
analyzed: 'on te gtsug lag rang bzo ste tshad ma ma yin na ni sgra'i bstan bcos las lhag ma bstan pa yin no zhes de yang tshad mar byed pa ci'i phyir tshad ma yin /
translated: Why is it a valid cognition?

original: 'on te 'di gtsug lag ma yin no zhes brjod na ni 'di la brjod pa mang du yod pas shin tu 'phros pas gzhag go //
analyzed: 'on te 'di gtsug lag ma yin no zhes brjod na ni 'di la brjod pa mang du yod pas shin tu 'phros pas gzhag go //
translated: But if you say that it is not a treatise, then there is much to be said about this, but it is very extensive, so I will set it aside.

original: sa bon las myu gu 'byung bar byed ces bya ba las gzhan byed pa med kyang byed pa po ston pa 'di yang yod pa yin no ;
analyzed: sa bon las myu gu 'byung bar byed ces bya ba las gzhan byed pa med kyang byed pa po ston pa 'di yang yod pa yin no ;
translated: Although there is no activity other than ‚Äúthe seed produces the sprout,‚Äù this also exists as the demonstrator of the agent.

original: / rgol ba po yang dngos po tsam yin te bya ba byed pa gzhan med par byed pa po ston pa yin du chug na /
analyzed: / rgol ba po yang dngos po tsam yin te bya ba byed pa gzhan med par byed pa po ston pa yin du chug na /
translated: The opponent is also just a thing. Although it is permissible that it is the demonstrator of the agent without another activity,

original: 'o na ci'i phyir las ston bya ba byed pa med par gzugs yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes par byed pa de la ni bya ba byed pa med par byed pa po ston pa de la las dang 'brel pa yang yod pa ma
analyzed: 'o na ci'i phyir las ston bya ba byed pa med par gzugs yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes par byed pa de la ni bya ba byed pa med par byed pa po ston pa de la las dang 'brel pa yang yod pa ma
translated: why is it that the activity of the object is not demonstrated without activity? The one who makes form known just as it is does not have the activity of the object. The demonstrator of the agent does not have a connection with the object.

original: yin te / ji ltar khyod nyid kyi blos sa bon las myu gu 'byung bar byed do zhes bya ba las dang 'brel pa ma yin pa bzhin no zhe na de'i phyir las bstan pa ni shes rab kyi yul bstan pa'i phyir zhes smras so //
analyzed: yin te / ji ltar khyod nyid kyi blos sa bon las myu gu 'byung bar byed do zhes bya ba las dang 'brel pa ma yin pa bzhin no zhe na de'i phyir las bstan pa ni shes rab kyi yul bstan pa'i phyir zhes smras so //
translated: Therefore, the teaching of the action is for the purpose of teaching the object of wisdom.

original: ji ltar zhe na yul gang la shes rab skyes pa zhes rgya cher 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na yul gang la shes rab skyes pa zhes rgya cher 'byung ba yin no //
translated: How is that? When wisdom arises in regard to an object, etc.

original: de lta ma yin na shes rab kyi yul ma bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na shes rab kyi yul ma bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, the object of wisdom would not be taught.

original: de ni de snang bar skye ba na de la bya ba byed pa dang bcas pa lta bu kho nar snang ngo //
analyzed: de ni de snang bar skye ba na de la bya ba byed pa dang bcas pa lta bu kho nar snang ngo //
translated: When it arises in the appearance of that, it appears as if it has action.

original: ji ltar snang ba de bzhin du shes par byed pa de bas na rig pa zhes bya'o zhes 'di'i nges tshig byed pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar snang ba de bzhin du shes par byed pa de bas na rig pa zhes bya'o zhes 'di'i nges tshig byed pa yin no //
translated: It is called knowledge because it causes the appearance to be known as it appears. This is the derivation of the term.

original: yang na gang du mi mthun pa'i phyogs zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni gzugs la sogs @90b pa'i yul gang du mi mthun pa'i phyogs rig pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs mi shes pa de 'joms par byed pa rnam par 'jig par byed pa'i yul de rnam par shesüîΩpar byed do zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na gang du mi mthun pa'i phyogs zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni gzugs la sogs @90b pa'i yul gang du mi mthun pa'i phyogs rig pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs mi shes pa de 'joms par byed pa rnam par 'jig par byed pa'i yul de rnam par shes par byed do zhes bya'o //
translated: That is the object that is made known.

original: de ltar na bya ba byed pa dang bcas pa la yang las ston pa yod do zhes ston par byed do //
analyzed: de ltar na bya ba byed pa dang bcas pa la yang las ston pa yod do zhes ston par byed do //
translated: Thus, he shows that even in the case of that which has an action, there is the teaching of the object.

original: dper 'di na sgron ma ni sgron ma'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs mun pa 'joms pa'i yul de snang bar byed do zhes bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper 'di na sgron ma ni sgron ma'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs mun pa 'joms pa'i yul de snang bar byed do zhes bya ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like saying, ‚ÄúHere, a lamp illuminates the object that destroys the darkness which is the opposing side of the lamp.‚Äù

original: gang de zhes bya ba ni sngar bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: gang de zhes bya ba ni sngar bstan pa yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to what was taught earlier.

original: mdo sde de dang de las gsungs pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste gsus po che'i mdo las phung po lnga la zhes rgyas par gsungs nas nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po de dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mi shes pa dangüîΩ/ mi mthong ba dang mngon par mi rtogs pa zhes rgyas par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: mdo sde de dang de las gsungs pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste gsus po che'i mdo las phung po lnga la zhes rgyas par gsungs nas nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po de dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mi shes pa dang / mi mthong ba dang mngon par mi rtogs pa zhes rgyas par 'byung ba'o //
translated: The sutra states that the five aggregates are the self in the Mahapadana Sutra, etc.üîΩ The sutra states that the six sense spheres are the self in the Chadasrayasutra, etc.

original: de bzhin du skye mched drug po la zhes rgyas par gsungs nas skye mched drug po de dag nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mi shes pa dang mi mthong ba dang / mngon par mi rtogs pa zhes rgyas par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du skye mched drug po la zhes rgyas par gsungs nas skye mched drug po de dag nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mi shes pa dang mi mthong ba dang / mngon par mi rtogs pa zhes rgyas par 'byung ba'o //
translated: The sutra states that the six sense spheres are the self in the Chadasrayasutra, etc.

original: rgyas pa smos pa ni sngon gyi mtha' nas brtsams nas mun pa'i rnam pa'i bar du mdo sde'i dum bu thams cad ston par byed do //
analyzed: rgyas pa smos pa ni sngon gyi mtha' nas brtsams nas mun pa'i rnam pa'i bar du mdo sde'i dum bu thams cad ston par byed do //
translated: The word etc. refers to the entire section of the sutra from the beginning to the end, which is like a dark passage.

original: sngon gyi mtha' la sogs pa ni dmigs pa'o zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang / gnyi ga dang nang dang / phyi dang gnyi ga dang / las dang rnam par smin pa dang / gnyig dang sangs rgyas dang chos dang /
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' la sogs pa ni dmigs pa'o zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang / gnyi ga dang nang dang / phyi dang gnyi ga dang / las dang rnam par smin pa dang / gnyig dang sangs rgyas dang chos dang /
translated: The past limit, future limit, both, internal, external, both, karma, karmic maturation, both, Buddha, Dharma,

translated: Sa·πÖgha, suffering, origin, cessation, path, cause, origination, virtue, nonvirtue, reprehensible, irreproachable,

original: bsten par bya ba dang / bsten par bya ba ma yin pa dang / ngan pa dang / gya nom pa dang / nag po dang / dkar po dang / rnam par dbye ba dang bcas pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / reg pa'i skye mched drug rnams ni ma rig pa'i dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: bsten par bya ba dang / bsten par bya ba ma yin pa dang / ngan pa dang / gya nom pa dang / nag po dang / dkar po dang / rnam par dbye ba dang bcas pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / reg pa'i skye mched drug rnams ni ma rig pa'i dmigs pa yin no //

analyzed: mi shes pa la sogs pa ni rnam grangs so zhes bya ba ni mi shes pa dang / mi mthong ba dang / mngon par mi rtogs pa dang / rmongs pa dang / kun tu rmongs pa dang / ma rig pa dang / mun pa'i rnam pa dag ces bya ba yin no //
translated: Ignorance, non-vision, non-realization, delusion, confusion, nescience, and the aspect of darkness are synonyms.üîΩIgnorance associated with doubt about the prior limit and the posterior limit is stated in the sutra:

original: de la sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' gnyis la the tshom za ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i ma rig pa yin par gsungs pa ni ci bdag 'das pa'i dus na byung ba zhig gam /üîΩ'on te ma @91a * //

translated: What was self in the past?

analyzed: byung ba zhig gam / ji lta bur bdag byung ba yin /
translated: Was self in the past non-self?üîΩHow was self in the past?üîΩWhat will self become in the future?

analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud gnyi ga bye brag med pa kho nar bdag med pa yin par ma rtogs pa'i mi shes pa gang yin pa de ni ma 'dres pa'i ma rig pa yin par bstan to // las mi shes pa ni bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa yod pa nyid la the tshom za ba dang skur pa 'debs pa'o zhes bya ba de la bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa yod pa nyid la the tshom za ba dang ldan pa'i mi shes pa gang yin pa de ni the tshom za ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i ma rig pa yin par bstan to //
translated: The ignorance that does not understand the selflessness of both one‚Äôs own and another‚Äôs continuum is taught to be unmixed ignorance.üîΩThe ignorance of karma is doubt and denial regarding the existence of merit and demerit.üîΩThe ignorance that doubts the existence of merit and demerit is taught to be ignorance concomitant with doubt.

original: bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa yod pa nyid la bsod nams yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa yod pa nyid la bsod nams yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The ignorance that denies the existence of merit and demerit is taught to be ignorance concomitant with wrong view.

original: bsod nams ma yin pa yang yod pa ma yin no zhes skur pa 'debs pa rnams kyi mi @91b shes pa gang yin pa de ni log par lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin no //

original: bsod nams la yang bsod nams ma yin par 'du shes pa rnams kyi mi shes pa gang yin pa de ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang log par lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa yang yin no //

original: ji lta zhe na /üîΩgal te bsod nams la 'bras bu yid du mi 'ong ba'i rgyur gyur pa bsod nams ma yin pa yin no zhes rtog na tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin no //

analyzed: 'on te bsod nams la yid du 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'i rgyur gyur pa nyid cung zad kyang ma yin no zhe na /

analyzed: log par lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin no //

analyzed: de'i phyir phyugs gsod pa dang mer 'jug pa la sogs pa zhes smos te /

original: gal te yid du 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'i rgyur gyur pa'i bsod nams bzhin du bsod nams ma yin pa la rtog na ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu mtshungs par ldan pa yin no //

analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu phyin ci log tu skur pa 'debs pa'am /

analyzed: rnam par smin pa dang rgyu la skur pa 'debs pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: de'i rgyu gzhan du rtog par byed pa'i phyir ro //

original: rgyu med par smra ba rnams kyi yang yin no zhes bya ba ni gang dag rgyu yod pa ma yin no zhes smra ba de dag kyang gnyi gar mi shes pa log par lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i ma rig pa yin par bstan te /

original: rgyu la skur ba 'debs pa gang yin pa de ni rnam par smin pa'i rgyu sngon gyi yin par mi shes pas gnyi gar mi shes pa yin no zhes bstan no //

translated: The phrase ‚Äúnot comprehending‚Äù teaches that it is ignorance that is not mixed with other mental factors.

analyzed: the tshom za ba'am zhes bya ba ni the tshom za ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin no //

analyzed: log par lta ba'am zhes bya ba ni log par lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin no //

analyzed: 'gog pa'i mtshan nyid ni 'gog pa dang zhi ba dang / gya nom pa dang nges par 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid do //

analyzed: lam gyi mtshan nyid ni lam dang rig pa dang sgrub pa dang / nges par 'byin par byed pa'i mtshan nyid do //
