original: gzhag pa dang / yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang stobs dang byang chub kyi yan lag dang lam mo //
analyzed: gzhag pa dang / yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang stobs dang byang chub kyi yan lag dang lam mo //
translated: The factors of enlightenment are the applications of mindfulness, the right efforts, the bases of supernatural power, the faculties, the powers, the limbs of enlightenment, and the path.

original: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni mi shes pa dang le lo dang / g-yeng ba dang ma dad pa dang / dran pa nyams pa dang / shes bzhin ma yin pa dang / mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i phra rgyas rnams so //
analyzed: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni mi shes pa dang le lo dang / g-yeng ba dang ma dad pa dang / dran pa nyams pa dang / shes bzhin ma yin pa dang / mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i phra rgyas rnams so //
translated: Their counteragents are ignorance, laziness, distraction, lack of faith, loss of mindfulness, lack of full awareness, the proclivities that are to be eliminated by the path of seeing, and the proclivities that are to be eliminated by the path of cultivation.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams kyi rgyu ni skyes bu dam pa la brten pa dang / dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang / tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dang / sngon gyi tshe rabs la goms pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams kyi rgyu ni skyes bu dam pa la brten pa dang / dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang / tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dang / sngon gyi tshe rabs la goms pa'o //
translated: The causes of the factors of enlightenment are: reliance on holy persons, listening to the holy Dharma, proper attention, and habituation from previous lives.

original: de la skyes bu dam pa la brten pa dang dam pa'i chos nyan pa ni gzhan gyi rkyen gyi stobs so //
analyzed: de la skyes bu dam pa la brten pa dang dam pa'i chos nyan pa ni gzhan gyi rkyen gyi stobs so //
translated: Among these, reliance on holy persons and listening to the holy Dharma are the power of the conditions of others.

original: tshul bzhin yid la byed pa ni nang gyi rkyen gyi stobs so //
analyzed: tshul bzhin yid la byed pa ni nang gyi rkyen gyi stobs so //
translated: Proper attention is the power of the inner conditions.

original: sngon gyi tshe rabs la goms pa ni rgyu dang rkyen gyi stobs yin no //
analyzed: sngon gyi tshe rabs la goms pa ni rgyu dang rkyen gyi stobs yin no //
translated: Habituation from previous lives is the power of causes and conditions.

original: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi rgyu ni skyes bu dam pa ma yin pa la brten pa dang / dam pa'i chos ma yin pa nyan pa dang / tshul bzhin ma yin par yid la byed pa dang / sngon gyi tshe rabs la ma goms pa'o //
analyzed: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi rgyu ni skyes bu dam pa ma yin pa la brten pa dang / dam pa'i chos ma yin pa nyan pa dang / tshul bzhin ma yin par yid la byed pa dang / sngon gyi tshe rabs la ma goms pa'o //
translated: The causes of the factors that are incompatible with those are: reliance on unholy persons, listening to the unholy Dharma, improper attention, and lack of habituation from previous lives.

original: de la skyes bu dam pa ma yin pa la brten pa ni bdag po'i rkyen yin no //
analyzed: de la skyes bu dam pa ma yin pa la brten pa ni bdag po'i rkyen yin no //
translated: Among these, reliance on unholy persons is the dominant condition.

original: dam pa'i chos ma yin pa nyan pa ni dmigs pa'i rkyen yin no //üîΩtshul bzhin ma yin par yid la byed pa ni @93a * //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos ma yin pa nyan pa ni dmigs pa'i rkyen yin no // tshul bzhin ma yin par yid la byed pa ni @93a * //
translated: Listening to what is not the true Dharma is the objective condition.

original: de ma thag pa'i rkyen yin no //
analyzed: de ma thag pa'i rkyen yin no //
translated: Incorrect mental attention is the immediately preceding condition.

original: tshe rabs snga ma la ma goms pa ni rgyu'i rkyen yin te /
analyzed: tshe rabs snga ma la ma goms pa ni rgyu'i rkyen yin te /
translated: Lack of cultivation in previous lives is the causal condition.

original: de dag mi shes pa ni ji skad du de khong du mi chud pa'am /
analyzed: de dag mi shes pa ni ji skad du de khong du mi chud pa'am /
translated: Ignorance is explained as not understanding,

original: the tshom za ba'am /üîΩskur ba 'debs pa'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: the tshom za ba'am / skur ba 'debs pa'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: doubting, or denying.

original: de dag ni dge ba yin te /
analyzed: de dag ni dge ba yin te /
translated: These are virtuous,üîΩbecause they are for the sake of happiness and because they have pleasant results.

original: bde ba'i don gyi phyir dang / 'bras bu yid du 'ong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba byang chub kyi phyogs de dag bde ba'i don gyi phyir zhes bya ba ni gnod pa med pa'i don yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde ba'i don gyi phyir dang / 'bras bu yid du 'ong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba byang chub kyi phyogs de dag bde ba'i don gyi phyir zhes bya ba ni gnod pa med pa'i don yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The factors of enlightenment are for the sake of happiness because they are for the sake of non-affliction.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: de'i phyir 'bras bu yid du 'ong ba yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'bras bu yid du 'ong ba yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that they have pleasant results.

original: 'bras bu yid du mi 'ong ba ni gnod pa dang bcas pa yin pa'i don gyis mi bde ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu yid du mi 'ong ba ni gnod pa dang bcas pa yin pa'i don gyis mi bde ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The unpleasant result is called ‚Äúpain‚Äù because it is associated with injury.

original: ma rig pa'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dus re zhig pa dang gtan du ba ste /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dus re zhig pa dang gtan du ba ste /
translated: Because they are the antidote to ignorance.

original: dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa'i byang chub kyi phyogs rnams ni dus re zhig cig ma rig pa'i gnyen po yin no //
analyzed: dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa'i byang chub kyi phyogs rnams ni dus re zhig cig ma rig pa'i gnyen po yin no //
translated: The virtuous factors that are associated with the outflows are the antidote to ignorance for a limited time.

original: yang na dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa rnams ni 'bras bu yid du 'ong ba yin pa'i phyir bde ba yin te /
analyzed: yang na dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa rnams ni 'bras bu yid du 'ong ba yin pa'i phyir bde ba yin te /
translated: Or, the virtuous factors that are associated with the outflows are pleasant because they have a pleasant result.

original: de ni gnod pa med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni gnod pa med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are not injurious because they are not associated with the mental afflictions.

original: zag pa med pa rnams ni ma rig pa'i gnyen po yin pa'i don gyis gnod pa sel bar byed pa'i phyir bde ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zag pa med pa rnams ni ma rig pa'i gnyen po yin pa'i don gyis gnod pa sel bar byed pa'i phyir bde ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The uncontaminated factors are pleasant because they are the antidote to ignorance and because they remove injury.

original: smad pa'i don gyis kha na ma tho ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: smad pa'i don gyis kha na ma tho ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The term ‚Äúblameworthy‚Äù means that which is reprehensible.

original: de las bzlog pa kha na ma tho ba med pa ni mkhas pas bsngags pa'i don gyis yin no zhes bya bar grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa kha na ma tho ba med pa ni mkhas pas bsngags pa'i don gyis yin no zhes bya bar grub pa yin no //
translated: The opposite of that is without fault, because it is praised by the wise.

original: mkhas pa smos pa ni rmongs shing phyin ci log pas bsngags pa bstsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mkhas pa smos pa ni rmongs shing phyin ci log pas bsngags pa bstsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The mention of the wise is to exclude praise by the ignorant and the perverse.üîΩIt is to be relied upon because it is to be made manifest again and again.

original: bsten par bya ba ni yang nas yang mngon du bya ba'i don gyis so zhes bya ba ci'i phyir zhe na phan pa yin pa'i phyir te phan pa ni yang nas yang du mngon du bya ba yin pa'i don gyis bsten par bya bar 'os pa yin no
analyzed: bsten par bya ba ni yang nas yang mngon du bya ba'i don gyis so zhes bya ba ci'i phyir zhe na phan pa yin pa'i phyir te phan pa ni yang nas yang du mngon du bya ba yin pa'i don gyis bsten par bya bar 'os pa yin no
translated: Why? Because it is beneficial. That which is beneficial is worthy of being relied upon because it is to be made manifest again and again.üîΩIt is satisfying because it satisfies body and mind.

original: ; / tshim par byed pa ni lus dang sems tshim par byed pa'i don gyis te zhes bya ba ji ltar yin zhe na de'i phyir shin tu sbyangs pa'i bye brag dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ; / tshim par byed pa ni lus dang sems tshim par byed pa'i don gyis te zhes bya ba ji ltar yin zhe na de'i phyir shin tu sbyangs pa'i bye brag dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: How is that? Therefore he says, because it has the special quality of pliancy.

original: de dag ni lus dang sems la tshim par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni lus dang sems la tshim par byed pa yin no //
translated: Those are what satisfy body and mind.

original: dkar ba ni dri ma med pa'i don gyis te /
analyzed: dkar ba ni dri ma med pa'i don gyis te /
translated: It is bright because it is stainless.

original: ji lta zhe na /üîΩde'i phyir zag pa med pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na / de'i phyir zag pa med pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes lta zhe na /
translated: How so?üîΩBecause they are uncontaminated.

original: de'i phyir zag pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir zag pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes smras te /
translated: Because they are uncontaminated.

original: zag pa rnams ni sems dang sems las byung ba'i dri ma lta bu yin no //
analyzed: zag pa rnams ni sems dang sems las byung ba'i dri ma lta bu yin no //
translated: Contaminants are like stains of the mind and mental factors.

original: de las bzlog pa zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ji lta bu zhe na /üîΩde dag ni mi dge ba ste mi bde ba'i don gyis yin te /
analyzed: de las bzlog pa zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ji lta bu zhe na / de dag ni mi dge ba ste mi bde ba'i don gyis yin te /
translated: The opposite of that is the opposite of the contaminants.üîΩThey are nonvirtuous because they are the opposite of virtue.

original: de 'bras bu yid du mi 'ong ba yin @93b pa'i phyir dang / rig pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin pa'i don gyis so //
analyzed: de 'bras bu yid du mi 'ong ba yin @93b pa'i phyir dang / rig pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin pa'i don gyis so //
translated: They are the opposite of virtue because they are the opposite of virtue, because they are the opposite of the result of virtue, because they are the opposite of the cause of virtue, because they are the opposite of the basis of virtue, because they are the opposite of the essence of virtue, because they are the opposite of the aspect of virtue, because they are the opposite of the antidote of virtue, because they are the opposite of the object of virtue, and because they are the opposite of the time of virtue.

original: kha na ma thob dang bcas pa ni mi mkhas pas bsngags pa'i don gyis sam /üîΩsmad pa'i don gyis so //
analyzed: kha na ma thob dang bcas pa ni mi mkhas pas bsngags pa'i don gyis sam / smad pa'i don gyis so //
translated: They are reprehensible because they are the opposite of what is praised by the wise.üîΩThey are reprehensible because they are the opposite of what is praised by the wise, because they are the opposite of what is praised by the noble ones, because they are the opposite of what is praised by the world, because they are the opposite of what is praised by oneself, and because they are the opposite of what is praised by others.

original: bstan par bya ba ma yin pa ni mngon du bya ba ma yin pa'i don gyis te /üîΩmi phan pa yin pa'i phyir bsten par 'os pa ma yin pas so //
analyzed: bstan par bya ba ma yin pa ni mngon du bya ba ma yin pa'i don gyis te /üîΩmi phan pa yin pa'i phyir bsten par 'os pa ma yin pas so //
translated: They are not to be revealed because they are the opposite of what is to be revealed.üîΩThey are not to be revealed because they are the opposite of what is to be revealed, because they are the opposite of what is to be seen, because they are the opposite of what is to be heard, because they are the opposite of what is to be sensed, because they are the opposite of what is to be cognized, because they are the opposite of what is to be known, because they are the opposite of what is to be understood, because they are the opposite of what is to be realized, because they are the opposite of what is to be directly perceived, and because they are the opposite of what is to be manifested.

original: tshim par byed pa ma yin pa ni lus dang sems tshim par byed pa ma yin pa'i don gyis te shin tu sbyangs pa ma yin pa'i bye brag dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshim par byed pa ma yin pa ni lus dang sems tshim par byed pa ma yin pa'i don gyis te shin tu sbyangs pa ma yin pa'i bye brag dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Not satisfying is in the sense of not satisfying body and mind, because it is associated with the particular of not being serenity.

original: nag po ni dri ma med pa yin pa'i don gyis te /
analyzed: nag po ni dri ma med pa yin pa'i don gyis te /
translated: Black is in the sense of being impure.

original: ji lta zhe na zag pa dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji lta zhe na zag pa dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: How so? Because it is associated with the outflows.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang 'dra ba'i rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ni byang chub kyi phyogs de dag nyid mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang 'dra ba'i rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ni byang chub kyi phyogs de dag nyid mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: The concordant dependent origination of the adverse side is just that of the factors of enlightenment with its adverse side.

original: ji lta zhe na de'i phyir skyes bu dam pa dang / skyes bu dam pa ma yin pa la brten pa la sogs pa dang tshe rabs snga ma'i rgyu la brten te byung ba'i phyir ro zhes smras so //
analyzed: ji lta zhe na de'i phyir skyes bu dam pa dang / skyes bu dam pa ma yin pa la brten pa la sogs pa dang tshe rabs snga ma'i rgyu la brten te byung ba'i phyir ro zhes smras so //
translated: How so? Therefore, it is said that it arises in dependence on the support of a holy person or an un-holy person, etc., and the cause of a previous life.

original: reg pa'i skye mched drug yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du khong du chud par mi shes pa gang yin pa de ni mngon par nga rgyal dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i ma rig pa yin par bstan to //
analyzed: reg pa'i skye mched drug yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du khong du chud par mi shes pa gang yin pa de ni mngon par nga rgyal dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i ma rig pa yin par bstan to //
translated: The ignorance that is associated with the pride of thinking ‚ÄúI am‚Äù is taught to be the ignorance that does not understand the six sense bases as they are in reality.

original: de la reg pa'i skye mched drug ni mig dang rna ba dang / sna dang lce dang / lus dang yid kyi skye mched rnams te de skye ba'i sgo'i don gyis so //üîΩde la dmigs pa 'jig rten las 'das pa bdag med pa'i ye shes kyis ni de dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du khong du chud pa yin no zhes bya ba ni mthong ba dang / thos pa dang bsnams pa dang / ro myangs pa dang reg pa dang /
analyzed: de la reg pa'i skye mched drug ni mig dang rna ba dang / sna dang lce dang / lus dang yid kyi skye mched rnams te de skye ba'i sgo'i don gyis so // de la dmigs pa 'jig rten las 'das pa bdag med pa'i ye shes kyis ni de dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du khong du chud pa yin no zhes bya ba ni mthong ba dang / thos pa dang bsnams pa dang / ro myangs pa dang reg pa dang /
translated: The six sense bases are the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind sense bases, because they are the doors for the arising of consciousness.üîΩThe supramundane wisdom of selflessness understands them as they are in reality.

original: rnam par shes pa'i sgo nas de dag la 'jig tshogs la lta ba 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i sgo nas de dag la 'jig tshogs la lta ba 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The view of the transitory collection arises in relation to those through the doors of seeing, hearing, smelling, tasting, touching, and cognizing.

original: de'i phyir bdag med pa'i ye shes ni de dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du khong du chud pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag med pa'i ye shes ni de dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du khong du chud pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Therefore, the knowledge of selflessness is called ‚Äúthe thorough understanding of them just as they are.‚Äù

original: de'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is their antidote.

original: mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba'i rnam pa dang ldan pa smon pa med pa'i shes pa ni de dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du khod du chud pa ma yin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba'i rnam pa dang ldan pa smon pa med pa'i shes pa ni de dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du khod du chud pa ma yin pa ma yin te /
translated: The knowledge of wishlessness, which has the aspects of impermanence and suffering, is not the thorough understanding of them just as they are.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du khong du chud pa smos pa ni 'jig rten pa'i bdag med pa shes pa las bye brag tu bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du khong du chud pa smos pa ni 'jig rten pa'i bdag med pa shes pa las bye brag tu bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The mention of ‚Äúthorough understanding of them just as they are‚Äù is in order to distinguish it from the mundane knowledge of selflessness.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de la dmigs pa 'jig rten las 'das pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de la dmigs pa 'jig rten las 'das pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is called ‚Äúsupramundane‚Äù because it focuses on that.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du khong du chud pa de ni 'jig rten pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du khong du chud pa de ni 'jig rten pa ma yin no //
translated: That thorough understanding of them just as they are is not mundane.

original: lam mi shes pa dang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa mi shes pa la bye /
analyzed: lam mi shes pa dang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa mi shes pa la bye /
translated: It is said that the knowledge of the path and the knowledge of the thorough understanding of things just as they are are the knowledge of the path and the knowledge of the thorough understanding of things just as they are.

original: @94a * // brag ci yod ce na zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rtogs pa la yang lam yin te /
analyzed: @94a * // brag ci yod ce na zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rtogs pa la yang lam yin te /
translated: The path is also the correct understanding of reality,

original: lam la mi shes pa yang bstan pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: lam la mi shes pa yang bstan pa yin no zhe na /
translated: and the path is also taught to be ignorance.

original: de'i phyir des ni ji ltar mu stegs can bzhin du lam la lam yin par mi mos so zhes rgyas par smras so //
analyzed: de'i phyir des ni ji ltar mu stegs can bzhin du lam la lam yin par mi mos so zhes rgyas par smras so //
translated: Therefore, he says in detail, ‚ÄúOne does not believe in the path as a path, like the tƒ´rthikas.‚ÄùüîΩThat which is engagement is coming and going.

original: 'jug pa gang yin pa de ni 'ong ba dang 'gro ba dang zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' dang gnyi ga zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: 'jug pa gang yin pa de ni 'ong ba dang 'gro ba dang zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' dang gnyi ga zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: This is the prior limit, the later limit, and both.

original: sngon gyi mtha' mi shes pa zhes rgyas par bstan pa yin no //üîΩde la sngon gyi mtha' nas phyi ma'i mtha' zhes bya ba ni 'ong ba yin no //
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' mi shes pa zhes rgyas par bstan pa yin no // de la sngon gyi mtha' nas phyi ma'i mtha' zhes bya ba ni 'ong ba yin no //
translated: It is taught in detail, ‚ÄúOne does not know the prior limit.‚ÄùüîΩThere, the prior limit is called the later limit, which is coming.

original: phyi ma'i mtha' nas sngon gyi mtha' zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba yin no //
analyzed: phyi ma'i mtha' nas sngon gyi mtha' zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba yin no //
translated: The later limit is called the prior limit, which is going.

original: sems can zhes bya ba 'jug pa gang yin pa yang rang dang gzhan gyi rgyud kyi zhes bya ba ni nang mi shes pa dang zhes rgyas par bstan pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can zhes bya ba 'jug pa gang yin pa yang rang dang gzhan gyi rgyud kyi zhes bya ba ni nang mi shes pa dang zhes rgyas par bstan pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The ‚Äúso-called sentient beings‚Äù are the ‚Äúinternal non-understanding of the self and others‚Äù and so on.üîΩMoreover, the ‚Äúso-called sentient beings‚Äù are the ‚Äúcoming and going‚Äù that is characterized by the prior limit and the subsequent limit.üîΩThis is the ‚Äúso-called sentient beings‚Äù that are the ‚Äúinternal non-understanding of the self and others‚Äù and so on.

original: de yang sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' 'ong ba dang 'gro ba'i mtshan nyid de sems can zhes bya ba'i dngos po 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' 'ong ba dang 'gro ba'i mtshan nyid de sems can zhes bya ba'i dngos po 'jug pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, this ‚Äúso-called sentient beings‚Äù is the ‚Äúcoming and going‚Äù that is characterized by the prior limit and the subsequent limit.üîΩThis is the ‚Äúso-called sentient beings‚Äù that are the ‚Äúinternal non-understanding of the self and others‚Äù and so on.

original: de ltar 'jug pa yang so so'i las kyi rnam par smin pa 'byin par byed pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de ltar 'jug pa yang so so'i las kyi rnam par smin pa 'byin par byed pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: Moreover, this ‚Äúso-called sentient beings‚Äù is the ‚Äúcoming and going‚Äù that is characterized by the prior limit and the subsequent limit.

analyzed: mi shes pa la sogs pa yang de bzhin no //

original: gzhan yang gang dag gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma rig pa yin no zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni gang gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma rig pa yin pa de ni mi shes pa dang mi mthong ba dang mngon par mi rtogs pa zhes bya ba rnam grangs

analyzed: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni mi shes pa'i rnam grangs kyis bstan to //
translated: The synonyms for the absence of knowledge are stated as the counteragents to that.

original: bsams pa las byung ba ni mthong ba dang zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: bsams pa las byung ba ni mthong ba dang zhes bya ba yin te /

analyzed: yang dag par nges par rtogs pa'i rnam pa yin pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni mthong ba'i rnam grangs kyis bstan to //

analyzed: bsgoms pa las byung ba ni mngon par rtogs pa zhes bya ba yin te /

original: nyon mongs pa spong ba mngon du gyur cing phyin ci ma log par rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa spong ba mngon du gyur cing phyin ci ma log par rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //

original: mngon par zhes bya ba 'di ni mngon sum gyi don yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mngon par zhes bya ba 'di ni mngon sum gyi don yin par rig par bya'o //

original: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni mngon par ma rtogs pa zhes bya ba'i rnam grangs kyis bstan to //
analyzed: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni mngon par ma rtogs pa zhes bya ba'i rnam grangs kyis bstan to //
translated: The synonyms for the absence of realization are stated as the counteragents to that.

original: de'i yul bkab pa'i don gyis zhes bya ba ni rig pa de dag gi yul zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i yul bkab pa'i don gyis zhes bya ba ni rig pa de dag gi yul zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

original: mun par gyur pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ji ltar mun pa de'i thog tu bab pa'i phyir dang / snang ba'i bgegs su gyur pa'i snang bar bya ba'i don 'gebs par byed do //

translated: Because it is a darkness means that, just as darkness covers the eye sense faculty and obscures the object of seeing,

original: ma rig pa yang de bzhin te /
analyzed: ma rig pa yang de bzhin te /

original: de la dmigs shing skyes pas rig par bya ba'i don dang rig pa kun du 'byung ba gnyen po la yang g-yogs par byed pa bzhin du 'gebs par byed do //
analyzed: de la dmigs shing skyes pas rig par bya ba'i don dang rig pa kun du 'byung ba gnyen po la yang g-yogs par byed pa bzhin du 'gebs par byed do //
translated: Since it arises in dependence on that, it obscures the object of seeing and the seeing itself, just as a cover obscures.

original: de ltar na 'di ni ma 'dres pa'i ma rig pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na 'di ni ma 'dres pa'i ma rig pa yin te /

original: rmongs pa zhes bya ba'i rnam grangs kyis bstan to //
analyzed: rmongs pa zhes bya ba'i rnam grangs kyis bstan to //
translated: It is taught by the synonyms ‚Äúdelusion‚Äù and ‚Äúdarkness.‚Äù

original: log par mthong bar byed pa'i don gyis kyang mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin no //
analyzed: log par mthong bar byed pa'i don gyis kyang mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin no //
translated: It is also a counteragent because it causes wrong seeing.

original: log par mthong ba ni phyin ci log tu 'dzin pa'i rnam pa yin no //
analyzed: log par mthong ba ni phyin ci log tu 'dzin pa'i rnam pa yin no //

original: ji ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar yin zhe na /

original: yid gnyis dang / blo ngan pa dang / blo med pa'i nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid gnyis dang / blo ngan pa dang / blo med pa'i nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is concomitant with the afflictions of doubt, wrong view, and absence of view.

analyzed: 'di ltar yid gnyis kyi nyon mongs pa dang rab tu sbyor ba ni the tshom gyis so //

analyzed: blo ngan pa'i nyon mongs pa dang rab tu sbyor ba ni log par lta ba la sogs pas so //

original: blo med pa'i nyon mongs pa dang rab tu sbyor ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pas so //üîΩde la gang yid gnyis kyi nyon mongs pa dang rab tu sbyor ba de ni kun du rmongs pa'i rnam grangs kyis bstan to //
analyzed: blo med pa'i nyon mongs pa dang rab tu sbyor ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pas so // de la gang yid gnyis kyi nyon mongs pa dang rab tu sbyor ba de ni kun du rmongs pa'i rnam grangs kyis bstan to //
translated: The afflictions of no understanding are applied to attachment and so on.üîΩAmong these, the afflictions of indecision are taught by the synonyms of confusion.

original: gang blo ngan pa dang gang yin pa de ni ma rig pa'i rnam grangs kyis so //
analyzed: gang blo ngan pa dang gang yin pa de ni ma rig pa'i rnam grangs kyis so //
translated: The afflictions of bad understanding are taught by the synonyms of ignorance.

original: blo med pa'i nyon mongs pa gang yin pa de ni mun pa'i rnam grangs kyis so //
analyzed: blo med pa'i nyon mongs pa gang yin pa de ni mun pa'i rnam grangs kyis so //
translated: The afflictions of no understanding are taught by the synonyms of darkness.

original: re zhig kun du rmongs pa dang yid gnyis @96b kyis nyon mongs par rab tu sbyor bar ston pa gang yin pa de ni rigs te /
analyzed: re zhig kun du rmongs pa dang yid gnyis @96b kyis nyon mongs par rab tu sbyor bar ston pa gang yin pa de ni rigs te /
translated: It is reasonable that the afflictions of indecision and confusion are taught by the synonyms of confusion,

original: kun du rmongs pa ni the tshom za ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun du rmongs pa ni the tshom za ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because confusion is doubt.

original: mun pa'i rnam pa dang blo med pa'i nyon mongs par rab tu sbyor bar ston pa ni rigs te /
analyzed: mun pa'i rnam pa dang blo med pa'i nyon mongs par rab tu sbyor bar ston pa ni rigs te /
translated: It is correct to teach that the aspect of darkness and the mental affliction of non-understanding are applied,

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa mngon du gyur na ci yang mthong ba med pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa mngon du gyur na ci yang mthong ba med pa yin te /
translated: because when attachment and so on are manifest, nothing is seen.

original: chags pa po ni chos mi shes //
analyzed: chags pa po ni chos mi shes //
translated: The attached one does not know dharmas.

original: chags pa po ni chos mi mthong //üîΩzhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chags pa po ni chos mi mthong // zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The attached one does not see dharmas.

original: ma rig pa dang blo ngan pa'i nyon mongs pa rab tu sbyor bar ji ltar bstan du rung zhe na zhes bya ba ni ci'i phyir bstan par mi bya zhe na /
analyzed: ma rig pa dang blo ngan pa'i nyon mongs pa rab tu sbyor bar ji ltar bstan du rung zhe na zhes bya ba ni ci'i phyir bstan par mi bya zhe na /
translated: How can it be proper to teach that the mental affliction of non-understanding and bad understanding are applied?

original: rig pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs chos gzhan ma rig pa yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: rig pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs chos gzhan ma rig pa yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is taught in order to show that non-understanding is a dharma that is the opposite of understanding,

original: de'i phyir tshor ba dang rig pa dang shes rab ces bya ba ni zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te tshor ba dang rig pa ni sgra la 'chel ba rnams kyi shes rab dang don tha dad pa ma yin par bshad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir tshor ba dang rig pa dang shes rab ces bya ba ni zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te tshor ba dang rig pa ni sgra la 'chel ba rnams kyi shes rab dang don tha dad pa ma yin par bshad do //
translated: then in response to that, it is said: Feeling, understanding, and wisdom are not different. Feeling and understanding are explained as not different from wisdom in the case of those who cling to words.

original: ma'i rnam pa ni smad pa'i don yin te /
analyzed: ma'i rnam pa ni smad pa'i don yin te /
translated: The form of a mother is the meaning of ‚Äúinferior.‚Äù

original: chung ma med pa dang bu med pa bzhin no //
analyzed: chung ma med pa dang bu med pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like the absence of a wife and the absence of a son.

original: smad pa'i rig pa de lta ba lnga'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: smad pa'i rig pa de lta ba lnga'i rang bzhin te /
translated: That knowledge is of the nature of the five views.

original: rig pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi mtshan nyid 'di la yod pas ma rig pa ni 'bru mang po pa'i don gyis ma rig pa'i rnam grangs kyi sgra ston par byed do //
analyzed: rig pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi mtshan nyid 'di la yod pas ma rig pa ni 'bru mang po pa'i don gyis ma rig pa'i rnam grangs kyi sgra ston par byed do //
translated: Since the characteristic of the counteragent to knowledge exists in this, ignorance is taught to be a term that is a bahuvrƒ´hi compound.

original: dngos su ni ma rig pa'i sgra mi mthun pa'i phyogs la bya'o //
analyzed: dngos su ni ma rig pa'i sgra mi mthun pa'i phyogs la bya'o //
translated: In fact, the term ‚Äúignorance‚Äù should be applied to the counteragent.

original: de ltar byas na ma rig pa dang blo ngan par rab tu sbyor bar ston pa yin no ;
analyzed: de ltar byas na ma rig pa dang blo ngan par rab tu sbyor bar ston pa yin no ;
translated: If this is done, it shows that ignorance is applied to bad understanding.üîΩThe master ƒÄryadeva says:üîΩIgnorance is not knowing the beginning and so on.üîΩThis shows that ignorance is not knowing the six sense bases up to the truth of suffering.

original: / slob dpon 'chang ba ni zhes bya ba ni slob dpon thogs med do //
analyzed: / slob dpon 'chang ba ni zhes bya ba ni slob dpon thogs med do //
translated: The master ƒÄryadeva says:üîΩIgnorance is not knowing the beginning and so on.

original: sngon gyi mtha' la sogs pa mi shes pa zhes bya ba ni ji skad du reg pa'i skye mched drug yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin khod du chud pa la thug pa'i bar du mi shes pa zhes ston to //
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' la sogs pa mi shes pa zhes bya ba ni ji skad du reg pa'i skye mched drug yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin khod du chud pa la thug pa'i bar du mi shes pa zhes ston to //
translated: This shows that ignorance is not knowing the six sense bases up to the truth of suffering.

original: gtan tshigs rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya ste /
analyzed: gtan tshigs rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya ste /
translated: The reason should be understood as twofold:

original: bdag tu 'dzin pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i gtan tshigs dang / de las grol ba'i bgegs byed pa'i gtan tshigs kyis so //
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i gtan tshigs dang / de las grol ba'i bgegs byed pa'i gtan tshigs kyis so //
translated: the reason that accords with the apprehension of self and the reason that obstructs liberation from that.

original: bdag tu 'dzin pa de las grol ba ni de las grol ba'o //
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin pa de las grol ba ni de las grol ba'o //
translated: Liberation from the apprehension of self is liberation from that.

original: de'i bgegs byed pa ni de dag gi bgegs byed pa ste /
analyzed: de'i bgegs byed pa ni de dag gi bgegs byed pa ste /
translated: Obstructing that is obstructing those.

original: de'i bgegs byed pa nyid du mi shes pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i bgegs byed pa nyid du mi shes pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the reason that obstructs that is the reason that obstructs liberation from the apprehension of self.

original: bdag tu 'dzin pa yang rnam pa gsum ste zhes rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin pa yang rnam pa gsum ste zhes rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: The apprehension of self is threefold, as stated in the sutra.

original: rtag par 'dzin pa ni bdag rtag pa'i rdzas su mngon par zhen pa'o //
analyzed: rtag par 'dzin pa ni bdag rtag pa'i rdzas su mngon par zhen pa'o //
translated: The apprehension of permanence is the manifest clinging to a permanent self.

original: de dang rjes su mthun pa ni sngon gyi mtha' mi shes pa dang / phyi ma'i mtha' mi shes pa dang / sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' mi shes pa zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de dang rjes su mthun pa ni sngon gyi mtha' mi shes pa dang / phyi ma'i mtha' mi shes pa dang / sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' mi shes pa zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: The reason that accords with that is the ignorance of the prior limit, the ignorance of the later limit, and the ignorance of the prior and later limits.

original: dus la rmongs pa ni @97a * //
analyzed: dus la rmongs pa ni @97a * //
translated: Delusion about time

original: rtag pa'i lta bar ltung ba yin no //
analyzed: rtag pa'i lta bar ltung ba yin no //
translated: is the falling into the view of permanence.

original: dngos po 'dzin pa ni bdag med pa'i dngos po la bdag gi dngos por mngon par zhen pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po 'dzin pa ni bdag med pa'i dngos po la bdag gi dngos por mngon par zhen pa'o //
translated: The grasping of a real entity is the adherence to the idea that a non-self entity is a self entity.

original: de dang rjes su mthun pa ni nang mi shes pa dang / phyi mi shes pa dang / nang dang phyi mi shes pa zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de dang rjes su mthun pa ni nang mi shes pa dang / phyi mi shes pa dang / nang dang phyi mi shes pa zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: The corresponding is the ignorance of the internal, the ignorance of the external, and the ignorance of the internal and the external.

original: skye mched drug la rmongs pa ni de la bdag tu rtogs par byed do //
analyzed: skye mched drug la rmongs pa ni de la bdag tu rtogs par byed do //
translated: The delusion in regard to the six sense-fields is the cause of the idea of self.

original: byed pa po dang zab por 'dzin pa ni las dang rnam par smin pa dang // dus dang skye gnas la byed pa po dang / zab por bdag gi rdzas su mngon par zhen pa'o //
analyzed: byed pa po dang zab por 'dzin pa ni las dang rnam par smin pa dang // dus dang skye gnas la byed pa po dang / zab por bdag gi rdzas su mngon par zhen pa'o //
translated: The grasping of the doer and the experiencer is the adherence to the idea that the self is the substance of the doer and the experiencer in regard to action, retribution, time and destiny.

original: de dang rjes su mthun pa ni las mi shes pa dang / rnam par smin pa mi shes pa dang / las dang rnam par smin pa mi shes pa zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de dang rjes su mthun pa ni las mi shes pa dang / rnam par smin pa mi shes pa dang / las dang rnam par smin pa mi shes pa zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: The corresponding is the ignorance of action, the ignorance of retribution, and the ignorance of action and retribution.

original: las dang rnam par smin pa la rmongs pa ni byed pa po dang za ba po gzhan zhig yan par rtog par byed de /
analyzed: las dang rnam par smin pa la rmongs pa ni byed pa po dang za ba po gzhan zhig yan par rtog par byed de /
translated: The delusion in regard to action and retribution is the cause of the idea of another doer and another experiencer.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba mngon par mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba mngon par mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they do not understand dependent origination.

original: de ltar sngon gyi mtha' la sogs pa dngos po drug mi shes pa gang yin pa de ni bdag tu 'dzin pa dang rjes su mthun pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar sngon gyi mtha' la sogs pa dngos po drug mi shes pa gang yin pa de ni bdag tu 'dzin pa dang rjes su mthun pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the ignorance of the six things beginning with the prior limit should be understood as the conformity to the belief in a self.

original: bdag tu 'dzin pa rnam pa gsum ste de bzhin du 'jug pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin pa rnam pa gsum ste de bzhin du 'jug pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa'i phyir ro //

original: gal te bdag gi dngos po zhig yod pa yin na ni de yang rtag pa dang rang dbang can dang byed pa po dang zab por gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te bdag gi dngos po zhig yod pa yin na ni de yang rtag pa dang rang dbang can dang byed pa po dang zab por gyur pa yin no //

original: de lta na ni 'jug par rigs kyi gzhan du ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta na ni 'jug par rigs kyi gzhan du ma yin no //
translated: In that case, it would be reasonable to engage in it, not otherwise.

original: de las thar pa'i bgegs byed pa yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de las thar pa'i bgegs byed pa yang rnam pa bzhi ste /

analyzed: skyabs su 'gro ba mi shes pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas mi shes pa dang / chos dang dge 'dun la zhes gang smras pa yin te /
translated: The ignorance of the refuge is the ignorance of the Buddha, the Dharma, and the Sa·πÖgha, as stated.

original: 'di ni de las thar pa'i bgegs byed pa nyid du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ni de las thar pa'i bgegs byed pa nyid du rig par bya ste /

original: dkon mchog gsum la mi brten pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum la mi brten pa'i phyir ro //

original: bdag tu 'dzin pa spang ba'i mngon par bya ba'i don ni bden pa rnams yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin pa spang ba'i mngon par bya ba'i don ni bden pa rnams yin par rig par bya ste /

analyzed: de bas na mthong bar bya ba'i don zhes bya ste /

analyzed: mthong bar bya ba'i don de nyid ci zhe na /

original: khong du mi chud pa zhes skabs dang sbyar te sdug bsngal mi shes pa nas lam mi shes pa zhes bya ba'i bar 'di ni de las gral ba'i bgegs byed pa nyid du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: khong du mi chud pa zhes skabs dang sbyar te sdug bsngal mi shes pa nas lam mi shes pa zhes bya ba'i bar 'di ni de las gral ba'i bgegs byed pa nyid du rig par bya ste /

original: bden pa mthong ba ni bdag tu 'dzin pa'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bden pa mthong ba ni bdag tu 'dzin pa'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / gnyen po spangs pa dang skyed pa ci zhe na mi shes pa zhes bya ste /

original: de la mi mthun pa'i phyogs spang ba khong du chud pa ni rgyu mi shes pa zhes bya ba nas rgyu @97b las yang dag par byung ba dang / mi dge ba dang / zag pa dang bcas pa la sogs pa nas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i bar du mi shes pa gang yin pa smras pa 'di yang de la grol ba'i bgegs byed pa nyid yin par rig par bya ste /

analyzed: gnyen po skyed pa mi shes pa ni rgyu mi shes pa nas rgyu las yang dag par byung ba dang / dge ba dang kha na mtho ba med pa dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i bar du mi shes pa gang yin pa gang smras pa 'di ni de las grol ba'i bgegs byed pa nyid yin par rig par bya ste /

original: byang chub kyi phyogs rnams ni bdag tu 'dzin pa'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs rnams ni bdag tu 'dzin pa'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro //

original: gnyen po la mngon pa'i nga rgyal med pa ci zhe na /
analyzed: gnyen po la mngon pa'i nga rgyal med pa ci zhe na /

original: mi rtogs pa zhes skabs dang sbyar te reg pa'i skye mched drug yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du khong du chud pa mi shes pa 'di yang nga las grol ba'i bgegs byed pa nyid yin par rig par bya ste /

analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du khong du chud pa ni bdag tu 'dzin pa'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro //

original: skyabs su 'gro ba la nye bar brten pa ni sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa la dmigs pa mnyan pa dang bsam ba dang goms pa'i sbyor bas mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang bral zhing gnyen po 'phel ba yin te /

analyzed: bden pa rtogs na phyin ci ma log pa'i sems ni bdag tu 'dzin pa spong ba yin no //

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las bstan pa zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni de la sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' mi shes pa ni sngar bstan pa las bye brag 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /

original: de bzhin du nang du mi shes pa yang bye brag med do //
analyzed: de bzhin du nang du mi shes pa yang bye brag med do //
translated: Similarly, internal ignorance is not different.

original: phyi la ni yod de sems can gyi grangs su ma gtogs pa yul rjod par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi la ni yod de sems can gyi grangs su ma gtogs pa yul rjod par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: External ignorance is different, because it refers to objects not included in the number of sentient beings.

analyzed: nang dang phyi mi shes pa la bye brag yod de rgyud gzhan gyi 'du byed rnams la tshul bzhin ma yin par mdza' bo dang mi mdza' ba dang tha mal ba'i sems can du bltas pas 'du byed tsam yin par ni mi rtogs pa'i mi shes pa gang yin pa ste de yang 'jig tshogs la lta ba rjes su chags pa dang khong khro ba dang so sor ma brtags pa'i btang snyoms dang mtshungs @98a * //

translated: with attachment, hostility, and indifference that is not thorough analysis.üîΩThe conditioning factors of other continua are ‚Äúinner‚Äù because they are

analyzed: rgyud gzhan gyi 'du byed ni sems can gyi grangs su gtogs pa'i phyir nang yin no //

translated: They are ‚Äúouter‚Äù because they are external to one‚Äôs own continuum.

original: las mi shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: las mi shes pa gang zhe na /

analyzed: de lta ni de tshul bzhin ma yin par brtags pa yin no //

original: rnam par smin pa mi shes pa gang zhe na rnam par smin pas bsdus pa'i 'du byed rnams la myong ba po nyid du tshul bzhin ma yin par rtogs pa'i mi shes pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni bdag sna tshogs pa can la lta bas mchogüîΩtu bzung nas myong ba po nyid du rtog par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa mi shes pa gang zhe na rnam par smin pas bsdus pa'i 'du byed rnams la myong ba po nyid du tshul bzhin ma yin par rtogs pa'i mi shes pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni bdag sna tshogs pa can la lta bas mchogüîΩtu bzung nas myong ba po nyid du rtog par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: What is the ignorance that consists in the non-understanding of the result of evolution? It is the non-understanding that consists in the non-apprehension of the result of evolution in regard to the formative forces that are included in the result of evolution.üîΩThe ignorance that consists in the non-understanding of the result of evolution refers to the non-apprehension of the result of evolution in regard to the formative forces that are included in the result of evolution.

original: yang na tshor ba'i rnam pa ni de la phan pa dang gnod pa byed pa'i dbang du byas nas myong ba po nyid du rtog par byed kyi tshul bzhin ma yin par brtags pa ni ma yin no //

analyzed: las dang de'i 'bras bu yang phyin ci log tu zhes bya ba ni ji ltar phyin ci log ce na /

analyzed: de'i phyir tshul bzhin ma yin par rtogs pa zhes smras te /

original: de ltar yin na de phyin ci log tu brtags pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar yin na de phyin ci log tu brtags pa yin te /

original: tshul bzhin ma yin par yid la byed pas log par brtags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin par yid la byed pas log par brtags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are incorrectly attended to and distortedly conceived.

original: ji ltar par sig la sogs pa dag ma la sogs pa'i gan du song ba'i phyir mtho ris su 'gro ba la sogs par rtog pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar par sig la sogs pa dag ma la sogs pa'i gan du song ba'i phyir mtho ris su 'gro ba la sogs par rtog pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the Parivrajaka and others who, because of going to their mother and so on, conceive of going to heaven and so on.

original: de yang tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / log par lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i ma rig pa yang yin par bstan te /
analyzed: de yang tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / log par lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i ma rig pa yang yin par bstan te /
translated: Moreover, it is associated with morality and ritualism and with wrong views.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu phyin ci log tu lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro//
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu phyin ci log tu lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro//
translated: It is taught that it is also ignorance associated with wrong views of cause and effect.

original: sangs rgyas mi shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas mi shes pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is ignorance of the Buddha?

analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams ni byang chub yin par yid la mi byed pa'am /
translated: It is the failure to take to heart the fact that the Buddhas are enlightened,

original: phyin ci log tu yid la byed pa'am /
analyzed: phyin ci log tu yid la byed pa'am /

original: zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'i tshig yin no //

original: de ltar yid la mi byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar yid la mi byed pa yin zhe na /

analyzed: de'i phyir bag med pa'am zhes smras te bag med pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i @98b ma rig pa yin par bstan to //
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚Äúthrough heedlessness,‚Äù in order to show that it is ignorance associated with heedlessness.

original: ji ltar phyin ci log tu yid la byed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar phyin ci log tu yid la byed ce na /
translated: How is it that the Buddhas are taken to heart in a distorted way?

original: the tshom za ba'am skur pa 'debs pa zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: the tshom za ba'am skur pa 'debs pa zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: It is said, ‚Äúthrough doubt and disparagement.‚Äù

original: snga ma bzhin zhes bya ba ni kun la yang yid la mi byed pa'am /üîΩphyin ci log tu yid la byed pa'am /
analyzed: snga ma bzhin zhes bya ba ni kun la yang yid la mi byed pa'am / phyin ci log tu yid la byed pa'am /
translated: As before means that one should not attend to it, or attend to it in a distorted way.

original: bag med pa'am the tshom za ba'am /üîΩskur pa 'debs pa'o zhes bya bar ston to //
analyzed: bag med pa'am the tshom za ba'am / skur pa 'debs pa'o zhes bya bar ston to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúas before‚Äù indicates that one does not give attention to the truths, or one gives attention to them in a distorted manner, or one does not do so with a concentrated mind, or one does so in a careless manner, or one does so with doubt, or one does so with contempt.üîΩThe same should be said, as appropriate, about the path, up to:

original: de bzhin du lam gyi bar du ji ltar rigs par brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de bzhin du lam gyi bar du ji ltar rigs par brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the ignorance of the origination?

original: kun 'byung la kun 'byung bar yid la mi byed pa'am zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: kun 'byung la kun 'byung bar yid la mi byed pa'am zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin no //
translated: It is the absence of knowledge regarding the origination of suffering, or the distorted knowledge regarding it, or the absence of knowledge regarding the origination of the origination, or the distorted knowledge regarding it.üîΩWhat is the ignorance of cessation?

original: 'gog pa la 'gog par yid la mi byed pa'am zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin no //üîΩlam la lam nyid du yid la mi byed pa'am /
analyzed: 'gog pa la 'gog par yid la mi byed pa'am zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin no // lam la lam nyid du yid la mi byed pa'am /
translated: It is the absence of knowledge regarding the cessation of suffering, or the distorted knowledge regarding it, or the absence of knowledge regarding the cessation of cessation, or the distorted knowledge regarding it.üîΩWhat is the ignorance of the path?

original: phyin ci log tu yid la byed pa'am zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: phyin ci log tu yid la byed pa'am zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin no //
translated: It is the absence of knowledge regarding the path to the cessation of suffering, or the distorted knowledge regarding it, or the absence of knowledge regarding the path of the path, or the distorted knowledge regarding it.

original: rgyu mi shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu mi shes pa gang zhe na /

original: rgyu med pa'am /
analyzed: rgyu med pa'am /

original: mi mthun pa dbang phyug la sogs pa zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni gal te rgyu yod pa ma yin no zhes rgyu med par rtog na log par lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin no //

translated: If one imagines that it is not a cause, it is ignorance associated with wrong view.

original: 'on te mi mthun pa dbang phyug la sogs pa rgyur rtog na tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i ma rig pa yin no //üîΩrgyu la ji lta bar rgyu las yang dag par byung ba'i chos la yang de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni gal te de dag rgyu med par byung ba'am /
analyzed: 'on te mi mthun pa dbang phyug la sogs pa rgyur rtog na tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i ma rig pa yin no // rgyu la ji lta bar rgyu las yang dag par byung ba'i chos la yang de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni gal te de dag rgyu med par byung ba'am /
translated: If one imagines that it is a cause that is not in conformity with the effect, it is ignorance associated with the esteeming of morality and asceticism.

original: mi mthun pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i chos yin par rtog na 'di yang log par lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i ma rig pa yin pa bstan te /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i chos yin par rtog na 'di yang log par lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i ma rig pa yin pa bstan te /
translated: Just as with the cause, so also with the effect: if one imagines that the effect arises without a cause or from a cause that is not in conformity with the effect, this is also ignorance associated with wrong view.

original: rgyu la skur pa 'debs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu la skur pa 'debs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is a denial of the cause.

original: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa yang yin te /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa yang yin te /
translated: It is also concomitant with the overesteeming of morality and asceticism,

original: rgyu ma yin pa la rgyur rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu ma yin pa la rgyur rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it conceives a cause to be nonexistent.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu phyin ci log tu lta ba dang skur pa 'debs pa ni log par lta ba yin pas log par lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa nyid du yang rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu phyin ci log tu lta ba dang skur pa 'debs pa ni log par lta ba yin pas log par lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa nyid du yang rtogs pa yin no //
translated: It is also concomitant with wrong view, because the view that the effect is the opposite of the cause and the view that deny the real are wrong views.

original: de dag kyang dge ba ni kha na mtho ba med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de dag rgyu las yang dag par byung ba'i chos zhes bya ba'i don gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang dge ba ni kha na mtho ba med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de dag rgyu las yang dag par byung ba'i chos zhes bya ba'i don gang yin pa'o //
translated: They are also called right views because they are the cause of the arising of the Dharma that is free from reproach.

original: kha na mtho ba med pa'i don kyang mkhas pas bsngags pa'i don gyi zhes sngar bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: kha na mtho ba med pa'i don kyang mkhas pas bsngags pa'i don gyi zhes sngar bstan pa yin no //
translated: The meaning of free from reproach was previously explained as the meaning of praised by the wise.

original: mi dge ba ni kha na mtho ba dang bcas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni mkhas pas smad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mi dge ba ni kha na mtho ba dang bcas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni mkhas pas smad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: They are also called wrong views because they are the cause of the arising of the Dharma that is associated with reproach.üîΩThe meaning of associated with reproach was previously explained as the meaning of despised by the wise.

original: de lta na 'dir tshig snga ma gnyis ni bstan pa yin la phyi ma gnyis ni 'chad par 'gyur ba yin no //üîΩbsten @99a * //
analyzed: de lta na 'dir tshig snga ma gnyis ni bstan pa yin la phyi ma gnyis ni 'chad par 'gyur ba yin no // bsten @99a * //
translated: Thus, the first two terms are the teaching, and the latter two are the explanation.

original: par bya ba dang bsten par bya ba ma yin pa gnyis ni bstan pa'i tshig yin la /
analyzed: par bya ba dang bsten par bya ba ma yin pa gnyis ni bstan pa'i tshig yin la /
translated: The two terms ‚Äúto be practiced‚Äù and ‚Äúnot to be practiced‚Äù are the teaching.

original: ngan pa dang gya nom pa zhes bya ba gnyis ni so sor 'chad pa'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: ngan pa dang gya nom pa zhes bya ba gnyis ni so sor 'chad pa'i tshig yin no //
translated: The two terms ‚Äúinferior‚Äù and ‚Äúsuperior‚Äù are the explanation.

original: de la gya nom pa nyid yin pa'i phyir bsten par bya ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: de la gya nom pa nyid yin pa'i phyir bsten par bya ba nyid yin no //
translated: It is to be practiced because it is superior.

original: de nyid kyi phyir phan pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras so ;
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir phan pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras so ;
translated: Therefore, it is said that it is beneficial.

original: / ngan pa yin pa'i phyir bsten par bya ba ma yin pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / ngan pa yin pa'i phyir bsten par bya ba ma yin pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not to be practiced because it is inferior.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mi phan pa nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes smras so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mi phan pa nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes smras so //
translated: Therefore, it is said that it is not beneficial.

original: kha na mtho ba dang bcas pa dang kha na mtho ba med pa nyid kyi don ni rjod par byed do //
analyzed: kha na mtho ba dang bcas pa dang kha na mtho ba med pa nyid kyi don ni rjod par byed do //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúwith offense‚Äù and ‚Äúwithout offense‚Äù is stated.

original: kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa ni nag po nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes smras so ;
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa ni nag po nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes smras so ;
translated: because it is black because it is associated with demerit.

original: / de ltar na de ni mkhas pas smad pa yin no //
analyzed: / de ltar na de ni mkhas pas smad pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the wise despise it.

original: kha na mtho ba med pa ni dkar po nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kha na mtho ba med pa ni dkar po nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is white because it is free from demerit.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de dag ni mkhas pas bstod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de dag ni mkhas pas bstod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the wise praise it.üîΩIt is mixed because it is associated with differentiation.

original: rnam par dbye ba'i cha dang bcas pa ni 'dren ma nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gnyen po dang mi mthun pa'i cha ni rnam par dbye ba ba'i cha'o //
analyzed: rnam par dbye ba'i cha dang bcas pa ni 'dren ma nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gnyen po dang mi mthun pa'i cha ni rnam par dbye ba ba'i cha'o //
translated: The part that is the antidote is the part that is differentiation.

original: rnam par dbye ba'i cha dang lhan cig pa ni rnam par dbye ba'i cha dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par dbye ba'i cha dang lhan cig pa ni rnam par dbye ba'i cha dang bcas pa ste /
translated: That which is associated with the part that is differentiation is associated with differentiation.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang 'dres pa zhes bya ba'i don gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang 'dres pa zhes bya ba'i don gang yin pa'o //
translated: The meaning is that it is mixed with the adverse side.

original: reg pa'i skye mched drug yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du khong du chud pa mi shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: reg pa'i skye mched drug yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du khong du chud pa mi shes pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the ignorance of not understanding the six sense bases as they are?

original: rtogs pa la zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni reg pa'i skye mched drug yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du khong du chud pa ni rtogs pa'i chos kyi nang du 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtogs pa la zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni reg pa'i skye mched drug yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du khong du chud pa ni rtogs pa'i chos kyi nang du 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The term ‚Äúrealization‚Äù in the above passage is used because the six sense bases of contact are included in the Dharma of realization, which is understood as it truly is.

original: de la sems phyin ci log rnam pa du ma yod de de bas na mngon pa'i nga rgyal can mi shes pa gang yin pa'o zhes smras so //
analyzed: de la sems phyin ci log rnam pa du ma yod de de bas na mngon pa'i nga rgyal can mi shes pa gang yin pa'o zhes smras so //
translated: There are many kinds of erroneous mind, and so it is said that the one who is full of pride and ignorant is the one who is not a knower of the Dharma.

original: ma rtogs par rtogs so snyam pa'i 'du shes gang yin pa'i don to ;
analyzed: ma rtogs par rtogs so snyam pa'i 'du shes gang yin pa'i don to ;
translated: The meaning of this is that he has the notion that he has realized what he has not realized.üîΩAll of these ignorances are summarized as the seven kinds of confusion.

original: / mi shes pa de dag thams cad mdor bsdu na kun du rmongs pa rnam pa bdun te zhes rgyas par 'byung ba la dus la rmongs pa ni ji skad du sngon gyi mtha' mi shes pa nas sngon dang phyi ma'i mtha' zhes bya ba'i bar du smrasüîΩpa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: / mi shes pa de dag thams cad mdor bsdu na kun du rmongs pa rnam pa bdun te zhes rgyas par 'byung ba la dus la rmongs pa ni ji skad du sngon gyi mtha' mi shes pa nas sngon dang phyi ma'i mtha' zhes bya ba'i bar du smrasüîΩpa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Confusion about time is the ignorance of the prior limit, and so on, up to the prior and later limits.

original: dngos po la kun du rmongs pa ni nang mi shes pa nas nang dang phyi mi shes pa'i bar du smras pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: dngos po la kun du rmongs pa ni nang mi shes pa nas nang dang phyi mi shes pa'i bar du smras pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: Delusion about things is the delusion about the internal, up to the delusion about the internal and external.

original: skye mched drug ni bdag tu mngon par zhen pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye mched drug ni bdag tu mngon par zhen pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The six sense spheres are the cause of the manifest clinging to a self.

original: 'pho ba la kun du rmongs pa ni las mi shes pa zhes bya ba nas las dang rnam par smin pa mi shes pa zhes gang smras pa yin te /
analyzed: 'pho ba la kun du rmongs pa ni las mi shes pa zhes bya ba nas las dang rnam par smin pa mi shes pa zhes gang smras pa yin te /
translated: Delusion about transmigration is the delusion about karma, up to the delusion about karma and ripening.

original: las kyi rnam par smin pa 'byin pa'i phyir ris mthun pa gzhan @99b du 'pho ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las kyi rnam par smin pa 'byin pa'i phyir ris mthun pa gzhan @99b du 'pho ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it causes the ripening of karma and because it causes transmigration to another life in a different realm.

original: mchog la kun du rmongs pa ni sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun mi shes pa zhes gang smras pa yin te /
analyzed: mchog la kun du rmongs pa ni sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun mi shes pa zhes gang smras pa yin te /
translated: Delusion about the supreme is the delusion about the Buddha, Dharma, and Sangha.

original: dkon mchog gsum ni chos rnams thams cad kyi tshogs kyi mchog yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum ni chos rnams thams cad kyi tshogs kyi mchog yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the Three Jewels are the supreme collection of all dharmas.

original: sems can rnams kyi mchog ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa yin no //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi mchog ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa yin no //
translated: The supreme of sentient beings is the Bhagavat Buddha, who is fully enlightened.

original: de la brten nas chos rnams mchog yin te /
analyzed: de la brten nas chos rnams mchog yin te /
translated: The Dharma is supreme among them,

original: chos rnam pa gsum char yang rtag tu dge ba nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / nges par 'byin pa nyid kyi phyir dang / legs par gsungs pa nyid kyi phyir te /
analyzed: chos rnam pa gsum char yang rtag tu dge ba nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / nges par 'byin pa nyid kyi phyir dang / legs par gsungs pa nyid kyi phyir te /
translated: because the three aspects of the Dharma are always virtuous, because they definitely liberate, and because they are well-proclaimed.

original: go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: go rims bzhin no //
translated: They are respectively:

original: tshogs rnams kyi mchog ni dge 'dun te /
analyzed: tshogs rnams kyi mchog ni dge 'dun te /
translated: The Sangha is supreme among assemblies,

original: zhib thob par bya ba'i phyir legs par zhugs pa yin pas so //
analyzed: zhib thob par bya ba'i phyir legs par zhugs pa yin pas so //
translated: because it is well-endowed with the attainment of the result.

original: de kho na nyid la kun du rmongs pa ni sdug bsngal mi shes pa nas lam mi shes pa'i bar du smras pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de kho na nyid la kun du rmongs pa ni sdug bsngal mi shes pa nas lam mi shes pa'i bar du smras pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Delusion about reality is the ignorance of suffering, up to the ignorance of the path, as stated.

original: sdug bsngal la sogs pa phyin ci ma log pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la sogs pa phyin ci ma log pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are the non-erroneous nature of suffering, etc.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba la kun du rmongs pa ni rgyu mi shes pa nas rnam par dbye ba dang bcas pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i bar du smras pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba la kun du rmongs pa ni rgyu mi shes pa nas rnam par dbye ba dang bcas pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i bar du smras pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: Delusion about affliction and purification is the ignorance of cause, up to the ignorance of the dependent origination that is associated with differentiation, as stated.

original: de la byang chub kyi phyogs kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs mi dge ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: de la byang chub kyi phyogs kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs mi dge ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: The unfavorable factors of the factors of enlightenment are the nonvirtuous factors, etc.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa ni 'khor ba'i phyogs nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa ni 'khor ba'i phyogs nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the thoroughly afflicted is the side of cyclic existence.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa byang chub kyi phyogs rnams ni rnam par byang ba yin te /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa byang chub kyi phyogs rnams ni rnam par byang ba yin te /
translated: The factors of enlightenment, such as the applications of mindfulness, are the pure factors.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i phyogs nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i phyogs nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are the side of nirvana.

original: mngon pa'i nga rgyal can kun du rmongs pa zhes bya ba ni reg pa'i skye mched drug yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du khong du chud pa mi shes pa gang yin pa zhes smras pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: mngon pa'i nga rgyal can kun du rmongs pa zhes bya ba ni reg pa'i skye mched drug yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du khong du chud pa mi shes pa gang yin pa zhes smras pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: The confusion of the conceited is the ignorance of not knowing the six sense bases just as they are.

original: de mngon pa'i nga rgyal can yin pas de'i phyir mngon pa'i nga rgyal can kun du rmongs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de mngon pa'i nga rgyal can yin pas de'i phyir mngon pa'i nga rgyal can kun du rmongs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because they are conceited, they are called the confused conceited.

original: mi shes pa nas ma rig pa dang mun pa'i bar gyi ma rig pa'i rnam grangs drug po de dag ni kun du rmongs pa'i dngos po bdun yin par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ji ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: mi shes pa nas ma rig pa dang mun pa'i bar gyi ma rig pa'i rnam grangs drug po de dag ni kun du rmongs pa'i dngos po bdun yin par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ji ltar yin zhe na /
translated: The six synonyms for ignorance, from non-knowledge to darkness, are to be known as the seven things that are the basis of confusion.

original: de'i phyir kun du rmongs pa'i dngos po tha ma gnyis gcig tu byas pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba la kun du rmongs pa'i dngos po dang mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi kun du rmongs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir kun du rmongs pa'i dngos po tha ma gnyis gcig tu byas pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba la kun du rmongs pa'i dngos po dang mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi kun du rmongs pa yin no //
translated: The last two things that are the basis of confusion are combined into one, which is the thing that is the basis of confusion about defilement and purification and the confusion of over-evaluation.

original: de'i phyir bsam pa mi shes pas na /
analyzed: de'i phyir bsam pa mi shes pas na /
translated: Therefore, because of not knowing the intention,

original: der ma rig pa dang mun pa'i rnam pa'i rnam grangs gnyis yin par blta bar @100a * //üîΩbya'o zhes bya ste /
analyzed: der ma rig pa dang mun pa'i rnam pa'i rnam grangs gnyis yin par blta bar @100a * // bya'o zhes bya ste /
translated: the two synonyms of ignorance and darkness are to be seen as two.

original: kun du rmongs pa'i dngos po de'i nang du de dag gang yin pa gcig tu bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: kun du rmongs pa'i dngos po de'i nang du de dag gang yin pa gcig tu bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that they are combined into one in the seven things that are the basis of confusion.

original: de ltar byas na dus la kun du rmongs pa ni mi shes pa'i sgras bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar byas na dus la kun du rmongs pa ni mi shes pa'i sgras bstan to //
translated: Thus, confusion about time is indicated by the word non-knowledge.

original: dngos po la kun du rmongs pa ni mi mthong ba'i sgras so //
analyzed: dngos po la kun du rmongs pa ni mi mthong ba'i sgras so //
translated: Delusion about things is indicated by the word ‚Äúnot seeing.‚Äù

original: 'pho ba la kun du rmongs pa ni mngon par mi rtogs pa'i sgras so //
analyzed: 'pho ba la kun du rmongs pa ni mngon par mi rtogs pa'i sgras so //
translated: Delusion about transmigration is indicated by the word ‚Äúnot comprehending.‚Äù

original: mchog la kun du rmongs pa ni rmongs pa'i sgras so //
analyzed: mchog la kun du rmongs pa ni rmongs pa'i sgras so //
translated: Delusion about the supreme is indicated by the word ‚Äúdelusion.‚Äù

original: de kho na nyid la rmongs pa ni kun du rmongs pa'i sgras so //
analyzed: de kho na nyid la rmongs pa ni kun du rmongs pa'i sgras so //
translated: Delusion about reality is indicated by the word ‚Äúdeluded.‚Äù

original: kun du nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba la kun du rmongs pa dang mngon pa'i nga rgyal can gyi kun du rmongs ba ni ma rig pa dang mun pa'i rnam pa'i sgra yin te /
analyzed: kun du nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba la kun du rmongs pa dang mngon pa'i nga rgyal can gyi kun du rmongs ba ni ma rig pa dang mun pa'i rnam pa'i sgra yin te /
translated: Delusion about defilement and purification and the delusion of the conceited are indicated by the words ‚Äúignorance‚Äù and ‚Äúdarkness.‚Äù

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'dir rnam grangs gnyis gcig tu byas pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'dir rnam grangs gnyis gcig tu byas pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, these two synonyms are combined into one.

original: rnam grangs gzhan yang mnyan pa dang bsams pa dang zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni mnyan pa dang / bsams pa dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab rnams kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni rnam grangs gsum go rims bzhin du mi shes pa dang mi mthong ba dang mngon par mi rtogs pa zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan yang mnyan pa dang bsams pa dang zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni mnyan pa dang / bsams pa dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab rnams kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni rnam grangs gsum go rims bzhin du mi shes pa dang mi mthong ba dang mngon par mi rtogs pa zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Another explanation: the three categories of the wisdom that arises from hearing, reflection, and cultivation are, respectively, ignorance, non-vision, and non-realization.üîΩThey are also three, because they are distinguished as small, medium, and great.

original: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa de dag ni chung du dang 'bring dang chen po'i bye brag yin pa'i phyir gzhan yang gsum mo zhes bya ba ni rmongs pa dang / kun du rmongs pa dang / ma rig pa dang mun pa'i rnam pa zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa de dag ni chung du dang 'bring dang chen po'i bye brag yin pa'i phyir gzhan yang gsum mo zhes bya ba ni rmongs pa dang / kun du rmongs pa dang / ma rig pa dang mun pa'i rnam pa zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: Ignorance, delusion, and darkness are the three categories of the obscurations that are adverse to the wisdom that arises from hearing, etc.

original: chung du gang yin pa de ni rmongs pa'i sgras bstan to //
analyzed: chung du gang yin pa de ni rmongs pa'i sgras bstan to //
translated: The small is taught by the word delusion.

original: 'bring gang yin pa de ni kun du rmongs pa'i sgras so //
analyzed: 'bring gang yin pa de ni kun du rmongs pa'i sgras so //
translated: The medium is taught by the word delusion.üîΩThe great is taught by the word darkness.

original: chen po gang yin pa de ni ma rig pa dang mun pa'i rnam pa'i sgras so //
analyzed: chen po gang yin pa de ni ma rig pa dang mun pa'i rnam pa'i sgras so //
translated: The great one is the word for the form of nescience and darkness.

original: 'di ltar rmongs pa'i tshe ni ma nges pa cung zad cig mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar rmongs pa'i tshe ni ma nges pa cung zad cig mthong ngo //
translated: Thus, when there is delusion, one sees something indefinite.

original: kun du rmongs pas ni phyin ci log tu mthong ngo //
analyzed: kun du rmongs pas ni phyin ci log tu mthong ngo //
translated: When there is complete delusion, one sees in a distorted way.

original: mun pa'i rnam bas ni ci yang mi mthong ste /
analyzed: mun pa'i rnam bas ni ci yang mi mthong ste /
translated: When there is the form of darkness, one does not see anything at all.

original: mun pa'i rnam pa bzhin du byed pa ni mun pa bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mun pa'i rnam pa bzhin du byed pa ni mun pa bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The form of darkness is like darkness because it acts like darkness.üîΩIt should be understood that there are six synonyms by way of the differentiation of the adverse elements and by way of the differentiation of the natures.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs rab tu dbye ba dang / ngo bo nyid rab tu dbye bas kyang rnam grangs drug yin par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba de la mi mthun pa'i phyogs rab tu dbye ba ni mnyan pa dang bsams pa dang bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin pa'i phyir
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs rab tu dbye ba dang / ngo bo nyid rab tu dbye bas kyang rnam grangs drug yin par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba de la mi mthun pa'i phyogs rab tu dbye ba ni mnyan pa dang bsams pa dang bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin pa'i phyir
translated: The differentiation of the adverse elements is that it is the adverse element of the wisdom that arises from listening, reflection, and meditative development.

original: ro // ngo bo nyid rab tu dbye ba ni chung du dang 'bring dang chen po'i bye brag gis so //
analyzed: ro // ngo bo nyid rab tu dbye ba ni chung du dang 'bring dang chen po'i bye brag gis so //
translated: The differentiation of the natures is due to the distinctions of the small, middling, and great.

original: dang po bye brag rnam par 'byed pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs las kyang zhes rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: dang po bye brag rnam par 'byed pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs las kyang zhes rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: The first is the ignorance that is the cause of generosity, which is the basis for engaging in all aspects.

original: rnam pa thams cad du 'jug pa'i rten sbyin pa'i las can gyi ma rig pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du 'jug pa'i rten sbyin pa'i las can gyi ma rig pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The ignorance that is the cause of generosity, which is the basis for engaging in all aspects, is called the ignorance that is the cause of generosity, which is the basis for engaging in all aspects.

original: rnam pa @100b thams cad du zhes bya ba ni rnam pa kun du'o //
analyzed: rnam pa @100b thams cad du zhes bya ba ni rnam pa kun du'o //
translated: All aspects means in every way.

original: 'jug pa ni 'od ba dang 'gro ba'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa ni 'od ba dang 'gro ba'i dngos po'o //
